loans.name: Creciendo Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.en:
Colacina S. is the group coordinator for the Creciendo Hacia el Futuro Bank of Hope. The loan will be divided among the nine people in the group, who run various businesses.

Colacina has three children. She operates a grocery store. She plans to use her portion of the loan to restock her grocery. She wants to expand her business and increase her daily profits. Thank you for your interest in this group!

loans.use: To restock a grocery store

loans.name: Mr. Chey Ket Village Bank Group

texts.en:
14 people living in Spean Dek village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan. Mr. Chey K., the 32 year-old village bank president is a motor taxi driver. Aside frO. this career, he is a rice miller who owns a small rice mill. His wife, Mrs. Oeurn Saren, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Chey K. is applying for a loan to increase her savings so that she can buy a piece of land to cultivate rice and earn more income. He is the father of four children, two of whO. are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. 

Six members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice to increase rice revenue.

loans.name: Phach

texts.en:
C. is 22 years old and a resident of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is married to Sokleng, 29, who earns a living by working as a local construction worker. C. has been a local farmer for more than 3 years, and earns a good income of $5 per day. She always sells her rice in bulk three times per year for a good price to the customer.

C. plans to reduce her family's expenses for farming. She is tired of hiring her neighbor's oxen to plow her farmland. So C. is requesting a loan to buy a pair of oxen for her farmland. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: Buy a pair of oxen to plow the farmland

loans.name: Simaya

texts.en:
Simaya K. is currently in the business of selling beans, onions, tomatoes, etc., and is requesting a loan to build a shop.

Simaya is 37 years old and is married with a husband that is a chief. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба- женщина 42 лет,замужем, имеет двоих детей.Её муж на заработках в России. Сама Махбуба занимается бизнесом продажи сухофруктов,курага, изюм,мендаль арахис,и.т.д. У неё дети учатся в средней школе.Махбуба закупает товар у поставщиков, которые её привозят сами.Она торгует на рынке Костакоза.Соседи по бизнесу посоветовали ей попробовать увеличить свой бизнес в кредит, для чего она и обратилась в Микроинвест.При мониторинге было выявлено, что у неё стабильная торговля и постоянный поток клиентов.Махбуба подходит по критериям программы Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is a 42-year-old woman, and married with two children. Her husband is away working in Russia. Mahbuba herself runs a business selling dried fruit, dried apricots, almonds, and peanuts, et cetera. Her children are enrolled in secondary school. Mahbuba purchases goods from suppliers, who deliver them to her. She sells her wares at the Kostakoz market. Neighboring business people counseled her to take out a loan to try increasing her inventory, and she has applied to MicroInvest for that purpose. When we visited, it was clear that she has a stable business and a steady stream of customers. Mahbuba meets the criteria for MicroInvest's program.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of dried fruit and nuts

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat is 35 years old and married to S.. They have two children. She sells body creams and soap. She travels to Cotonou to purchase body cream and soap to sell in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Saidat hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more body cream and soap to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back her Kiva loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more body cream and soap to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion runs a small business selling fruits and vegetables, and is proud that this business helps her family overcome many of life's hardships. They live in the simple village of Barangay Natappian West Solana, Cagayan. Her husband farms a small rice field, but his earnings were only enough to pay for one semester's education of their children. 

Her strong desire to improve her business has led her to apply for this loan, which she will use to increase her working capital. She is proud that she has been able to give her children an education that will allow them to get good jobs and support their own families. She hopes to expand her business and become an even more successful entrepreneur in the future.

loans.use: To expand her small business

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.en:
Ana is 33 years old and is married to Gustavo Maldonado Palacios, with whom she adopted a child. She works making clothes for men and women, as well as uniforms for school and offices as they are ordered. She has been working in this industry since 2006.

The couple works every day with the three sewing machines they have. The credit will be used for the purchase of fabric for the making of a batch of uniforms for the nursing school, from whom they receive a large amount of orders. Their greatest wish is to expand and improve their workshop with other types of garment-making in order to have a good future and an education for their daughter.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to make uniforms

loans.name: Mario Nelson

texts.es: Mario Nelson L. C. de 45 años reside en Ahuachapán junto a sus dos hijos menores de 12 años y su esposa. Él posee una venta de productos varios como carteras, juguetes, zapatos para niños, ropa, ganchos y colas para el cabello, el tiene ubicada su venta en una de las calles más concurridas de Ahuachapán pero a pesar de esto no siempre es tan favorable la venta debido a que no siempre tiene lo que las personas buscan. Es por esto que Mario solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas lo cual no le sería imposible de alcanzar sin dicho préstamo.
texts.en:
Forty-five year old Mario Nelson L. C. lives in Ahuachapán with his two children under the age of 12 and his wife. He sells various products such as purses, games, children's shoes, clothing, hangers, and barettes. His store is located on one of the busiest streets of Ahuachapán, but, in spite of this, his situation is not very favorable because he doesn't always have what people want. For this reason, Mario is applying for a loan, with which he will purchase goods for his business and increase his sales. Increased sales will not be possible without this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new goods for his business

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
N. Vũ Thị (412040365) is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, N. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. N. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. N. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: used to invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Nueva Integracion Group

texts.es:
La señora Myriam, emprendedora y entusiasta, tiene 28 años de edad, Tiene una hija de 11 años y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Actualmente es la  presidenta de la alcancía comunal “Nueva Integración”, conformada por 10 socios, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades como: venta de ropa,  servicios de enfermería, bodega y una de ellas maneja su mototaxi (con el cual le permite generar ingreso diario para su hogar).

Myriam  trabaja desde hace un año con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad, tiene su negocio de locutorio hace 3 años y  actualmente esta  iniciándose en la  venta de vinos, ya que su novio se dedica a la exportación de vinos.
Con su parte del préstamo grupal, comprara vinos y tarjetas para su locutorio, el cual le permitirá mantener y hacer crecer su negocio, contribuir a mejorar la calidad educativa de su hija, ampliar su negocio de vinos, y  poder así mas adelante llegar a  comprarse su terreno.
texts.en:
Sra. Myriam is a 28 year old enthusiastic businesswoman and has an 11 year old daughter. She completed her high school education. She is currently the president of the communal bank “Nueva Integración” (New Integration), which consists of 10 members who engage in different business activities. These include clothing sales, health care, groceries, and one member owns a motor-taxi (which allows generates income on a daily basis). Myriam has been working with EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad for a year. She has been operating a phone center for the past 3 years and has just started selling wine. Her boyfriend is in the wine export business. With her part of this group loan, she will buy wines and calling cards for her phone center. This will help her maintain and grow her phone business, contribute toward a high quality education for her daughter, increase her wine business, and help her buy land in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wines & phone cards

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 58-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mouhamad owns a grocery store. He has requested a loan of $2200 US dollars from Al Majmoua  to purchase merchandise and change his decor. This is his second loan and he has always paid on time. 

His previous loans helped him to diversify his merchandise. Mouhamad is special in his work because he offers a large variety of products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mouhamad first started his business, he had financial issues. He decided to start his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans to expand his store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and change his decor.

loans.name: Ahou

texts.fr: Cette femme est spécialisée dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale à Agoè Démakpoè à Lomé. Elle est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière au foyer. Sa boutique d’alimentation est très visitée par beaucoup de clients de ce quartier très peuplé de Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne le plus souvent au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle vend à la fois en gros et en détail ; sa clientèle est essentiellement composée de revendeuses ambulantes. Actuellement elle veut se lancer dans la vente d’huile, de riz, de couscous et autres. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 bidons d’huile, 05 sacs de riz, 05 sachets de couscous, 02 cartons de lait, 03 sacs de maïs, 15 bouteilles d’eau minérale Voltic et différents cartons de savons de toilette. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2005 et compte sur sa longue expérience pour vite rembourser ce prêt.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Heidi Joy

texts.en:
Heidi Joy A. is from the village of P-3, Brgy. 25, Pandan Gingoog City. She is 27-years-old. Heidi Joy is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Heidi Joy owns and operates a food stall.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community like grilled pork, chicken parts, and a variety of snacks. Heidi Joy is just starting this business.

Heidi Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Heidi Joy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de los Ángeles M. Ramírez tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y junto a su pareja tienen 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de Doña Maria es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, inicio aplicando los conocimientos de venta por lo que ella vendía cebollas, tomates y golosinas. Los propósitos de Doña Maria son de incrementar su negocio ya que así podría abastecer la demanda de sus clientes. El financiamiento es solicitado para la compra de materia prima. Sus sueños son de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles M. Ramírez is 39 years old, she is married and together she and her partner care for three sons. Doña Maria’s economic activity involves running a general store. She has been dedicated to this business for more than six years. She began by applying her sales knowledge, through which she sold onions, tomatoes, and candies. Doña Maria’s goal is to grow her business in order to meet the demand from her customers. She seeks funding in order to purchase raw materials. Her dream is to improve the conditions of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Najjanakubbi J Lidia Mulindwa Group

texts.en: Lidia M. is 36 years old, married with two children in school and also has two dependents in school. She has traded in used shoes for 13 years. She has been suffering from less capital and could not find any one to help her out. She is requesting a loan to purchase used shoes for sale. She wants to add to her business. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase used shoes for sale.

loans.name: Eco Andino Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, “Alto Lima” se encuentra una de las Asociaciones antiguas de Pro Mujer “Eco Andino”, con aproximadamente 14 años de vida, cuenta con 12 integrantes. Su presidenta es Albertina Y. que se dedica a la artesanía confeccionando presentes nativos como llama, casina, pueblo y otros  en bastidores o telares, cuenta que inicio su negocio hace aproximadamente 20 años pero en los últimos años ha bajado su producción porque no encuentra mercado donde acomodar sus productos, entonces está solicitando es un monto bajo y en esta oportunidad necesita el préstamo para comprar lana, a futuro ella quiere cambiar de negocio. Las demás integrantes del grupo tambien tienen diferententes negocios como la venta de verduras, api, atención de tienda, confección de ropa y tejido de chompa. Necesitan el préstamo  para comprar insumos, materia prima y mercadería.
texts.en:
In Pro Mujer's Focal Center "Alto Lima", one of its older groups "Eco Andino" is found. It has been in existence for approximately 14 years and has 12 members. Its president is Albertina Y. who makes traditional handicrafts featuring scenes of villages, llamas, etc., on a loom or frame. She says that she started her business about 20 years ago but in recent years her production has decreased because she isn't able to find a market in which to put up her products. So she is requesting a small loan to buy wool. In the future she would like to change businesses. The rest of the members of the group also have different businesses such as selling vegetables, running a store, clothes making, and sweater making. They need the loan to purchase foods, raw materials, and merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase foods, raw materials, and merchandise

loans.name: Obéissance Plus Group

texts.fr:
Tshibangu K. 50 ans, est dirigeant d’un groupe des micro-entrepreneurs dénommé « Obéissance Plus». Il est composé de 33 membres solidaires qui ont besoin des microcrédits de la part des prêteurs du monde à travers Kiva et l’IMF HOPE RDC dans le but de développer leurs affaires. 
Tshibangu vend des bijoux et autres articles divers dans un marché situé au sud-ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Il est micro entrepreneur depuis 1990 et a acquit une solide expérience dans ce domaine. Tshibangu est client fidèle qui a obtenu 5 fois les crédits chez l’IMF HOPE RDC et les a remboursés correctement. Actuellement, son activité lui génère un bénéfice de $150 par semaine. Il compte avec le prochain prêt acheter les bijoux et autres articles à revendre pour renforcer le capital. Son ambition est d’épargner beaucoup afin de faire face aux moments difficiles dans l’avenir. Tshibangu est marié et père de 3 enfants âgés de 12 à 17 ans. Tous vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Tshibangu K., aged 50, is the leader of a group of micro-entrepreneurs called "Obéissance Plus".  It is composed in solidarity of 33 members who have a need for micro-loans from the lenders of the world via Kiva and the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC.  The goal of the members is to develop their businesses.  Tshibangu sells jewelry and a variety of other items at a marketplace located southwest of the city of Kinshasa.  He has been a micro-entrepreneur since 1990 and has acquired solid experience in this domain.  He is a loyal client who has obtained a loan five times with HOPE RDC, and he has repaid them properly.  Right now, his business generates a profit of $150 for him per week.  He intends to use the next loan to buy jewelry and other goods to sell in order to bolster his capital.  His ambition is to save a lot of money for coping with hard times in the future.  He is married and the father of three children, ages 12 to 17 years.  They all go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry and a variety of items to sell for bolstering his capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase office and school equipment

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas D. C. is from the village of Cabaruan. He is 58 years old. Nicolas is married. To make a living, Nicolas owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing electrical repairs in the local community. Nicolas has been engaged in his business for several years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nicolas joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicolas is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nicolas from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Pavlo

texts.en:
Pavlo is married with no children yet. He sells baked goods in Khoost town as well as in other small neighboring towns and villages. His family started this business four years ago. They make the bakery items and then sell it both in bulk and at retail. Pavlo is an honest and hardworking person.

Pavlo would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase the assortment of his products. He hopes to open another retail business location to increase profits.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Каюмова Жумагул проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 47 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Каюмова Жумагул животноводством занимается более 20 лет. Она откармливает и продает крупно- рогатый скот. В этом ей помогает муж. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Jumagul K. lives in the J. Rumy district. She is 47 years old, married and has 2 children. Jumagul has been involved in animal husbandry for over 20 years. She raises and sells cattle. Her husband helps her with this business. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: P. Dinusha

texts.en:
Dinusha is a 24-year-old woman living with her husband along with their only daughter.

Dinusha and her husband started a small masonry goods supply business but they don’t have enough capital to run the business effectively. So Dinusha plans to borrow some money and expand the business. By doing this, they will be able to earn some more money for their small family.

loans.use: To buy stone, bricks, cement and steel rods

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeun S. is a 51-year-old married woman who lives in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Moe Mil, are farmers who own a one-hectare field to grow rice. They face a problem because their field does not have enough water and is far from the irrigation system. Mrs. Khoeun S. decided to ask for a loan to dig a well to support her farming. Mrs. Khoeun S. is the mother of four children. One of the children is a laborer, two are students in the local school and the last one is a farmer who helps her parents on the farm. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To dig a well

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy tiene 27 años, es un joven emprendedor que está casado con Lupe de 20 años, con quien tiene 2 pequeños hijos; ellos viven en su casa propia, donde además instalaron un vivero de plantas de café para obtener ingresos económicos adicionales luego de venderlos.

Consiente de que los cuidados que le brinda a sus cultivos serán decisivos para buenos resultados, Freddy desde tempranas horas de la mañana, con su machete en mano, se dirige a cuidar sus plantaciones de café, plátanos, yuca y palta. Mientras él se enrumba al trabajo de campo, su esposa se queda en casa atendiendo a sus hijos, a quienes desean brindarle más comodidades, por eso lleva 6 años dedicado a la agricultura que le ha generado buenas satisfacciones, por lo que considera rentable su oficio.
Lo que más le gusta es observar sus sembríos limpios, libres de maleza, insectos y algunos roedores; asimismo para más adelante guarda la esperanza de poder reabrir su tienda de comestibles, el cual administraba su pareja y de donde tranquilamente cubrían los gastos domésticos, logrando ahorrar todo el dinero de la producción agrícola para adquirir más bienes.                 

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y como es una persona responsable que se ganó la confianza de su banco comunal, lidera al grupo haciendo cumplir las normas fielmente, por lo que están mejor organizados y muy felices porque son un ejemplo a seguir.   

Con los dos mil soles que solicita pretende invertirlo en acopiar los granos de café para venderlos en grandes cantidades, con estas ganancias adquirirá productos comestibles para implementar la tienda que volverá a abrir.
texts.en:
Freddy is 27 years old. He is a young entrepreneur who is married to Lupe, who is 20 years old. They have two young children and live in their own home where they have established a coffee nursery so that they could obtain additional income from their sales.

Freddy is aware that the care he provides to his crops is crucial to obtaining good results. Beginning in the early morning hours, with machete in hand, Freddy goes out to inspect his fields of coffee, bananas, cassava, and avocado. While he wanders across his farm, his wife stays at home to look after their children. He has been farming for six years and it has provided him great satisfaction since he considers it to be a profitable livelihood. What he enjoys most is keeping his crops free of weeds, insects, and a few rodents. Sometime later, he would like to reopen the grocery store that he and his wife managed so that they can peacefully cover their household expenses. This will allow them to save the money earned from their agricultural production so that they can acquire more property.

This is his second loan with MFP. Freddy is a responsible person who has earned the trust of his Communal Bank and leads his group in enforcing the rules fairly so that they are better organized. They are happy because he is an example to follow. With the loan of 2000 PEN that he requested, he will invest in the gathering of coffee beans to sell in large quantities. With the earnings, he will acquire food products needed to reopen his grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay to gather coffee beans

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: El señor Marcelino Padrón es casado con la señora Nicolasa y son un matrimonio unido y establecido, viven solitos ya que sus hijos están casados; el labora para una empresa de venta de libros y realiza gestiones de cobranza, además cuenta con un ingreso extra ya que tiene un negocio propio donde realiza productos de herrería tales como puertas, portones,ventanas, etc. el señor Marcelino es un cliente distinguido de nuestra institución ya que anteriormente se le otorgo un crédito para la compra de material para su negocio y nuevamente esta solicitando para invertir en el mediante la compra de pintura y acabados.
texts.en:
Marcelino Padrón is married to Nicolasa in a united and stable relationship. They live alone as their children are all married. Marcelino works at a bookstore where he negotiates payments. He also has his own business making products from iron, such as doors, gates, windows, etc. Marcelino is a distinguished client of FVP, having a prior loan for the purchase of materials for his business. With this loan, Marcelino will buy paint and finishes.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials for blacksmith shop

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is a 30-year-old married lady with one child.  Her husband is employed as a driver and they both work hard to meet their family’s needs. 

Cicilia is glad to be involved in a group called Neges within Faulu Kenya because she can save money on weekly basis.  She joined this group to easily access financial resources from Faulu Kenya--group members guarantee each other when a member takes out a loan.

For two years, Cicilia has sold second-hand clothes, and she hopes to enlarge the business into a wholesale in the future.  She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Yamileth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Yamileth es una mujer trabajadora, madre de tres hijos, tiene la edad de 35 años y junto con su esposo trabajan para lograr las mejoras de su casa. El trabaja como conductor de cabezal y viaja mucho. Doña Yamileth desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Ya que se afilio con la zermat y vende sus productos por catálogos, da al crédito y cada día adquiere clientes el cual para ella es de muchas ganancias. 
Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción  como piedra, arena, piedrin, cemento para hacer la tapa al sumidero y levantarlo para lograr una mejor higiene,  ya que lo tiene tapado solo con zinc  y de mucho peligro para su familia  Sus planes es seguir en el comercio y de esta forma generar ingresos que beneficien en lo personal
texts.en:
Doña Yamileth is a hardworking woman and a 35 year old mother of three children. She and her husband work together to make improvements to her home. Her husband is a truck driver by profession and travels frequently. Doña Yamileth has been selling clothing and cosmetics for several years. Since she is affiliated with the Zermat brand, she sells their products through a catalog. She offers her products on credit and acquires customers each day so that she can generate good earnings.

With this loan she will buy construction materials such as stone, sand, gravel, and cement in order to build a cover for her sewage drain that will provide more hygienic conditions. At the moment it is covered with sheets of zinc, which makes it dangerous for her family. Doña Yamileth plans to continue with her business so that she can generate income that benefits her personally.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a cover for a sewage drain

loans.name: Kishwar's Group

texts.en:
Kishwar is the wife of Y. and a resident of the Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She owns a small, two-roomed house where she has lived with her family for over 15 years. 
Kishwar is a very caring lady who stays at home, manages the household chores, and prepares food for her family. Her husband is a vegetable vendor. He purchases vegetables in bulk from the vegetable market and sells them in various places in the community and also to vegetable shops to earn a profit. Kishwar is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase seasonal vegetables in bulk and expand his business. They hope to earn profit from this loan so that they can open their own vegetable shop and have their own customers.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables in bulk to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Hagra

texts.en: Hagra B. is divorced and has three children. Hagra prepares fante kenkey to sell at Abura. She has been through junior high school. She has been in her kenkey business for 12 years. Hagra single handedly takes care of her children. She is going to use the loan she hopes to receive to purchase bags of corn to prepare kenkey to sell. With the earnings from her expanded business, Hagra plans to save to build a small kiosk for her kenkey business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of corn to prepare kenkey

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Florencia is a busy entrepreneur who is engaged in dual businesses of computer rentals and billiard games in her family's barangay (village). These businesses allow her to save money and to sustain her family’s basic needs. They want to save towards retirement time of their life in the future and have a happy family to live with. Now on her second loan, she has applied for PHP 10,000.00 for the maintenance of her businesses. In the future, Florencia hopes to establish new billiard games and to buy an additional computer machine. Her dreams are to provide a better future for her family and to sustain the profitability of her businesses. Through hard work, Florencia is focused on improving her quality of life through her entrepreneurial initiatives and support from kindhearted Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: The loan fund will be used for the maintenance of her businesses.

loans.name: Varnette Venture #4 Group

texts.en:
Annie O. (who is holding the sign) is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Varnette Venture #4. She is 42 years old, married and has four children who range from 1 to 14 years old. She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to a lack of financial support. Annie cares for one sibling.

For 3 years, she has been operating a mini restaurant in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cooking oil, fish, meat, rice etc. She describes herself as a caring mother. Her goal is to improve her business, build a house and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, fish, meat, rice etc.

loans.name: Los Emprendedores I Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Donatila tienen 52 años, tiene dos hijos mayores D. edad. Ella es socia del grupo "Los Emprendedores I" formado por 9 personas muy emprendedoras tal y como dice su nombre, sus compañeros la eligieron como secretaria D. actas del grupo.

Hace 18 años, la Sra. Donatila incursionó en las ventas, inició vendiendo especerías en un mercado D. comas, le iba bien, pero a raíz que se le manifestó una alergia producida por la manipulación del ají tuvo que cambiar D. giro, es así que inicia su negocio D. venta D. pollo.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo ella ha podido solventar los gastos D. estudio D. sus hijos logrando que sean profesionales.

El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. mayor cantidad D. pollo para aumentar su venta.
texts.en:
Donatila, 52, has two adult children. She is a member of the “Los Emprendedores” (The Entrepreneurs) communal bank which has 9 very enterprising members, as their name attests. Her fellow group members elected her Recording Secretary. Donatila went into sales 18 years ago. She stared out selling spices in one of Comas’ markets. She did well but developed an allergy from handling hot peppers so she had to change her occupation. This is how she got into chicken sales. Thanks to her hard work and effort she has been able to pay for her children’s education leading to their becoming professionals. The requested funds will be used to buy larger amounts of chicken in order to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy larger amounts of chicken.

loans.name: Layne Marita

texts.es:
Layne tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su unico hijo en el caserío Tejedores Bajo del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, un área productora de frutas para exportación perteneciente a la provincia de Piura y ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella es maestra de profesión y con mucho esfuerzo pudo ahorrar dinero durante los años que tiene trabajando para adquirir un vehiculo de segunda mano con el cual brinda servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros cubriendo la ruta Tambogrande – Cruceta, el vehículo es manejado por su menor hijo y con los ingresos que perciben de esta actividad ambos mantienen su economía diaria.

Layne desea adquirir un juego de llantas para hacer que su vehículo pueda funcionar de mejor manera ya que debido al constante uso sus llantas actuales se encuentran deterioradas, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solictar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Layne es una madre bastante luchadora y que gusta mucho de la labor que realiza, en la zona donde vive  es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos y amigos.
texts.en:
Layne is 47 years old, a single woman, and lives with her only son in the Tejedores Bajo village in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an area producing export fruit, within the Piura province. It is located in the the Piura region, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. She is a teacher by profession and with much effort managed to save money during the years she has been working in order to get a used vehicle which she uses for her cargo and passenger transportation service. Her service covers the route from Tambogrande to Cruceta. The vehicle is driven by her youngest child and with the income that they receive from this business, both are able to support their daily lives. Layne would like to buy a new set of tires so that her vehicle can work better. Due to its constant use, its current tires are in bad condition. In order to do this, she is applying for a loan of 1200 soles for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa. Layne is a hardworking mother who very much likes the work that she does. She is quite well known in the area that she lives in and is respected by her neighbors and friends.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new tires for the maintenance of the vehicle she uses for cargo and passenger transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beauty salon products

loans.name: Alba María

texts.es:
La Sta. Alba María es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, Barrio San José, tiene 20 años de edad, y con un hijo menor de edad.
     
Ella comenta que desde los 15 años empezó a trabajar como ayudante de una peluquería la cual le sirvió mucho como aprendizaje empírico, luego con su ingreso fue realizando compras a cuotas de algunos elementos más necesarios de peluquería pensando en tener lo que hoy en día ya pudo lograr, su propia peluquería, que gracias a su sacrificio y dedicación ya cuenta con clientela formada y con varios equipos propios.

Agradece a Fundación Paraguaya y kiva por la oportunidad de préstamo que le otorga para así aumentar día a día su crecimiento profesional, mediante la ampliación del negocio con herramientas que faciliten la atención a la clientela, así como pinturas para cabellos, maquillajes, herramientas de manicuro y pedicura.
texts.en:
Alba Maria is from the town of Carapeguá, San José district. She is 20 years old and has a young son. She tells us that she started working as a salon assistant at 15 years of age. That served her as practical experience. She started buying basic salon tools in installments with her income thinking about having her own salon which is a reality today. Thanks to her sacrifice and dedication she has an established clientele and many equipment of her own. She thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity to receive a loan to promote her professional growth day by day. This will be possible by increasing her business through purchasing tools to facilitate caring for her clients such as hair color, make up, manicure and pedicure equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of salon tools and materials, such as hair color, make up, etc.

loans.name: Hajaratu

texts.en: Hajaratu I. is a palm oil extractor at Abura. She has received junior high education. Hajaratu is married to a farmer and has eight dependents. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase more palm fruits to process oil to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to use the new profit to educate her dependents.

loans.use: purchase more palm fruits to process into oil

loans.name: Night

texts.en: Night N., 20 years old, married, is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home.  She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal for sale.  Her husband works as a driver.   With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en: Tsetsgee D. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son currently works and lives in Korea, her middle son works as a private businessman, and her two younger children both attend a local high school. Her husband is a carpenter and produces a variety of wood products in his town. Tsetsgee operates a business selling children's toys with the help of her sister. She began her business in 2000 and has gained significant experience and many permanent customers as well. She sells a variety of children's toys that are imported from China. Tsetsgee's dream is to continue growing and expanding her business and to save money for her children's future educational costs. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT in order to import a large amount of  children's toys from China to sell.

loans.use: To import a large amount of children's toys

loans.name: Villa

texts.en:
Villa V. is from the village of Upper Salug Dako, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. She is 52 years old. Villa is an individual member of PMPC. Villa is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Villa owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from her daughter. 

Villa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Villa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Villa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Villa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: additional capital for sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 53 years old. He is married and a father of three children.

Muhammad has good experience in the running his business. He opened a minimarket to sell groceries and fulfill the market needs in his area and he maintains a good reputation there.

He is requesting a $2700 loan to install a new door and set up a solid entrance for his store. His aim in the long term is to develop his project and expand later on.

loans.use: To install a new door and set up a solid entrance for his store

loans.name: Gorden

texts.en: Thirty-five-year-old M. Gorden got involved in his current banana sells trade in Kanywambogo-Ibanda through savings from his earlier agro produce and retail trades. This business has now lasted a decade. He mostly relies on harvests from his own gardens. The happily married father of 5 says he has steadily been making progress in regards to establishing a strong footing and position for his business in the local markets. He says this business generates him 220,000 UGX monthly and with this loan, he is anticipating purchasing more farm inputs.

loans.use: The purchase of more farm inputs

loans.name: Maida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ÑAUPASUNCHIS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maida; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia tiene un taller de artesanía donde hace diferentes trabajos como mantas, collares, pulseras y trabajos en arcilla, por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.                           
                          
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maida is a member of the “ÑAUPASUNCHIS” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Maida is 38 years old, single and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling handicrafts.  She has a craft workshop where she makes different items such as blankets, necklaces, bracelets and pottery.  Through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Maida would like to expand and improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy handicrafts wholesale.

Maida is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts wholesale

loans.name: Islomjon

texts.en:
Islomjon K. is married with six children. He lives in Isfara in Tajikistan.

Islomjon has been in a manufacturing business for 33 years. He takes an individual approach to each client, helping with color, shape and configuration. Little competition and good quality work have resulted in good profits for Islomjon and much positive feedback from his clients.

Islomjon is requesting a loan of 7500 TJS. The loan will allow him to purchase necessary materials, provide his customers with trendy and modern products, and increase the assortment of inventory he offers to his clients. Islomjon takes his loan liabilities very seriously.

About Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich place in history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the farthest reach of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

About IMON:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials for his manufacturing needs

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Меликбоева Зарина проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 41 год. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж находится в России. Сама Зарина имеет средне - специальное образование. Она медсестра. По специальности проработала пять лет. На сегодняшний день она занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Zarina M. lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 41 years old, married and has 5 children.  Her husband is in Russia.  Zarina has a secondary-specialized education.  She is a nurse and spent five years working in that field.  Today, she is involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds livestock at home.  Zarina has been involved in this business for over 10 years.  She breeds livestock for future sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Marylene

texts.en:
Marylene C. is from the village of Villaluz, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Marylene is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marylene owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food products in the local community. Marylene has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marylene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marylene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marylene is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Marylene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana M. is 53 years old and married to M. who contributes to the family income. She has been running her food nutrition service for a period of two years with an income of KES. 17,000 per month. 


She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD,which she  intends to use to buy more stock of food supplements and herbal medicines for sale. 

She hopes to grow her business and in future  buy a vehicle that will help her transport her products  to the market place.

loans.use: to buy stock of food supplements and herbal medicines

loans.name: Bokoli Plus Group

texts.en:
Mado T. is a chairwoman of a Community bank, named “Bokoli Plus”. The group is composed of 14 microentrepreneurs jointly united to receive loans from Kiva, through IMF HOPE RDC, with the goal of developing their businesses.

Mado started has been in business since 1980 selling slippers. Today, she operates a general store and she also sells charcoal. She is 56 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 14 and 33. One of her children still goes to school. Her store has prospered, thanks to Hope’s loans. With the profit of about $20 earned per day, she increased her working capital. Currently, Mado is happy to be part of one of MFI Hope’s groups.  She joined the group in 2009 and her business has been reinforced through the eleven loans she received from MFI Hope DRC. She has repaid each loan properly. With the next loan, she intends to diversify her business by purchasing some crates of soft drinks and other items in order to increase the profits. Her dream is to open a larger store. Her business is located in the western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of the store in order to reinforce the working capital.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 41 years old and married, with 6 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Marites sells all his catch to the market. She also makes and sells dried fish.

Marites has requested a loan to purchase a pump boat. She hopes that her family's business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase a pump boat

loans.name: Myrian

texts.es:
Myrian tiene 48 años de edad, está casada con el señor Héctor Vargas quien es mecánico-tornero y le ayuda con  los gastos del hogar, vino a Carapeguá  hace más de 20 años. Tienen cinco hijos, a quienes han criado con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Myrian se dedica al ramo de la despensa desde hace más de 20 años. Cuando su marido y ella se mudaron a la ciudad, su esposo era el único que generaba ingresos por que se dedica a la mecánica de automóvil y con un pequeño capital que había juntado pudieron montar dicha actividad. Hoy día ambos generan ingresos y aportan a la canasta familiar.
Actualmente posee clientela formada, pues su negocio está ubicado cerca de una fábrica de cueros en donde hay varios empleados, la mayoría clientes que compran en su negocio.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderias como fideos, galletas, gaseosas, arroz y otros.
texts.en:
Myrian is a 48-year-old woman who is married to Mr. Hector Vargas, a lathe operator who helps with the household expenses. She came to Carapeguá over 20 years ago. They have 5 children whom they have raised with much work and sacrifice.

Myrian has been running a general store for over 20 years. When she and her husband moved to the city, her husband was the only one who earned a living; he is an auto mechanic. With a bit of capital that they had saved, they were able to set up this business. Today, they both earn an income and contribute to the family expenses.

She currently has a solid client-base since her business is located near a leather factory with many workers, the majority of whom shop at her store.

She needs this loan in order to purchase goods such as noodles, cookies, soft drinks, rice, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as noodles, cookies, soft drinks, rice, and other products.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida K. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.    

Aida has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Aida has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap.      

She also generates additional income through rental rooms. Her goal and aspiration is to own a wholesale shop. Aida lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es: El señor Calixto trabaja como profesor rural y su esposa es productora lechera  y sus hijos colaboran con actividades agrícolas. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera para mejorar su producción de leche e incrementar sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chahuira Pampa del departamento de La Paz; es casado y  tiene dos hijos. Este es su primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Señor Calixto works as a rural teacher, and his wife produces dairy products. Their children help with the agricultural activities. He needs the loan to purchase a dairy cow to improve their production of milk and increase their income. He lives in his own house located in the town of Chahuira Pampa in the department of La Paz. He is married and has two children. This is his first loan with Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow  to improve their milk production.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 42 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells different kinds of baked breads, oils, soap and some daily needs of her co-villagers. Amelita has had this business for almost 17 years. According to her, she would like to expand her store to generate more income. Aside from expanding her store, she aims to buy more products needed within the village. 

Amelita is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, sugar and coffee. Each month, Amelita earns about PHP 4,000 doing this business.

In the future, Amelita hopes to maintain and expand her business for her to continue to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Xocotitlan Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Xocotitlan" ya que ese es el nombre del municipio en el que habitan y se sienten orgullosas, esta ubicado en el estado de México. Es un lugar de oportunidades ya que al ser municipio hay visita de personas de diferentes comunidades. El grupo esta conformado por 9 personas. La tesorera del grupo se llama Ana tiene 2 hijos estudio hasta la Secundaria, es casada, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y tiene un negocio establecido de abarrotes. El prestamo lo solicitá para la compra de articulos como lo son (refrescos, jugos, jabon entre otros), ya que ha tenido un incremento en sus ventas gracias al buen servicio que brinda se ha ganado la amistad y preferensia de sus vecinos de la comunidad. Al momento de solicitar el prestamo se siente satisfecha por el buen desempeño de su grupo y porque en conjunto con su esposo van a seguir trabajando para darle a sus hijos un buen futuro y una base para que ellos puedan ser independientes y logren una carrera profesional.
texts.en: This group is named "Xocotitlan", since this is the name of the town where it is and its members are proud of it. It is in the state of Mexico. This is a place of opportunity since people from different communities visit the town. The group is made up of 9 people. The treasurer of this group is named Ana, and she has 2 children. She studied through high school and is married. She sells groceries and has a small grocery store. She has asked for the loan to buy items such as sodas, juice, and soap, among others. She has had an increase in sales because she offers good service and has earned the friendship and preference of the residents of her community. At this time, she feels satisfied by her group's hard work and because together with her husband she is going to keep working to give their children a good future and a base for them to be independent and have professional careers.

loans.use: to buy items such as sodas, juice and soap, among others, for her convenience store.

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es:
Luis, es empleado, vive con su madre y su esposa, la casa es de su mamá, él trabaja en una caja de crédito, desde hace 7 años, pero también es carpintero, elabora los fines de semana muebles.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de pega, madera de diferentes tipos, con esta compra tiene la posibilidad de fabricar mueble, que le generan un dinero extra, contando con suficiente material para su ejecución. Luis quiere conservar el trabajo pero también crecer con su negocio de la carpintería, ya que esto le abrirá las puertas para comercializar a más personas y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis has been employed at a credit union for seven years. He and his wife live at his mother’s house. Luis is also a carpenter who makes furniture on the weekends.

He is requesting a loan to buy adhesives and different types of wood. With this purchase, he will have enough materials on hand to make furniture so that he can earn extra money. Luis wants to keep his job, but he also wants to grow his carpentry business. By keeping his doors open, he will be able to sell to more people and generate a better income.

loans.use: to purchase adhesives and different types of wood.

loans.name: Amahl

texts.en:
Amal is a 55-year-old married woman from Gaza Strip in Palestine. She is a mother of two sons, Tamer and Samer. Amal has a woman's accessories shop and she wants to increase its income. Therefore, she took out a loan from FATEN in the amount of $2,000. Amal started her shop one year ago. She is becoming known in Gaza city because of her wide variety of accessories and the good reputation she is building.

Amal is a conservative woman, as are most of Gaza Strip inhabitants. Therefore, her husband Musaed is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase a large variety of accessories to sell

loans.name: Gleen

texts.en: Gleen, 42-year-old married father of nine children, lives in the Philippines where, for the last five years, he has owned and operated a meat shop selling meat  pork and chicken. A member of HSPFI since 2009, he has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy pigs to be butchered. In the future, Gleen hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs to be butchered.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, vive con su hijo de 7 años de edad, tiene casa propia, lleva tres años dedicándose al negocio, lo aprendió por una amiga quien influyo para que se motivara a instalar el negocio.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de perfumes, talcos, labiales y maquillajes, con esta inversión podrá diversificar la mercadería para generar más ventas a los clientes.
Su objetivo es mantenerse en el trabajo, proveer a su hijo todo lo necesario para que pueda crecer y desarrollarse en la sociedad.
texts.en:
María works selling beauty products.  She lives with her 7 year old son, and has her own home.  She has spent three years in this business, which she learned from a friend who influenced her and motivated her to start up the business.

She is currently applying for a loan to buy perfumes, powders, lipstick and makeup; with this investment she will be able to diversify her merchandise to generate more sales to her customers.

Her goal is to continue with her work, and provide her child with everything needed to grow and develop in society.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, powders, lipstick and makeup.

loans.name: Ghanem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has four children.

Ghanem is an owner of a shop selling clothes and fabrics since 2002.  He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation; and he has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, floor and walls, to make a sliding door and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, floor and walls, to make a sliding door and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 29 years old. As her source of income, she has engaged herself in a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been doing this for two years and earns an average of 4,000 PHP every month which she uses for daily expenses such as food.

She is requesting a loan amount of 9,000 PHP to buy sugar, cooking oil, coffee and vinegar as additional goods to her store. She hopes these goods will contribute a higher income for the betterment of her business. She is working hard as a store owner for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, coffee and vinegar

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 56 years old and she has been widowed for almost 10 years. She has to generate income and provide sustenance for her two children. But due to he expensive cost of studies, her eldest child had to stop from going to college and Mely felt guilty about it. 

Mely has been selling fruits and vegetables, particularly bananas, to the people in the village for almost 20 years. She offers it house to house. She usually earns P200 a day, but it is not enough to cover her family's daily consumption. 

She is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy bananas, eggplants and tomatoes to sell in the village and increase her earnings. In the future, Mely would like to improve her sales and save for the college education of her children so they have a degree and good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy bananas, eggplants and tomatoes to sell in the village

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Floriana has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Floriana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Floriana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is married with 2 child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

She has a motorcycle repair shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional tools and equipment for her repair shop.

In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough money so she could send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and equipment for her repair shop.

loans.name: Ner

texts.en:
Ner, age 55, is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $3 per day. They have three children: one is studying and other two are working in a factory, each earning $3 per day. Every month, Ner has to spend $70 on food and $12 on school fees. 

She would like to request a loan in the amount of $700 in order to buy a motorbike for her son to use for traveling to and from work, as well as to provide transportation for the family. She also wants to buy a stock of rice to sell when a good price is available.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to use for traveling to and from work, as well as to provide transportation for the family

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
This is Charlita, 47, a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Raul, an instructor, and they have six children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Charlita operates a salon business. She offers hair styling, hair grooming, manicure, pedicure, and the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 21,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for her salon like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Charlita hopes her business will continue over the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for salon materials and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa, 54, is married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Felisa has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Felisa aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lei

texts.en:
Lei, age 40, is married and has four children. One of her children is working at a rice field. To earn a living, she has been farming a rice field for 20 years in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district. She also plants cassava to generate additional income. She can earn approximately two dollars per day to feed her family. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy cassava trees and pay for laborers for her plantation. With this loan, she hopes to grow more cassava and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy cassava trees for planting

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Bonna

texts.en:
Bonna is 30 years old and is a married woman with a two-year-old child. She has had a sari-sari store business, or convenience store, for six months. Bonna sells items like bread, water, and canned goods. She earns 4,000 PHP per month with her business.

Bonna is requesting a loan to buy materials for store renovation, such as wood, cement, and nails. Bonna hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy materials for store renovation, such as wood, cement, and nails.

loans.name: Gnemogognouma. Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe GNEMOGOGNOUMA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne  39  ans,  3 enfants et qui vivent  majoritairement dans des  familles monogamiques à FAMA, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
DIARA, assise  la main dans le panier, vend les condiments  dans ce groupe de femmes GNEMOGOGNOUMA. Il ya environ 2 ans et jouis d’une grande notoriété à la matière.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt: 2 paniers de tomates fraiches;  3 boîtes de tomates concentrés,1sac de 25kg de sel gemme et 3 paquets poivres. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville les jour de foire.
Elle les revend au  dans le même marché et en famille à une, en détail à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the GNEMOGOGNOUMA group are essentially married women who have an average age of 39; an average of 3 children; and who, for the most part, live in monogamous families in FAMA, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso. 

This is the group’s tenth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution that they'll use to satisfy the needs of their customers.

DIARA, seated, with her hand in the basket, has been selling condiments in the GNEMOGOGNOUMA women’s group for 2 years. She benefits from a lot of notoriety in this domain.

With this loan, she plans on buying: 2 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 3 boxes of tomato puree, one 25kg bag of rock salt, and 3 bags of pepper. 

She buys her supplies in the grand market of Sikasso on market days, and resells her products in the market and out of her home. She sells her products for cash by the unit and at retail to a clientele of men and women.

She plans on earning an average monthly profit of 22,500 FCFA - some of which will be used to pay her loan and its interest, and the rest of which will be used for savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 37 year-old business lady in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She is married and has been in the grocery business for the past eleven years with great success. 

This is her first loan with KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more kales, bananas, tomatoes, cabbages and carrots. Her group Uwezo Self Help Group meets once a week and the photo was taken during one of the group meetings. Judith hopes to use the anticipated profits to repay back her loan and to expand her business further. 

She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more kale, bananas, tomatoes, cabbages, and carrots

loans.name: Force De Jésus Group

texts.fr: FORCE DE JÉSUS est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Léa  (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 32 ans. Léa a très peu fréquenté l'école. Léa est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Valère. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Léa vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Léa vend du riz, du haricot, de l'huile végétale et des condiments par la méthode de distribution depuis seize ans. Léa s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Léa sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe FORCE DE JÉSUS, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du riz, du haricot, de l'huile végétale et des condiments

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Working in the field is one of the most difficult jobs nowadays because of the great effort needed to make progress. However, Simon is a man who has never given up in spite of any circumstances that occur. He is always ready to get resources for his family. He gets up at the first hour in the morning in order to tend to his business of keeping his donkey, and raising and selling poultry and vegetables, as well as some personal business he engages in to supplement the meager income he earns. Simon is seeking a loan to purchase modern farming implements. He realized that he is working increasingly longer and harder on his farm. The workmen in the area are currently doing tasks on the farm previously performed by women. They have been forced to take over as their wives are left at home doing household chores. Therefore, the tools the men use are of great importance for improving productivity and yields, and reducing time and physical effort. There are health implications as well in using poor traditional tools. The increased income from the use of better tools will help him meet business related expenses. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Simon replied, "I will be able to educate my children."

loans.use: to buy modern farming equipment.

loans.name: Marie Dieumercie

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans, Dieumercie  est une commerçante pleine d’ambitions et très déterminée à améliorer sa situation financière. Elle est dans la revente de vêtements neufs et usagés depuis bientôt dix ans. Elle cherche un prêt pour acheter un nouveau stock de vêtements neufs à l’occasion des fêtes de fin d’année.

loans.use: acheter un nouveau stock de vêtements neufs

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad borrowed the loan amount two time. For the first time he borrowed the $600 and built the grocery store. The second time he borrowed $800 and bought the foodstuffs: rice, flour and etc. 
Now he needs the loan $1000 to expand the area of his grocery store to increase the products. He has been engaged in this business for 5 year.
He and his family lives in Salyan region Kardilli village. He is 33, has 2 children.

loans.use: To expand the area of his business and to buy the foodstuffs: rice, flour and etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: R. is a 22-year-old mother with one kid. Before she joined MBK, her husband, Endang, was the only one who worked in her family. Since she has joined MBK as a member, she has started a business by  selling household goods at her small kiosk. She sells snacks, cigarettes, soaps, shampoo, etc. She earns nearly $8 per day. She really wants to get a $50 loan to buy more goods for her kiosk. She is willing to repay this loan in a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Small kiosk

loans.name: Victorine

texts.en:
Victorine is 32 years old. She is married to Mr. T. George and has one child. She would like more children, but has had trouble having children. The family has also had to overcome the death of Victorine's brother-in-law. Victorine has benefited from GHAPE loans two times before, and has paid them back in full. She would like this loan to improve her pig farm and her fresh ground nut business.  She knows she will be able to repay this third loan because she has experience in her businesses and she knows there is a ready market. Victorine's farm is also good for the community because it provides employment to those who take care of the pigs. She will save the profit from her businesses and reinvest it so she will have her own capital, and not have to borrow again.

She plans to repay her loan in 18 months.

loans.use: Pig Farming and Fresh Ground Nuts

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
Rohat has been selling children shoes for 7 years. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a worker, but his salary is not enough for supporting the family, so she decided to help her husband.

Rohat’s business is located in the open-air market in Panjshanbe. She brings her goods from Istaravshan’s wholesale market. Rohat usually buys 100-150 pair of children’s shoes every trip. Her son helps her to carry her big bags of shoes.

Rohat became a client of Micro Invest in 2005. Her first loan was $100. She spent her first loan for buying 50 pair of shoes. Gradually she increased the volume of her goods. Today her stall is one of the best-known stalls in the market. She has many clients and she always wants to meet their needs.

Now Rohar wants to rent a trading place for her son. She is requesting $500 for it.

loans.use: Rent a trading place

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more natural products

loans.name: Biser

texts.en: Biser N. gets social benefits because he is a cardiac patient. He is not married but lives with his girlfriend and has two children. In addition to working as a guard in the village school, he breeds geese. He wants to buy some more geese and some corn for them. He is requesting a $750 loan so that he can do this.

loans.use: Purchasing geese and corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of dried fish for re-sale

loans.name: Thi Hien

texts.vi:
