Mrs. Hiền, 32 years old, is married with two children. She’s been serving breakfasts at her food stand for ten years since before she married to her husband. She has never borrowed money from any bank because banks just offer big loans. She would like to apply for a small loan at Binh Minh that she will pay back in small installments. She needs money to replace old tables in the dining room.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hiền, 32 tuổi, đã có chồng và 2 con. Chị làm nghề bán hàng ăn sáng, bán cháo, phở... và bánh mỳ. Chị bán hàng đã được 10 năm nay từ khi còn là con gái. Mặc dù là bán hàng ăn sáng nhưng chị thường phải chuẩn bị từ rất sớm. Chị chưa tham gia vay vốn ở đâu vì các Ngân hàng chỉ cho vay với số lượng lớn, chị thích vay theo chương trình Tài chính vi mô bình minh cdc vì được trả dần. Chị vay để mua thêm một số bàn ăn mới vì nó đã quá cũ rồi.

loans.use: Replace dining tables in food stand

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso P. is a young father at the age of thirty two. He is happily married to his wife Teresa and together they have 2 children. He spent a lot time in Argentina as a driver and after he managed to save enough money he returned to Paraguay. When Celso returned, he opened a shop with some telephones and sold their services. He then increased his goods to include newspapers and books, and now his shop sells food merchandise, too.

Celso wants to open his own grocery store eventually. He will use this loan to continue expanding the products sold and will continue to save his earnings for a larger grocery store.

loans.use: To buy food merchandise like rice, pasta, oil, milk, eggs, cookies, soda, sugar, along with telephone cards.

loans.name: Budumbuli West F C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zelidah N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items. Zelidah is 39 years old and is divorced. She has 5 children ranging from ages 8 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Zelidah makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children and save the rest. Zelidah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her retail shop and the loan was paid back on time.

Zelidah is joined in her small group by Beth N. and Halimah N.. Beth N. has a business running a retail shop and wants to add more stock. Halimah N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and dairy sales and wants a loan to buy a commercial motorcycle.

loans.use: To increase stock in retail shop

loans.name: Marllory

texts.es:
Señora Marllory belongs to the communal bank called Comunal Indo America located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She's 25 years old and she has one son. Her husband is a salesman. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, Marllory decided to open up her own business making and selling Mapachos (which are cigarettes used for medicinal purposes).

She's currently making and selling Mapachos for home remedies. She starts her day at 7:00 in the morning to prepare breakfast for her family and then she solely concentrates on making Mapachos until 10:00 in the evening.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase tabbaco, etc. Marllory is very happy because she's now able to provide for her family and this makes her very proud. She's very thankful for all the support she gets from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marllory pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en el Jr Asentamiento Humano Barrio Unido, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es comerciante. Marllory con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de preparación y venta de mapachos. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de preparación de cigarros mapachos esto para las curaciones caseras del lugar, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la preparación de sus cigarros mapacho hasta las 10 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: cigarros artesanales, 1 ciento de mazorcas de tabaco, etc. Marllory esta muy feliz, por que puede apoyar en los gastos familiares esto le hace estar llena de orgullo, ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make cigarettes called Mapachos which are used for medicinal purposes

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha S. is thirty-two years old. She is married and the mother of three children who are all currently in school. Martha is an important part of her family because she provides food and helps to pay family bills. She is a member of a community group called Quality Trust Group. Members guarantee one another's loans as social collateral.  Martha is a trader and sells all kinds of underwear, napkins, diapers, bed spreads, towels and other goods by traveling around and offering her goods to strangers. However, her business is constrained by a lack of access to capital. Martha therefore wants a loan of $225 to buy a larger stock of goods, which will allow her to make increased sales. This she believes will help her raise money to build a container shop to ease the drudgery of hawking to strangers.

loans.use: To increase the stock of underwear, bed spreads, napkins, diapers, etc.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Born January 1, 1976 in Lomé, Mr Kossi A. is married to Mrs. Hodalo Kabissa, who is a hairdresser. He is the father of 7 children, all of whom are at school. In 2005 he opened a pork butcher’s shop called “Cachez Regardez” in Lomé’s Akodessewa neighborhood. This type of business is usually run by women. However, Mr A. runs it with passion and also greets customers enthusiastically. His business consists of buying pigs, firewood and the necessary condiments for the cooking process. At the moment he is welcoming a lot of customers and it is only his resources that prevent him from satisfying them. This first loan he is requesting will therefore enable him to buy 10 pigs and some firewood.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 1er janvier 1976 à Lomé, Monsieur A. Kossi a pour épouse dame KABISSA Hodalo qui est une coiffeuse. Il est père de 7 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. En 2005, il a crée une charcuterie « CACHEZ REGARDEZ » dans le quartier d’Akodessewa à Lomé. Généralement ce genre d’activité est exercé par les femmes. Pourtant Monsieur A. Kossi l’exerce avec passion et accueille aussi les clients avec enthousiasme. Son activité consiste à acheter les porcs, le bois de chauffe, et les condiments nécessaires afin de passer à la cuisson. Dans ces temps-ci, il accueille beaucoup de clients et seul ces ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. Ainsi ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 porcs et des bois de chauffe.

loans.use: To buy 10 pigs and firewood

loans.name: Chinkiry

texts.en:
Mr. Chinkiry M. and his wife, Mrs. Sopheak Mak, who live in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1989 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. All of them are in school.

Mr. Chinkiry has been driving a Moto-Remorque taxi (a motorcycle with a trailer at the back) for eighteen years. He carries people and goods from his village to Phnom Penh City. His wife has been a hairdresser for twelve years. His motorcycle is broken now and needs to be exchanged for a new one but he lacks some money to add to his own for buying a new one. So he is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one for running his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace their old one

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Danti

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Danti is a housewife who is diligent and resilient in her efforts to run her stall business. Initially she set up shop in simple surroundings, but now Ni Nyoman Danti is able to situate her stall in a place good enough to run her business properly. Ni Nyoman Danti began this enterprise several years ago, back when she first married her husband, Nengah Sudendra. The shop sells many types of basic consumer needs, such as rice, sugar, light snacks, soap, and other daily necessities.

With the help of a working capital loan entrusted to her by the DINARI Foundation (via the village’s central organization), Ni Nyoman Danti will furnish her business with all the necessary items and increase her wares so selection will be more varied. Ni Nyoman Danti opens her stall at 7am after tending to her children, who are still in elementary school. She then sets out to perform all the routine activities of a housewife, such as cooking, washing, and cleaning the house, in addition to waiting on customers who come to purchase items from her stall. The daily earnings, which reach Rp.20,000-Rp.30,000 (~US $2-3) help sustain the household, because her husband has a modest occupation as a farmer.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Danti adalah sosok ibu rumah tangga yang tekun dan ulet dalam menjalankan usaha warung. Dengan usaha awal hanya berjualan di tempat yang sangat sederhana, kini Ni Nyoman Danti bisa menempati warung yang cukup bagus untuk menjalankan usahanya. Ni Nyoman Danti sudah menjalani usaha ini sejak menikah dengan suaminya, Nengah |Sudendra beberapa tahun yang silam. Berbagai macam kebutuhan pokok dijual seperti beras, gula, makanan ringan, sabun dan kebutuhan pokok lainnya.

Dengan adanya bantuan Pinjaman untuk modal usaha dari yayasan Dinari melalui organisasi didesanya Ni Nyoman Danti mendapat kepercayaan untuk menggunakan modal tersebut sebagai modal usaha untuk melengkapi segala macam keperluan untuk usaha warungnya dan juga memperbanyak dagangannya agar lebih bervariasi. Ni Nyoman Danti membuka warungnya jam 07.00 pagi setelah mengurus anak ketiganya yang masih duduk dibangku sekolah dasar. Setelah itu barulah melakukan segala rutinitas sebagai seorang ibu rumah tangga seperti memasak, mencuci, membersih rumah dan sesekali melayani pembeli yang datang belanja. Dengan keuntungan bersih sehari mencapai Rp. 20.000.- s/d Rp.30.000.- Penghasilan ini mampu menopang perekonomian keluarganya karena suaminya hanya berprofesi sebagi petani.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise so she can increase her stall's inventory and selection

loans.name: Elidia Santa

texts.es:
Elidia, de 37 años de edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Asunción de Carhuaz”, espera tener una tienda de venta de regalos en Carhuaz para poder mantener mejor a sus dos hijos, ya que su conviviente gana muy poco en los trabajos temporales que tiene.

Elidia vende abarrotes en una tiendita al frente del Hospital de Carhuaz, en el Jr.  Unión 230 en el departamento de Ancash. Los días viernes lleva productos a la capital (Lima) donde vende de manera ambulatoria y es en estos días que sus hijos se encargan del negocio.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,700, el cual pagará en 8 meses, comprará 2 sacos de arroz , 2 sacos de azúcar y también lo invertirá en comprar productos de la zona para llevar a la ciudad de Lima.
texts.en:
Elidia is 37 years old and is a member of the comunal bank “Virgen de Asunción de Carhuaz.” Her hope is to have a gifts store in Carhuaz in order to better support her children since her partner does not earn much in his seasonal jobs.

Elidia sells groceries in a small store facing the Carhuaz hospital. On Fridays, when she travels to Lima to sell her products as a street vendor, her children take care of the business.

With this loan of $575 - which she will pay in eight months - she will purchase two sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar and she will also invest in purchasing products to sell in Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Sabohat.

texts.ru: Шарофова Сабохат жительница города Нурек. Не замужем . Живет с родителями . Зарабатывает деньги путем ведения бизнеса. Имеет торговую точку на рынке , куда ввозит промышленные товары из города Душанбе. Занимается этим бизнесом уже  четыре года. Ее дело помогает ей обеспечивать родителей и себя. Но для того , чтобы увеличить доход , она планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sabohat S. lives in Nurek. She is single, lives with her parents and earns her living in a private enterprise. Sabohat has a retail outlet at a market and brings her products from Dushanbe. She has been in this business for 4 years. It is this business that helps support her and her parents. In order to increase profits, Sabohat plans to obtain a loan and broaden the goods assortment. She will be able to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: El señor Juan José Cuaresma tiene la edad de 65  habita en el barrio Pablo Calero junto a su esposa, este señor tiene hijos pero todos están casados y le ayudan .Don cuaresma desde hace 40 años trabaja como agricultor, el solicita el monto de C$ 6,000.00 córdobas para comprar insumos y tener una producción buena y así poder vender a un mejor precio la piña .Este señor con sus propios y el financiamiento de AFODENIC a logrado mantener su producción.
texts.en:
Juan José Cuaresma is 65 years old and lives in the Pablo Calero neighborhood with his wife. He has children, all of whom are married and help him. For 40 years, Don Cuaresma has worked as a farmer. He requests a loan of $325 to purchase supplies that will enable him to have a good crop and sell his pineapples at a better price. With his own savings and funding from AFODENIC, he has managed to maintain his output.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pesticides and fertilizers for crops

loans.name: Donatila

texts.es:
La señora Donatila, socia del Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Rioja. Se dedica a  la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa y de manera  ambulatoria visita a sus amigas y pueblos cercanos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará ropa para damas como polos, blusas, pantalones, ropa para niños y niñas, para poder atender los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes quienes son la razón de su negocio. Quiere aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.

Donatila tiene  36 años de edad, vive con su hija y su esposo quien la apoya en sus proyectos. Su meta es contar con un local en el centro de la ciudad para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Donatila is a member of the La Mujer Riojana (the Riojan Woman) Village Bank, and lives in the Rioja district of the San Martín province. She makes her living selling clothing for women, men, and children. Her business is located in her home, and she takes her cart to friends in nearby villages. With her loan of 1,500 Soles, which she will repay in 6 months, Donatila will buy clothing for women, including polo shirts, blouses, and pants, and clothing for boys and girls, so she can meet the demands of her customers, who are the reason she is in business. She hopes to take advantage of the Christmas season. Donatila is 36-years-old and lives with her daughter and with her husband, who supports her in her projects. Her goal is to have a shop downtown where she can offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of polo shirts, blouses, pants, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Mutaramkhon

texts.en:
V. Mutaramkhon is an enterprising woman with a big desire for improving the quality of life of her family.  She is married with 3 children. 

Two years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances.  She began this business because she did not have a job and she needed to find an activity so that she could support her husband with family expenses.  She works in tailoring shop where she produces national dresses for women. 

Now, all of her children are going to school.  She wishes that her children will be able to continue their education.  That is the reason why she needs to continue growing her business. 

She asks for a loan of $600 USD that will be invested in buying supplies to increase her production and cover her customers' demands.  She commits herself to return back the amount in 12 months.  Please help this family to improve their quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Mutaramkhon’s business.  They will sincerely thank you for it.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.  

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  

While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.  Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.  To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing women's national dresses.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Sixto tiene 46 años, es casado hace 14 años y tiene su casa en un pueblo de nombre Cumutay, lugar apropiado y cercano a sus terrenos de cultivo; tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales viven con ellos solo dos de ellos ayudándoles en los trabajos de la chacra. Sus actividades agrícolas se inician a las 5.00am cuando empieza a sacar la yerba y a realizar los surcos para que pueda sembrar, después a eso de las 8.00am regresa a su casa para desayunar y luego regresa nuevamente a la chacra para culminar la faena. Mientras que su esposa va detrás de él con sus vacas y demás animales llevando el almuerzo, con esta labor pudo educar a sus hijos que ahora viven en diferentes ciudades y se siente muy orgulloso de ellos. En esta temporada está sembrando arvejas de una bolsa y media de semilla llamada “súper mejorada” que es resistente a la humedad, el próximo mes sembrará otra cantidad similar, pero otro tipo de semilla. Este método lo utiliza con la finalidad de que constantemente tenga para cosechar y no le falta dinero, así siempre esté cosechando. Cuando no hay mucho trabajo en el campo, Sixto realiza trabajos de albañilería; como por ejemplo construir casas de adobe, este trabajo generalmente se presentan a partir de junio hasta setiembre, por en esta temporada la lluvia no le permite avanzar en la construcción. Es su tercer préstamo con MFP, con el cargo de presidente de su banco comunal ha trabajado con mucha responsabilidad haciendo que todos los socios paguen en las fechas designadas, producto de ello el grupo no ha caído en morosidad. Con el dinero solicitado comprará semillas de arvejas, cada bolsa cuesta 600 soles, y con lo que resta comprará insecticidas para el fumigado.
texts.en:
Sixto is 46 years old, has been married for 14 years, and lives in a town name Cumutay which is close to his farmlands. He has 6 children, two of whom still live with him and help with the crops. His work begins at 5 am, at which time he removes the grass and starts his planting areas. After this work is complete, he returns to his house at 8 am to eat breakfast, then returns to the farm again to complete his tasks. His wife follows with his cows and other animals, bringing him lunch. Through these labors, he was able to educate his children who now live in other cities; he is very proud of them. During the current season, he is planting 1 ½ bags of pea seeds called “Super Improved” which are resistant to humidity. He will plant about the same quantity next month, but from a different type of seed. He uses this staggered technique so he will continually have a harvest and, as a result, a more consistent level of income. When there is not much farm work to be done, Sixto works in construction. He builds adobe homes, for example, from the months of June through September. This is his third loan with MFP and, under the directive of the president of his cooperative bank, he works very responsibly to make sure all members make their payments on the designated date. As a result of these efforts, the group has not fallen into delinquency. With the funds he is requesting he will purchase pea seeds that cost 600.00 Peruvian soles per bag, and he will use the remaining funds to buy insecticides to fumigate his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Sanovbar

texts.en:
Sanovbar is a lovely 56-year-old woman who lives with her three children.  She runs a small fabric selling business at the market where she offers a variety types of fabrics for different tastes and ages.  

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of goods.  The extra capital will enable her to expand her merchandise and, thus, improve her business and increase her profits. 

Her dreams are to have her own large store one day—but most importantly, enable her children to have a better future, one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals, and lead healthy and comfortable lives.  On behalf of Sanovbar and everyone here at IMON International, thank you for your support!
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. 

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.  Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.  

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: M. is 39 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He has four children: the first one, female, works in the garment factory, and the other three attend school. He is married to Pov, 37, who works in the garment factory and earns a salary of $80. M. is a motor taxi driver for more than two years. He is famous for his good and polite service. M. spends time taking his daughter and Pov to work and back home which always interrupted his business and sometimes his daughter and his wife need to take a other motor taxi to work. He gets up every early morning taking his clients to work and back home. Recently, M. is looking for a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for his daughter and his wife as a mean to work. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his daughter and his wife as a mean to work

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace D. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil and is requesting a loan to build a shop. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

Grace is 30 years old and is married with a husband that is a teacher. She has three children and her children go to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано женщина, которая кредитуется в Микроинвест с 2007 года.Она продаёт на рынке г.Худжанда, мужскую одежду. За товаром она ездит в Бишкек на частном такси. раз в неделю.Она использует свой займ для увеличения своего товарооборота.Рано по бизнесу помогает её муж. Кроме этого он работает мастером по ремонту мобильных телефонов.У неё среднее семейное положение.Она хочет потратить кредит для завоза товаров весенних мужских футболок.Рано благодарна за возможность в кредит увеличить свой оборот товаров.
texts.en:
Rano is a woman who has been a loan client of MicroInvest since 2007. She sells men's clothing at the Khujand city market, but goes to Bishkek once a week in a private taxi for her goods. She uses her loan to increase turnover. Rano's husband assists her in the business, and additionally works as a mobile telephone repairman. Rano finished secondary school, and has a family. She wants to spend this loan on men's t-shirts for spring. Rano is grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan to increase the turnover of goods.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of men's clothing

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is a hair stylist and she also sells drinks and hair extensions. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 140,000 (USD 975) to purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell. Kehinde is 47 years old, married and she has four children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda hopes to start a hog-raising business and is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to start up the business. She already has a pigpen but due to lack of capital she couldn’t buy any piglets to raise. She is hoping that Kiva Lenders will give her the opportunity to develop her hog-raising business so that she may help her husband earn a living. She wants to prepare for the future education of their children. She hopes that they will be able to finish college someday but she will have to save a lot of money for that dream to be realized. She just hopes that she will be given the chance to have the business that someday will expand and provide a large income.

Yolanda is 38 years old and married to Policarpio A.. They are blessed with two children; her elder Jayvee is 19 years old, and Rustom is 13 years old. Yolanda hopes to give them both the best education she can so that they may have a better future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana A. is 37 years old. She is divorced and has four children – all girls. All her children are currently in school. Some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Juliana works very hard to provide for the family. She runs a grocery store in her community. Her shop is on one of the streets. She buys the groceries from Accra and other big shops in her community. Juliana says she also sells textile materials. 
She has been in business for over 13 years, and she wants a loan buy provisions in bulk so she can increase her stock. Juliana is hopeful to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia B. is from Oroquieta City. She is 51 years old. Lilia's business is in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Lili has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Lili from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow sweet potatoes

loans.name: Joelor

texts.en:
Joelor V.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 42 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the city of Dapitan. Joelor has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Joelor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Joelor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Joelor is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This will be her eighth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products

loans.name: Aurora Flavia

texts.es:
La señora Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres progresivas”, ubicado en la el distrito de Asillo, provincia de Azangaro, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera y es madre de 02 hijos, ella estudio educación secundaria completa.  Vive en la Comunidad de Santa Cruz.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para la comprar de  ganado menor (ovinos).

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella comprará ganado menor (ovinos) para engorde.  Aurora los compra y vende en las ferias de ganado de la región.

Su deseo es darles una profesión a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los encuentros y las reuniones entre Bancos Comunales.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos

loans.name: Arly Antonio

texts.es: El señor Arly P. de 34 años de edad, tiene una pequeña fábrica textil desde hace dos años, el trabajaba en la zona franca en mecánica industrial, sus planes era poder tener su propio negocio ya que el salario es bajo y mucho lo que se trabaja. Reside en la comarca Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua, junto a su esposa que le tiene tres hijos de 7,9 y 11 años de edad, los cuales están en la  escuelita del barrio. Ella es costurera y junto a el se apoyan para cada día poder lograr sus objetivos, con este crédito es para comprar una maquina de coser industrial para seguir con el proceso de su negocio. Con esto espera incrementar más negocio, vender más, y seguir adelante,  después comprara otra maquina cover industrial y poder tener las herramientas necesarias para su costura. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Arly P., is 34 years old, and since two years ago he owns a little textile factory. He works in the zona franca** in industrial mechanics. He plans to have his own business since his salary is too low and work is hard. He lives in the Sabana Grande region in the capital, Managua, with his wife and three children who are 7, 9 and 11 and go to a local school. Mr. P. and his wife, who is a seamstress, rely on each other so that each day they can accomplish their goals. With this loan they will buy an industrial sewing machine to continue with the development of their business. With it, he hopes to boost more business, sell more and persevere. Later he will buy another industrial sewing machine and have the necessary tools for sewing. He is thankful to Kiva partner, Afodenic, for the opportunity to expand his business. **Translator's note: The Zona Franca is a governmental organization that regulates exportation from Nicaragua. See www.cnzf.gob.ni for more info (in Spanish). Taken from Olivia Engkvist.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en:
Quirina is 49 years old and she is married to Nicanor and they were blessed with two children: their children are both college graduates and they are now working as domestic helpers.  The eldest is in Canada while the youngest is in Dubai. Quirina and her husband were currently residing at Barangay Barangcuag Angadanan, Isabela. 

She manages a general store for almost ten years.  Her store has become their partner in supporting the financial needs of their children when they were studying.  At the moment, her store is now their sole source of income to support their daily needs at home since their two children is working miles away from them. She is requesting to avail the amount of PHP17, 000 as additional capital for the improvement of her business. She wanted her business to expand more and yield bigger income. On the other hand, their two children abroad sometimes sends them money remittances but Quirina and husband though the couple did not want to expect remittances from them because they will also soon have their own families to prepare for.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Jessica Carolina

texts.es:
la joven Jessica M. tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de el cual depende de ella a un 100%. Jessica se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal como ser cremas, lociones, perfumes, carteras, monederos, ropa interior de dama, trajesitos para niños.
ahora tiene poco tiempo con su negocio ya que hace poco empezo pero le estan saliendo bien las cosas, ya que vende bastante, pero a veces se queda sin mercaderia por falta de capital, el cual necesita para ir a comprar al por mayor y asi tener variedad de productos ya que sus clientes son bien exigentes.
Jessica necesita el credito para poder salir adelante con su hijo, este es su unico trabajo, tiene mucho espiritu de superacion.
su meta es poder tener una tienda en la cual venda muchos productos y asi tener muchas ganancias y darle una buena vida a su hijo que es lo mas importante para ella.

loans.use: compra de cremas, perfumes, carteras, monederos, blummers, trajes de niño

loans.name: Grace Makonjo

texts.en:
Grace is married to Festus. They have three children: Mathew (22 years old), Hellen (18) and Maureen (13).

Grace has been in the beauty salon business for six years. She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET through existing clients, and has no previous credit history. She services the residents of the estate where the salon is located.

Grace will use her loan to purchase a blow dryer for her salon. With the extra profits she earns as a result of having this equipment and therefore drawing more customers in, Grace plans to educate her children. In the future, Grace hopes to have a salon with all the necessary equipment and chemicals.  She believes she is determined and focused.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase a blow drying machine for her salon

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert trabaja como agente de seguros en la vitalicia seguros. Y tambien realiza trabajos de contabilidad ya que esta en el último año de contaduría pública.
Vive en la zona de Villa Fatima de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para el pago de matricula y mensualidades en la universidad salesiana.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su responsabilidad y la necesidad que tiene le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Robert works as an insurance agent in annuities. He also does accounting work, as he is in his last year of public accounting studies. He lives with his parents in the Villa Fatima area of the city of La Paz. This loan will be used to pay for monthly tuition fees at the Salesiana University. This is the third time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO. He is given this opportunity to obtain credit because of his need and his responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay school fees

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 42-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Moustafa has been working as a school bus driver since 1996. Moustafa requested this loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his bus and to purchase a car for his wife. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.
Moustafa is special in his work because he is punctual and  trustworthy. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Moustafa decided on doing this business because he wanted to improve his income.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his bus and purchase a car for his wife.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita F. is from the town of Gamu. She is 48 years old. Perlita is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Perlita owns & operates a specialized retail store.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice in the local community. Perlita earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Perlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Porch

texts.en: Mrs. Porch K. lives in Kakaoh village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ngaol Ngen, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice. This couple has three children, one of whom is employed at the Thai border, while another is employed in India, and the remaining is attending the local school. Although this family’s members have differenct careers they don't earn enough income to support their needs. Now Mrs. Porch K. is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for her family. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan H. (pictured here), 51, and her husband, Mr. Heng Hor, 53, live on an island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1979 and have eight children: two sons and six daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, three live at home, and the other three attend school.
Phan raises pigs at home, while her husband constructs wooden houses. Phan is requesting her first loan of $1,200 USD to purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Clarisse Nadine

texts.fr: Née en 1973 à Dassa-Zoumé, dans le département des Collines au Bénin, A. Clarisse Nadine vit depuis 6ans au quartier Hlacomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HOUNNOU K. Pascal avec qui elle vit, Clarisse Nadine est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple se partage les charges de la famille. Pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, Clarisse Nadine vend de la farine de manioc à Tokpa kpodji, marché international du Bénin. C’est à Azovè et Ikpinle, deux marchés de vente de produits vivriers au Bénin que Clarisse Nadine se ravitaille. Clarisse Nadine a déjà quinze ans d’expérience dans l’exercice de son activité mais n’avait encore jamais obtenu de prêt à AlIDé. C’est dans le but d’accroitre son capital et d’élargir son activité que Clarisse Nadine sollicite un prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Dassa-Zoumé, in the Collines department in Bénin, A. Clarisse Nadine has been living for 6 years in the Hlacomey district in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Married to and living with HOUNNOU K. Pascal, Clarisse Nadine is the mother of four children, all enrolled in school. The couple share responsibility for supporting the household.

In order to help with family expenses, Clarisse Nadine sells manioc flour at Tokpa kpodji, international market of Bénin. She buys her inventory at Azovè and Ikpinle, two marketplaces where foodstuffs are sold in Bénin. Clarisse Nadine already has 15 years' experience in her business but has not yet received a loan from ALIDé. She is requesting her first loan from ALIDé with a view to growing her working capital and expanding her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bags of 100 kg of manioc flour

loans.name: Santos Eliezer

texts.es: Santos Eliezer de 32 años de edad es casado, habita en la ciudad de Juigalpa en la casa que le heredaron sus padres a el y sus hermanos junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 2 niños el mayor de 9 años y el menor de 6 años, ambos estudiando la primaria.  Santos labora en el MAGFOR Chontales como Consultor Agropecuario. Ademas tiene una casa fuera de esta ciudad, la cual esta alquilando para recibir ingresos adicionales, a la cual necesita brindarle mayor seguridad, por lo que esta solicitando su 2do credito a esta institucion esperando ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva para poder construir una tapia en su casa, puesto que el patio no esta bien cerrado y los vecinos llegan a botar basura.  El mayor sueño de Santos es poder lograr que su casa pueda tener las condiciones basicas, puesto que es el patrimonio que en un futuro le heredara a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos Eliezer is 32 years old and is married. He lives in the city of Juigalpa, in the house his parents left for him and his brothers, along with his wife and two children. His oldest is 9 and his youngest 6 and they are both in elementary school. Santos works in MAGFOR Chontales as a Farming Consultant. Additionally, he has a house outside of Juigalpa which he is renting to receive extra income. He needs to provide greater safety to the house which is why he is requesting a second loan. He is hoping to receive Kiva funding to build a wall in his house since the yard is not enclosed and neighbors throw away their trash in it. Santos' greatest dream is have the house meet basic conditions as he will leave it for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building of wall

loans.name: Kimteung

texts.en: I. Kimteung, age 53, is married and lives wI. her husband in the Siem Reap province. She stays at home cooking and doing housework. Her husband, pictured here, is a farmer. He grows rice and vegetables to sell at the local market. On average, he is able to make about 4 USD per day. This couple also got support from one child who works as a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh city. I. Kimteung says that she spends about 25 USD on food, 15 USD on utilities, and 15 USD on transportation. Due to the high daily expense, Mrs. I. Kimteung would like to apply for a loan of 1000 USD from Kiva via CREDIT MFI in order to make two investments. She would like to invest 800 USD in raising fish and use the remaining 200 USD to purchase fertilizer for her husband. In the future, her husband wants to purchase another plot of land to expand their cultivation.

loans.use: To raise fish and purhcase fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Zoila

texts.es:
Maria Zoila R. S. tiene 31 años, es casada, y  tiene cinco hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Maria trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, habas, lenteja  y cebada  además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como vacas, gallinas, borregos y chanchos los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Maria le gusta lavar cocinar y coser.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria Zoila R. S. is 31 years old, married and has five children. She lives in the Guaranda district of Bolívar province. She is a member of the Grupo Enmanuel rural credit union, which is located 45 minutes away from Guaranda, the capital of Bolívar province. There are 17 members of the group; it is an agricultural and livestock-farming community of indigenous people who all speak Quechua. Maria works in agriculture in order to increase her family income. The crops that do best are corn, broadbeans, lentils and barley. She also raises domesticated animals such as cattle, chicken, sheep and pigs, which she sells from home and she sells her harvests in the wholesale market of Guaranda every six months. The main cultural activity is carnival, which is celebrated every year in February. Maria also likes to wash, cook and sew. The loan she is requesting is to buy supplies for her work in the fields, mostly for chemical and organic fertilizers. Her goal is to have a good source of income for her family. The challenges she faces are problems due to weather and diseases that affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies.

loans.name: Mayra Estefani

texts.es: La srta. Mayra Estefani S. J. de  19 años de edad, es soltera. Tiene casa propia ubicada en el caserio de la Venta Alta. Trabaja como obrera de campo en empresas agroindustriales. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda ya que se encuentra en construcción. Su sueño es lograr construir toda la vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Senorita Mayra Estefani S. J. is 19 years old and is single. She has her own house located in the little village of Venta Alta. She works as a field worker in agricultural businesses. She is an entrepreneurial person, who succeeded in acquiring her property thanks to her determination. She needs the loan to finish building her house, since it is now under construction. Her dream is to succeed in constructing the whole house, with the goal of attaining a better quality of live. She is very grateful for the support that we can offer her through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her house

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache G. is a vegetable farmer in Majaoni in Mombasa. She is 50 years old. She is married to Rashid and they have four children. Kache also sells firewood from her residence, a business that has been in operation for four years now.

This is Kache's second loan from KADET. With the loan money, she intends to purchase more firewood to resell and vegetables for planting. She mainly serves the residents of Majaoni, most of whom are retailers.

She hopes to expand her farming activities and to increase the scale of her firewood supplies.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and vegetables for planting.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino tiene 41 años, es casado y tienen 5 hijos mayores y 2 hijos en edad escolar. Reside en la localidad de Pichari, ubicada en la ceja de selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

Sus padres fueron toda la vida agricultores, pero él decidió cambiar de actividad, es por ello que tiene un restaurante. Pero no todo fue éxito en su vida, ya que pasó momentos de verdadera angustia económica cuando no le estaba dando resultados su negocio, pero aun así perseveró. Ahora tiene buena cantidad de clientela y por ende, buenas ganancias, por lo que ahora quiere incursionar en la agricultura, específicamente en el cultivo de cacao y café.
Generalmente trabaja junto a su esposa, pero ocasionalmente también recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y su horario de trabajo es de 10:00 AM a 1:00 AM. Sus planes a futuro son de ampliar su negocio teniendo sucursales de su restaurante en otras localidades.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente. Además  tiene un buen concepto de su banco comunal, por la responsabilidad de cada uno de sus socios. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en ampliar y mejorar su local, con el fin de captar mayor clientela y que se sientan más cómodos y satisfechos con la atención.
texts.en:
Paulino is 41 years old, married, and has 5 adult children and 2 school-age children. He lives in Pichari, located in the jungle of Cuzco, where he has his own house. His parents were farmers their whole lives, but he decided to do something else. For this reason he has a restaurant. However, his whole life has not been full of success. He had moments that were truly very difficult economically when his business was not doing well, but he still persevered. Now he has a lot of customers that provide good earnings. Now he wants to begin agricultural work, specifically by farming cocoa and coffee. He normally works with his wife, but his children sometimes help as well. His work schedule is from 10:00 am until 1:00 am. His future plans are to expand his business by having branches of his restaurant in other places.

This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he is committed to making the payments on time. He also has a good understanding of community banks, and of the responsibility required of each of the members. He will use the money to invest in expanding and improving his restaurant, with the goal of attracting more customers so that they feel more comfortable and satisfied with the service.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his restaurant

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik palabra en quechua que significa Nuestra Fuerza. Teodora es soltera, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos.
Teodora vende verduras de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García de Huamanga, esta actividad la realiza todos los días.
Teodora necesita un préstamo de 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras al por mayor para su negocio.
Los sueños de Teodora son que su negocio crezca y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teodora is 40 years old single, and has three children. She is a member of the Kallpanchik (a word that means “Our Strength” in the Quechua language) communal bank and sells vegetables in the Nery García marketplace in Huamanga. She works every day. Teodora needs a loan of 750 PEN ($275) which she will use to buy vegetables in quantity, in order to improve her business. She hopes to grow her business and provide a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Walter Agustin

texts.es:
Walter es casado, tiene 55 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y una de sus tres hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, conocido por ser el distrito mas poblado de la región y también el que tiene mayores indices de pobreza, ubicado 5 minutos del centro de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene 20 años trabajando como transportista, inicialmente alquilaba vehículos para ganarse el sustento familiar, luego pudo comprarse un auto en el año 2006, actualmente utiliza este vehículo como herramienta de trabajo, está asociado a una empresa de taxis que brinda sus servicios a los clientes del centro comercial más grande de la ciudad.

Walter se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1900 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo, ya que debido al continuo uso que le otorga siempre tiene que mantenerlo en buen estado para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Esta es la segunda vez que trabaja con el fondo Kiva y la tercera en que trabaja con Edpyme Alternativa, el se encuentra agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva ya que gracias a ellos puede seguir trabajando en su vehículo sin problemas.

El desea instalar un negocio de comercio en su vivienda para asi poder obtener una fuente adicional de ingresos. Walter es considerado como un cliente excelente por nuestra Institución ya que ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de cancelar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
55-year old Walter is married and lives with his wife and one of their three children in José Leonardo Ortiz district, recognized as the most populated and with the highest levels of poverty in the area. It is located five minutes from the centre of the town of Chiclayo. Walter has worked in transportation for 20 years, firstly renting vehicles to earn his living, and then buying his own car in 2006. Nowadays he uses this vehicle when he drives for the taxi business with which he is associated. He offers his services to customers visiting the biggest mall in the town. Walter is asking Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,900 soles which he is planning to use to maintain his vehicle. As it is in continuous use, he has to keep it in good condition so he can be sure that it will always run well. This is the second time that he has worked with Kiva and the third with Edpyme Alternativa. He is grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to them that he can keep his vehicle well-maintained. He wants to open a business centre in his home and in this way have an additional source of income. He is considered an excellent client by our organization since he has always shown responsibility and punctual repayments of his loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Mrs. Yon S. is a young woman whose husband appears in the photo. They do not have any children and live in a medium-sized home in Kompong Cham Province. Presently, the couple owns a piece of farmland that they inherited many years ago from their grandparents. They use this land to grow different kinds of crops to earn their living. Their current income is not sufficient so Yon S.’s husband wants to sell chopped wood, but he requires some cash and accessories to operate this business. Yon S. has, therefore, decided to borrow $1100 for her husband to use as start-up capital for this new venture.

loans.use: To invest in starting a chopped-wood selling business

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married and has two grown sons. She is a small-market entrepreneur from Berdyansk. She owns a store where she sells women's outerwear. Valentina knows a lot about customer service. She is always polite with her clients which brings them back to her for shopping. Valentina has been in the trade for 12 years. Presently, she has 12,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. 

Valentina is requesting a loan of 18,000 Grivnyas to diversify the assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her vending kiosk. Valentina buys her inventory in Russia. She travels to wholesalers there to purchase quality clothing items and then offers them at reasonable prices in her home town of Berdyansk. 

Valentina is known for her enterprising spirit and professionalism. She is a born entrepreneur who knows how to see her business grow and flourish.

loans.use: To diversify her assorted merchandise

loans.name: G.s. Mi Divino Niño Ii Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Mi Divino Niño II está conformado por Maria Concepción y Nora Yessenia ambas son personas muy responsables y disfrutan de sus actividades. En el caso de Maria se dedica a una pulpería, desde hace más de 12 años, por lo que decide  seguir adelante con esta actividad que es su medio de vida para seguir proporcionando a su familia los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante. En cambio Nora que se dedica a la venta de ropa hace más de 15 años, ya que ha demostrado ser una persona responsable. Pues juntas están solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima e invertir en inventario en sus negocios. Sueñan con mantener estables sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Mi Divino Niño II" consists of Maria Concepción and Nora Yessenia. They are both very responsible people and enjoy their businesses. Maria has been running a grocery store for over 12 years. This is her livelihood and has allowed her to provide her family with the necessary income to get ahead. Nora has been selling clothes for over 15 years and has proven to be a responsible person. Both are requesting this loan to purchase raw materials and to invest in inventory for their businesses. Their dream is to keep their businesses stable.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Dios con nosotros se encuentra en su quinto ciclo de crédito con ADIM y está conformado por Mirna Rosa M. M. de 56 años, Carmelina A. P. de 53 años y Katherin Suyen Alemán Vílchez de 21 años; doña Mirna quien es la coordinadora inició vendiendo comida en el malecón hace 15 años, actualmente se dedica desde su casa a la venta de ropa nueva y usada así como accesorios y zapatos y es ayudada por su esposo y su hija menor.

Carmelina es dueña de una librería desde hace 10 años y Katherin vende ropa usada, helados y leche agria en su casa. Ellas al igual que la coordinadora utilizarán el crédito para agrandar sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The Dios con nosotros solidarity group es currently on it's 5th loan cycle with ADIM and is comprised of Mirna Rosa M. M. who is 56 years old, Carmelina A. P. who is 53 years old and Katherin A. V. who is 21 years old. Mirna, who is the leader of the group, began by selling food in the public market 15 years ago. She currently sells new and used clother from her home as well as accessories and shoes. She gets help with her business from her husband and her youngest daughter. Carmelina has owned a bookstore for the last 10 year and Katherin sells used clothes, ice cream and sour cream from her home. The three members of this group plan to use their loans to expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy K. is 37 and married with five children.  She owns a business venture, selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  Daisy has 3 years of experience in this business.  Daisy needs a loan of WST 2500 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2007, Daisy joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Daisy's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Ra Sok, have been married since 1978 and have five children, two sons and three daughters. One of them is married and lives in a separate home, two have full-time employment, one daughter assists her mother in the business and the youngest attends school. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Srey has been selling vegetables in Phnom Penh market for more than ten years. She has asked for a Kiva loan one time already. She is now asking for another loan of $300 to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.es: Feliza tiene 58 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Feliza se dedica a varias actividades que le aseguran un ingreso económico estable todos los meses, siendo la agricultura la actividad principalmente que se dedica, mientras espera la cosecha, venD. animales que cría en su establo. Pero desD. hace 2 años el comercio D. productos agrícolas como fertilizantes y D. otros productos tiene mucha demanda, es por eso que se dedica a esta labor, ofreciendo a sus clientes los productos que tiene y los venD. al contado, por otro lado sus animales los venD. D. acuerdo a la necesidad D. dinero que tiene  y una vez llegada  la cosecha tiene  más trabajo por hacer, por lo que generalmente requiere D. la ayuda D. sus hijos o D. peones que contrata para que le faciliten el trabajo. Feliza se siente muy contenta D. ver que sus actividades son rentables por tal motivo ha decidido crecer más en su negocio. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen D. su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más sacos D. abono al por mayor que utilizará tanto para su negocio como parar sembrar en sus propios terrenos D. cultivo.
texts.en:
Feliza, 58, lives with her two children in her own house. She is engaged in several activities that assure stable monthly income. Her main activity is farming. While she awaits harvest, however, she sells animals that she raises in her stable. Since about two years ago, the sale of farming supplies like fertilizers and other products has had much demand. For this reason she is in this business too, offering to sell her customers products she has for cash. On the other hand, she sells her animals according to her financial needs. Once harvest time arrives she has more work to do so she needs help from her children or from laborers she hires to make the job easier. Feliza is very content because her activities are profitable so she has decided to expand her business. This is her first loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial help because they know she is a responsible person with respect to repayments. Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because she knows all the members and they are responsible and mutually supportive. She is grateful to all those who will fund the loan she is requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested loan to buy more sacks of manure at wholesale that she will use both for her business and on her own farmlands.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Mujeres Soñadoras (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Soñadoras está formado por 9 mujeres que viven en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta es la tercera ciudad  más importante del Ecuador. su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones,  es muy amable y cordial al igual que nuestras socias, quienes son mujeres trabajadoras que están en la lucha para lograr sus objetivos que es mejorar la economía de sus hogares.

La Señora Ana C. vive por el sector de Medio Ejido en la ciudad de Cuenca, este es  el primer  crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, fue invitada por una amiga.  
Nuestra socia tiene de 24 años,  es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo esta estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Doña Ana hace 6 meses se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos Yanbal y Avon,  labora todo el tiempo que le sea posible sin descuidar su casa y a su familia.
Su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de mas cosméticos como son perfumes, cremas etc.
Su meta es llegar a comprarse un vehiculo.
 
La Señora Ruth vive por el sector de Cristo Rey. Tiene 46 años,  es casada y tiene   3 hijos de 21, 15 y 14 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja esta estudiando en la universidad, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo es dueño de dos camiones pesados pero por el momento no se encuentra trabajando en su negocio ya que está enfermo y pasa en casa, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Doña Ruth hace 4 meses se ha puesto una pequeña tienda en la cual labora de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, también sabe elaborar artesanías pero por el momento ha dejado este negocio y se dedica solo a su tienda. Este es el primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, etc., y también es para hacer unos pequeños arreglos a su local.

Su meta es compra un almacén de repuestos para que su esposo se dedique a este trabajo y deje su trabajo actual.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Soñadoras communal bank consists of nine women that live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, the third most important city in Ecuador. The people of Cuenca maintain their culture and traditions. They are very friendly and polite, just like the group members, who are hardworking women who are fighting to achieve their goal of improving their household economies.

Ana C. lives in the Medio Ejido area of the city of Cuenca and this is her first loan with the communal bank. She was invited by a friend. Ana is 24 years old and has two children who are 5 and 1. Her first child is studying at a school in the city. Ana’s husband is a builder and they do not have their own house, which is why they are renting.

For the past six months, Ana has been working selling cosmetics from Yanbal and Avon. She works all that she can without neglecting her house and her family. She will invest her loan in the purchase of more cosmetics like perfumes, creams, etc. Her goal in the future is to buy a car.

Ruth lives in the Cristo Rey area. She is 46 years old, married, and has three children who are 21, 15, and 14 years old. Her oldest is a university student and the two others are in high school in the city. Her husband owns two large trucks but he is not currently working at his business because he is sick and at home. They do not have their own house, which is why they are renting.

Four months ago, Ruth set up a small store where she works all week from 6am to 10pm. She also knows how to make handicrafts but has currently left that business and is only working at her store. This is her first loan with the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of more products for her store such as rice, sugar, oils, etc. She will also use it to make a few repairs in the place. Her goal is to buy a warehouse for spare parts so that her husband can work in this business and leave his current job.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry and cosmetics - To buy rice, sugar, oil, eggs and general groceries

loans.name: Alba Dora

texts.es:
Alba Dora es una mujer viuda que tiene 4 hijos en las edades D. 23 a 44 años, ella inició su negocio desD. hace más D. 25 años, a través D. un préstamo familiar con el que compró algunos cosméticos y los vendió a crédito entre vecinos y miembros D. su familia. Con el paso del tiempo el número D. clientes aumentó  y empezó a diversificar sus productos,  así fue como incrementó sus utilidades con apoyo financiero D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con ello sus condiciones D. vida y D. mejoramiento en su negocio, al que  ha logrado adicionarle vitrinas donD. exhibir sus productos, y ya no sale por las calles a distribuir sus mercancías, porque este punto D. ventas, le ha representado un poco D. descanso. Con esta organización ha logrado obtener 7 créditos y con su credikiva, comprará mercancía para surtir su vitrina y prepararse para la época D. fin D. año, en la cual sus ventas se incrementan en un 50%, especialmente en lo que tiene que ver con papelería, paquetes D. regalos naviD.ños y  juguetes, ayudándole así a ganar más dinero.
Su meta principal es ampliar su negocio, adicionar nuevas vitrinas y ampliar su local, para hacerlo más confortable y con mayor capacidad D. venta. Con relación a su familia ayudar a sus nietos con una excelente educación; aunque Alba reconoce que  tiene un gran desafío y  es el D. ajustar sus gastos en las épocas,  ya focalizadas, en que las ventas disminuyen.
texts.en:
Alba Dora is a widow that has four children ages ranging between 23 and 44, she started a business more than 25 years ago through a family loan that she used to buy cosmetics and sold giving credit to her neighbors and family members.  As time went by, the number of clients increased and she started to diversify her products, this way she increased income and with the financial support of Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo she improved her life conditions and her business, she has been able to add a display area to showcase her products instead of going out the streets to distribute the merchandise, this has allowed her some rest.  With this organization she has been able to obtain seven loans and with her kiva credit she will buy merchandise to fill the display area and get ready for the holiday season in which her sales go up 50%, specially with anything related to paper, Christmas gift wrapping and toys, which helps make more money.

Her main goal is to grow the business, add new display areas and expand the area to make it more comfortable with more sales potential.  In regards to her family she helps her grandchildren achieve a great education, however, Alba recognizes that she has a challenge when it's time to adjust her expenses, already allocated when the sales go down.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to display on her store to get ready for the Holiday Season

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is a 44-year-old, married mother of four living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a permanent house and her dreams are to have a better family standard of living in the future and to see her children attain higher levels of education. Teddy deals in bicycles, spare parts, bar and lodge. She started small as a teacher, which actually led her to where she is now. However, she has the challenge of unreliable shop attendants and unpredictable price fluctuations, which seem to affect her dream of becoming a stable business lady in the future. Teddy intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok S., 31, buys and sells yams, making 1 USD each day in the Takeo province. She is married and supports three children living at home. Her husband, Phan Soeurn, makes approximately 2 USD every day selling coconuts.

Pok S. would like a loan of 900 USD to purchase more coconuts to sell.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Elshad

texts.ru:
Elshad X. 50 let on jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Elshad yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas porjivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy.

Elshad 8 let tomu nazad reshil zanatsya skotovodstvom , Etomu biznessu yeqo nauchil otec kotoriy ochen klubil svoyu rabotu. Elshad seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya pereprodaji. Tak je Elshad prodayet i sherst ovec delaya iz nix tepliye zimniye veshi.
texts.en:
Elshad X. is 50 years old. He is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Elshad is an Internally Displaced Person, a refugee form the town of Fuzuli now living in the Fuzuli Region with his beloved family.

Eight years ago Elshad decided to go into the  animal-raising business. He has learned this  trade from his father, who really enjoyed his work. Now Elshad needs 2000 AZN in order to purchase sheep for  resale. Elshad also sells sheep wool and various winter clothing items made of wool.

loans.use: Purchasing sheep

loans.name: Joseph Muoki

texts.en:
Joseph is 61 years old and married to Pascalia who is a house wife. He buys livestock, fattens them and then sells them to make a profit. He has been in the business for a period of 30 years, with an income of Kshs. 20,000 per month.

This is his third loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous two. He hopes to be a leading livestock trader, give his children a quality education, and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for sale

loans.name: Yajayra

texts.es: Yajayra, de 27 años, vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de su esposo Enrique de 36 años y de su pequeño hijo menor de edad; juntos buscan que alcanzar el progreso. Desde hace 4 años esta trabajadora madre de familia se dedica al bordado de pedrería en diversas prendas de vestir, realiza esta labor en el taller de una amiga que trae grandes volúmenes de ropa para que ella junto a otras 3 señoras realicen el cuidadoso trabajo. Yajaira esta muy contenta, pues solo trabaja durante 4 días a la semana, por horas y cuando debe salir se lleva el trabajo a casa, de esta manera no descuida las labores del hogar y si lo considera rentable pues ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Como es muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles en su casa, pero sabe que lo logrará con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permite continuar adelante. Yajaira tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de 2 rollos de tela y también quiere terminar el tarrajeado de una pieza de su casa.
texts.en: Yajayra, age 27, lives in a rented home with her husband Enrique, age 36, and their young child. Together, they are looking to succeed. For four years this hard-working mother has done beaded embroidery on diverse articles of clothing. She does this work in the workshop of a friend who brings large volumes of clothing for Yajayra and three other woman to do this delicate work. Yajaira is very happy, as she only works 4 days a week, and when she needs to leave she brings her work home. This way, she does not have to forget about her housework. This is profitable work and she is able to help her husband with the household expenses. Since she is a very enterprising person, in the future she plans to open a food sales business in her home, and she knows she will only achieve it with hard work and dedication.
