This is her third loan with MFP, and she promises to pay her quotas punctually, as she does not want to disappoint those who will make this loan possible. This loan will allow her to continue moving ahead. Yajaira plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of two rolls of fabric, and she also wants to finish plastering part of her home.

loans.use: to purchase two rolls of fabric, and have part of her home plastered

loans.name: Santigie S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you the teachers of the Baptist Model Primary School in Mange village, near Makeni.  The Baptist Primary School was founded in 1976 by the Nigerian Baptist Conference (NBC) to help educate the children of Mange village and free them from a long distance walk to Makeni in search of learning. Currently, the school is staffed with eight teachers and has 285 pupils. 

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from Kiva lenders. Santigie S. K. (second from right) is a teacher at the school and leader of this group of borrowers. The 34-year-old Santigie was born in northern Sierra Leone.  He has been in the teaching profession for nine years. He is married and has five children – two in primary school and three in secondary school. Sanitigie has requested this loan in order to buy building material like iron corrugated zincs.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a single woman with one child who is attending school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

She has been operating a restaurant business for the past two years.  Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby.  Zawadi faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands in her business. She hopes to expand her business and establish another business in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, vegetables, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu because of its good variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, vegetables, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya resides in a city called Gujranwala, Pakistan. Gujranwala is located in Punjab and famous for its industry and rice crops. She has lived there in a 2-room brick house with her family  for many years. She is a housewife and copes with her household work by staying at home. She is a very responsible person and tries to do her duties very well. 

He husband is a civil servant and works in a government organization. After his day job, he does loading work with his donkey cart. He is the only breadwinner in the family. 

Surriya is the mother of two daughters and a son. All of them are studying in a local high school. When Surriya was a child, she was very fond of education but her parents couldn’t educate her due to poor financial conditions. Surriya doesn’t want the same destiny to befall her children, and that’s why she has enrolled them in school so they get an education and make their future bright. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy a new donkey cart because his old cart has become rough and rotten in different areas. She is hopeful that by purchasing a new cart her husband will be able to do his work better and increase his income.  

She is a new loan user of Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Ren was born in 1984. He and his wife, Mrs. Sey Nuon, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land where they grow rice.  Some of the rice is for selling and the rest is for eating.  He is also a laborer. Although they work hard, they earn little income. 

Ren is asking for a loan to buy four piglets for breeding and pig food in order to start a new business. He is the father of a child who is 6 years old. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy four piglets and pig food

loans.name: Evelyn Cecilia

texts.es:
Evelyn de 39 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y su hija de 10 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa, este negocio lo inicio de forma ambulante y hoy tiene un local en el mercado municipal de Jiquilisco.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa, ayudando así al fortalecimiento del negocio y ofrecer una gran variedad de prendas de vestir.
Su objetivo es continuar luchando por mejorar el negocio, volverlo cada día más rentable y con más oportunidades de superación para ella y su hija.
texts.en:
39 year-old Evelyn lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  She lives with her husband and 10 year-old daughter.  Evelyn's business is selling clothes.  She started out making her sales door to door but now she has a stall in Jiquilisco town market.

Evelyn is requesting a loan to buy clothes.  This will help her to strengthen her business and enable her to offer a wide range of clothes to her customers.

Evelyn's goal is to continue working hard to improve her business, to make it more and more profitable and to provide herself and her daughter with more opportunities to improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man living with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. He has been working as a plumber, installing toilets, faucets etc… since 1998. At the same time, he works as a home electrician, specialized in home electrical projects. He works on a freelance basis. He is the main income provider of his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase an air compressor and cutting machinery in order to better satisfy his customers' demands. He says that the loan will help him fulfill his business objectives. He is planning to enlarge his business operation and pursue more work and more projects.

loans.use: to purchase an air compressor and cutting machinery.

loans.name: Behilla

texts.en:
Behilla works hard to support her family. Behilla is separated and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables and herbs for her business.

Behilla has been in this business for 13 years now and also earns additional income from a "carinderia" (small cafe), buying and selling used clothing, buying and selling rice, and a BBQ stand.

In the future, Behilla would like to save money and expand her businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables and herbs for her business.

loans.name: Rovie Jean

texts.en: Rovie Jean is from Trento, Agusan del Sur. She is 24 years old, married and has two children, ages 4 and 2 years old. Her husband is a farmer, while she helps generate income by making baskets. This has been her business for four years now, earning her 2,500 Philippine pesos per month. Her loan will be used to buy materials for basket-making, pay for labor, and buy piglets to raise. She hopes that through her profit, she can renovate her house and increase business income.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket-making, pay for labor on the farm, and buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Diamante, tiene 35 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 4 años y 10 meses de edad. Galdys se dedica a la comercialización de papa seca.
Gladys es de profesión docente de educación primaria pero por el momento no está ejerciendo porque sus hijos son pequeñitos, ahora se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de papa seca, aprendió de éste negocio de su madre. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de papa.
Está en FINCA Perú desde hace cuatro ciclos, ingreso por la invitación de su hermana, le gusta por la facilidad de los préstamos que recibe, el apoyo a las mujeres, el compañerismo y solidaridad que se práctica entre sus compañeras del banco comunal. Está ahorrando para tener mas capital de trabajo. Su meta es ejercer su profesión, hacer una segunda especialidad, abrir un negocio propio en su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales y que tengan mejores oportunidades que ella.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the communal bank "Diamante". She is 35 years old, married common-law, and she has 2 children, aged 4 and 10 months. Gladys sells dried potatoes. 

Gladys is a primary school teacher by profession but at the moment she is not practicing because her children are little. So she makes and sells dried potatoes. She learned the business from her mother. The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of potatoes.

She has been with Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for 4 loan cycles. She joined following an invitation by her sister. She appreciates it for the easy loan process, for the support of the other women, the collegiality, and the group support found among the members of the communal bank. She is saving to have a larger working capital. Her goal is to work in her profession and to learn a second specialty. She also wants to open her own business in her house and to see her children grow up to have careers, so that they will have better opportunities than her.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is 27 years old and married.  She operates a drug store.  She also sells cosmetics to earn extra income.  She has four years of experience in the business and she has employed one person.  She has grown her shares in Faulu Kenya and this has helped her to get loans.  She used her previous loan to boost her business.  In five years, she hopes to own other outlets of her business in other towns.  She has requested 20,000 KES to buy medicine and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy medicine and cosmetics

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: Jovita de 26 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una buena estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Jovita en la toma fotográfica sale expuesta con una gorra, debido a un accidente, causándole  fisuras en el encéfalo craneano y alrededor de la vista, por ello no desea ser fotografiada.  La actividad a la que se dedica Jovita es el cultivo de las plantas de café, cacao y frutas cítricas; plantas y tierras que heredó de sus padres. Desde entonces labra sus cultivos con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se dedican a sacar la maleza, cosechar y trasladar los productos hasta las carreteras para luego ser transportados en triciclos o carretillas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide que es lo mejor para sus cultivos. Lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es combatir con las plaga de insectos que se apoderan de los brotes de sus cultivos. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, es conciente que este  dinero le será muy útil en el progreso de su trabajo. Se siente muy contenta por ser socia de su banco comunal y aportará de si misma por el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará semillas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Jovita is 26 years old.  She is a happy, hard-working, single young lady with an eagerness to succeed in life.  She lives in her own house and greatly wishes to earn more in order to be able to provide her future family with a stable income.  In the photo, Jovita appears with a cap because of an accident which caused fractures on her skull and around her eyes.  As such, she did not wish to be photographed.  

Jovita works in the cultivation of coffee, cacao, and citrus fruit plants; lands which she inherited from her parents.  She works on her fields with the help of day laborers, who remove the weeds, harvest, and transport the products to the roads, where they are then transported in tricycles and wheelbarrows.  What she enjoys most about her work is the liberty that she has in the management of her fields, since she gets to decide what is best for her cultivations.  She has been doing this for over 5 years and considers the most difficult part to combating the insects that eat her plants.  But for now, her priority is to purchase new land in order to increase her cultivations.  This is her second credit with MFP and she is aware that this money will be very useful in the progress of her work.  She is very happy to be a member of her communal bank and does her best to support her group's growth.  With these 1,000 Soles, she will purchase cacao and coffee seeds.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and cacao seeds.

loans.name: Cruz Antonia

texts.es:
Cruz Antonia tiene 50 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Cruz se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. El desafio mas grande es las enfermedades de la edad. Su sueño es seguir produciendo mas.
texts.en:
Cruz Antonia is 50 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “San Francisco de Sibimbe” is located in the neighborhood of Recinto Sibimbe in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank has 20 members who engage in short-cycle farming. They grow corn and rice.

Cruz is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She buys her supplies in Ventanas each month and then sells her products at the fair in the same location.

Cruz is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. Her greatest challenge is dealing with illnesses that come with age. Her dream is to continue producing more.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Suraie

texts.ru: Сурайё проживает в районе Шахринав. Она замужем. У неё двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Более десяти лет Сайёра работает в кафе помошником повара. Она кредит берет для покупки продуктов и новой посуды для кафе.
texts.en: Suraie lives in Shahrinav.  She is married and has two children.  She has a secondary education.   For more than ten years, Suraie has been working in a cafe assisting the cooks.  She is taking out a loan to buy foodstuffs and new dishes for the cafe.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and new dishes.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
In a simple living standard, Mrs. Say, 36, has been living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham Province. She has given birth to five children. Every night, Mrs. Say always thinks with her husband on how to earn more money for their family. After she was married, the parents of Mrs. Say contributed land for her. She has decided to make a farm with her husband now. When she and her husband do farm, they could be earning approximately $5 per day. 

To help the family, one of the five children is working as a sewing factor worker in Phnom Penh, which provides a suitable salary per month. To improve their living standard, they are requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming materials.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming materials.

loans.name: Laura Martha

texts.es:
Al final de una callecita adoquinada en la parroquia "Río Verde" del cantón Santo Domingo se encuentra el pequeño restaurante de Laura, una mujer de 50 años madre de 4 hijos. Vive con su esposo Jorge que es albañil de 53 años y sus dos hijos menores de edad.

Su pequeño negocio lo abrió hace tres años, sus amistades le enseñaron a preparar comida rápida y así empezó. Su trabajo le ha ayudado a poder sustentar las necesidades de su familia. Hoy ella quiere comprar insumos de cocina para mejorar la presentación del negocio y de esta manera atraer mayor clientela. Por ello Fundación Alternativa la ayudó con un crédito el cual le permitirá lograr su objetivo.

A ella le aquejan problemas de salud por lo que esa es su mayor preocupación, ella quiere que tosa su familia pueda gozar de buena salud y algún día ver a sus dos hijos menores con un título profesional que les permita tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
At the end of a small cobbled street in Río Verde parish, canton of Santo Domingo, you would find the small restaurant that belongs to Laura, a 50 year-old woman and mother of four children.  She lives with her husband, Jorge, who is 53 years-old and a bricklayer, and their two youngest children.

Laura opened her small business three years ago. Her friends taught her to prepare fast food and this is how she got started. Her work has helped her be able to cover her family's necessities. Today, she would like to buy kitchen supplies to improve her business' presentation and thereby attract more customers. Fundación Alternativa is helping her with a loan that will allow her to achieve this goal.

Laura is plagued by health problems, which is her greatest worry. She wants her entire family to be able to enjoy good health and to someday see her two younger children with professional degrees that will allow them to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Amid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has four children.

Amid has been an owner of a food market since 2006 selling soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products, etc. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent for his market.

loans.name: Tat

texts.en:
Tat, 65, is living in Baray Reussey Keo Commune, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She lives with Yang, 69, and two of their six children.  Four of her children have already married and live independently and the other two are working as sewing factory workers in Phnom Penh city, where they earn an adequate salary per month.  

Because of the rainy season and the lack of money, Tat wishes to request some funds through HKL (partner with Kiva). She will use this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials. This is her 2nd loan with HKL.  She’s hoping for a small loan to reach her objectives, and she is naturally disposed to repay her loan punctually. She hopes that this loan will make her family find happiness and prosperity.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 34 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan to buy more food to sell in her food stall.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods like hotdogs and sweet meats to sell

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a single woman who lives at a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in the area. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase beans, cooking fat oil and rice for her food stall business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, cooking fat oil and rice for her food stall business.

loans.name: Ceasaria

texts.en:
Ceasaria is a married woman with one child. She owns a farm in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been growing and selling rice for more than 20 years. Aside from farming, Ceasaria also makes bread that she sells to the people in her community.

Ceasaria has requested this loan to purchase flour for baking, and, for her other business, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Ceasaria hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase flour for baking, as well as fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 27 years old. She is married with 1 child.
She has a store that sells fish and dried fish products. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional products to sell.
Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson, 31, is married and has two children. He does mixed farming: i.e. rearing sheep and goats, and also is a wheat farmer, which he has been doing for the past seven years.

He learned about KADET LTD through a KADET staff member. He paid his first loan successfully and applied for a second loan, which he plans to spend partially on farming and the remainder on purchasing more animals.

He hopes to make a profit and use the anticipated profits to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to spend part on farming and the remainder on purchasing more animals.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a guitar-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her guitar-making business.

Pacita has been in this business for 30 years. Pacita earns more income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

Pacita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her guitar-making business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and married with two children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more snack foods, school supplies and other groceries.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 5 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Erlinda aspires to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more snack food, school supplies and other groceries

loans.name: Tuvshinbayar

texts.en: Tuvshinbayar is 37 years old and lives with his mother, wife and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul, Mongolia. His mother is a retired woman who stays at home, his wife runs a small second-hand clothing shop and his daughter is a kindergarden student. He started his taxi service business in 2009 using his own car. Due to his lack of finances, he bought an old rusty car. Now his car is giving him a lot of technical problems and customers are avoiding using his service for that reason. Tuvshinbayar is requesting MNT2,438,000 to buy a new car. He has already found a buyer of an old car. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "My business is slowing down rapidly and I have to do something."

loans.use: to buy a new car for his taxi service.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo, a married 58-year-old resident of the Philippines, has operated a pigpen that sells grown pigs for the past 10 years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, he has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy feed for the pigs. In the future, Ricardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Juje

texts.en:
Juje is a 32-year-old man from Maloro, Tangub City. Juje is married and has two children.

To earn a living, Juje owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. Specifically, he provides car repair services for his local community members. Juje has been in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Juje joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, he was better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve his family's standard of living. Juje is now requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools and materials so that he can provide additional services for his customers. He plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to provide additional services by purchasing repair tools and materials

loans.name: Esperina

texts.fr: Esperina est commerçante. Elle revend des produits alimentaires. Divorcée, elle s’occupe seule des responsabilités familiales. Son petit commerce lui permet de gagner un peu d’argent pour prendre soin de ses trois enfants et leur payer une école. Elle demande ce prêt pour acheter des gallons d’huile.

loans.use: acheter des gallons d’huile

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris O. is a very hardworking lady who is willing to work but lacks starting capital. She lives in a small community called Dodowa in the Dangme West District of Ghana.  She sells shoes, sandals, slippers and so on from house to house. She wishes to have a permanent shop where she can buy goods in large quantities for sale. She is seeking a loan of $750.00 from Kiva to make this wish a reality.

loans.use: Doris is seeking to expand her shoe business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rent more land and buy goats

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Born in 1965, Sarah is a widow and has five children. She found things very difficult when her husband and son died in a motor accident. Unable to take care of the other children, she joined GHAPE in the year 2004 and received her first loan of $40 which she used in retailing fruits and vegetables. Her business site is situated near a daily market and so shop-keepers, hawkers and other buyers provide her with an encouraging sale all the time.

Given a loan of $800, she plans to buy pineapples, oranges, coconuts and vegetables for retail. She plans to repay the loan during the term, and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement

loans.use: Sale of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila is from Nicolaev, Ukraine. She is divorced and has two grown daughters. Ludmila has requested a loan to increase the assortment of inventory she has available in her small clothing business. She has been in business for nine years. Her business currently has two sales locations – one is in a good location in the lobby of a popular, large supermarket store and the other is a traditional kiosk at one of the local markets. As a single mother, her business is a very important source of income for Ludmila. In addition to meeting her own needs, she’d also like to help one of her daughter purchase an apartment. This loan will allow Ludmila to re-supply her inventory so that she can continue to attract new customers and generate a good profit.

loans.use: Increase inventory in clothing business

loans.name: Altagracio

texts.es:
Altagracio C. is from the republic of Santani. He is 69 years old and married to Dionisia Martinez who is 65 years old. They have 5 children, two of whom are studying in high school en Santani, and the older ones have their own independent activities. Altagracio works in agriculture, and also makes cheese. He has 12 hectares of land, 4 dairy cows and 2 horses. They are very hard working people, with their work day starting at 4am every day of the week. They have a good customer base thanks to the quality of their products and their ability to meet their clients needs. Now they plan to cultivate sesame, and are requesting the funding for the costs of the cultivation.

El Sr. Altagracio Chávez es de Republicano, Santaní, tiene 69 años de edad, y está casado con la Sra. Dionisia Martínez de 65 años de edad. Tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando en el colegio, en Santaní, y los mayores tienen sus actividades en forma independiente. Don Altagracio, se dedica a la agricultura, y a la producción de queso. Tiene 12 hectáreas de terreno, 4 vacas lecheras, y 2 caballos. Son personas muy trabajadores y sacrificadas, su actividad laboral del día empieza a las 04:00 horas de la mañana y es de lunes a lunes, tienen una clientela numerosa gracias a la calidad de sus productos y a su cumplimiento con los clientes. Ahora tiene proyectado cultivar sésamo, para lo cual solicita una financiación para los gastos de cultivo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To buy sesame sees and cover the cultivation costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mr. Sar T. (age 67) and his family live in a small village near the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Sar and his wife, Chet Ror Keas, have been married since 1979. Sar attended school through the second grade, and his wife attended through the fifth. They have four living children; two died in infancy. Of the four still living, three live at home with their parents. The two youngest, both boys, still study in school. The eldest son works in Phnom Penh as a security guard.

They are requesting this, their second loan from MAXIMA, for $1,200 to buy a fishing boat and a boat motor. Sar has been fishing on the nearby Mekong River his entire life. Depending on the season, he fishes in a single boat with one of his sons using a smaller net. During the main fishing season from January through March, they use three boats and a big net. At that time he and his neighbor work together and hire up to ten men to work with them. In addition to taking care of the home and family, his wife sells the fish in the local market.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat and motor

loans.name: Kabowa 3 (B) Group

texts.en:
Gloria M. is married and has five children. She helps support her family by working as a seamstress, and plans to use the income generated by the two new sewing machines she hopes to buy to pay her rent and her children's school fees. Flavia sells hardware, Jesca has a retail shop and Vincencia runs a kiosk. All three women will use this loan to add to the inventory of items they have to sell to their customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and other items

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepcion R. is a young woman who some months ago started her own small business, a grocery store in the city of Leon, in the El Sauce region of this beautiful city.

Since she was very young she been a hardworker and today she sees the need to invest in the purchase of merchandise to stock her grocery store. With the help of her business, this young woman supports her elderly parents and today more than ever they depend on her

To improve her business and to continue to fill the necessities of her home, Miss Conception R. has successfully repaid 5 loans with Ceprodel which she has used to purchase supplies for her grocery store. Importantly, since she has been working with Ceprodel she has been very responsible to repay the laons she has acquired on time and as indicated.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Concepción R. es una joven que desde hace pocos meses inicio su pequeño negocio de pulpería en la ciudad de León específicamente en el municipio El Sauce de esta bella ciudad.

Desde muy jovencita se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y hoy en día su necesidad es la de invertir en la compra de la mercadería para surtir la pulpería. Cabe señalar que por medio de este negocio, la joven mantiene a sus padres en edad avanzada que hoy mas que nunca dependen de ella.

Para mejorar la situación de su negocio y continuar supliendo las necesidades de su hogar, la dama Concepción R. ha realizado 5 créditos en Ceprodel que los ha utilizado en la compra de los productos de pulpería y de esta manera ha logrado mantener a sus padres. Es necesario destacar que desde que trabaja con Ceprodel, muy responsablemente ha logrado pagar todos estos créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Fatuma's Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 44 years old and is a married woman with four children, ages 27, 25, 24 and 15. Fatuma owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 6 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Nuru and Queen, who have businesess dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Guineales Group

texts.es:
The women that belong to “Las Guineales” Communal Bank gather together every three weeks outside a home made of adobe. Their meeting place is next to Manuela G.’s kitchen where she is constantly making tamales to sell at a very modest price to her partners.

The house where the meetings take place is located in a town far from the Guatemalan coast and, sadly, it is occasionally plagued by delinquents. Nevertheless, the town of Los Guineales is blessed with fertile land. This is a place covered with coffee plantations and when the coffee berries appear, the town is painted red.

This group of women is known to be very organized and, despite the fact that they appear serious at first, they are full of smiles once they get to know you. The members of this group invest the money they borrow in two principal activities: woven items and convenience stores.

The women that work in the textile area use their loans to buy thread, which is used to weave traditional Guatemalan clothing utilizing a special technique. They also use the thread to embroider beautiful and colorful flowers on the blouses that are worn in the high plains of Guatemala.

The women who have convenience stores use the money they borrow to replenish inventory. They all buy laundry detergent, beans, rice, sugar, cooking oil and other products used in the home. But some of the women with a more entrepreneurial vision also buy products that can’t be found in other stores, like prepaid cards for cellular phones, cereals, deli items and even shrimp.

The Guineales women say that they like working with Friendship Bridge because of the convenience to pay back the loan in payments due every 42 days with no interest plus, the training they have received helps them grow their businesses. They also mention that they like working together because they all pay on time and feel like they have formed a solid group.

This is a special group of women to which Friendship Bridge has given the opportunity to grow. Nevertheless, it will be thanks to the money you are going to invest in them that will help this group succeed. Thank you for supporting and believing in them.  

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Las mujeres que agrupan el banco comunal Las Guineales se juntan cada tres semanas a las afueras de una casa de adobe. Su lugar de encuentra se ubica al costado de la cocina de doña Manuela G., la cual está constantemente cocinando tamales para venderlos a un muy módico precio al resto de sus compañeras.

La casa donde se lleva acabo los encuentros se encuentra en una aldea muy retirada en la costa de Guatemala y lastimosamente es asediada, ocasionalmente, por delincuentes. Sin embargo, la aldea los Guineales está bendita con una tierra muy productiva. Este dicho lugar está cubierto por cafetales que cuando están retoñando sus frutos colorean la aldea de rojo.

Este grupo de mujeres tienen la característica de ser muy organizadas y a pesar de que reflejan una imagen seria al principio, regalan sonrisas cuando entran en confianza. Las integrantes de este grupo invierten su crédito en dos actividades mayormente: tejidos y tiendas de conveniencia.

Las clientas que trabajan en el área textil utilizan su crédito para comprar hilo. Con este hilo ellas tejen los trajes tradicionales de Guatemala, utilizando la técnica de telar de cintura. También, usan el hilo para bordar bellas y coloridas flores en las blusas que se utilizan en el altiplano de Guatemala.

En lo que respecta a la actividad de tiendas de conveniencia. Las clientas utilizan su crédito para completar el inventario de sus respectivas tiendas. Todas ellas compran jabón para lavar ropa, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos que se utilizan en el hogar. Sin embargo, algunas clientas con visión empresarial compran productos que no se encuentran en otras tiendas, como tarjetas de celular prepago, cereales, embutidos y hasta camarones.

Las mujeres Guineales dicen que les gusta trabajar con Friendship Bridge porque tienen la facilidad de pagar en cuotas de cuarenta y dos días cada una, les acomoda el interés y las capacitaciones que han recibido las ayuda a que su negocio crezca. Ellas también mencionaron que, les gusta trabajar juntas porque todas pagan puntualmente y sienten que se ha formado un grupo consolidado.

Este es un grupo especial de mujeres al cual Friendship Bridge les ha dado una oportunidad de crecer. Sin embargo, va a ser gracias al capital que se ustedes van a invertir en ellas que va a impulsar a este grupo al éxito. Gracias por apoyarlas y creer en ellas.

loans.use: Purchase the materials necessary to make and embroider typical clothing; purchase products to sell in convenience stores

loans.name: Justina Pastora

texts.es:
The lady lives with her husband and their children in her own house on Julio Téllez Avenue in the Tacagua zone of the city of La P.. Her husband is a carpenter and his salary is insufficient, so she helps with the household expenses by generating her income with the sale of clothes, provisions, toys, etc. In order to increase her capital, purchase more merchandise, enlarge her clientele and improve her standard of living, she has requested a loan.

Her previous credit is good and she qualifies to obtain said loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos en la Av. Julio Téllez de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La P.. El marido es carpintero y su salario es insuficiente, por lo cual ella ayuda en el hogar generando sus ingresos con la venta de ropa, víveres, juguetes, etc. A fin de aumentar su capital, surtirse de mayor mercadería para aumentar clientela y mejorar su nivel de vida ha solicitado un crédito.

Su antecedente crediticio es bueno y califica para obtener dicho préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, provisions and toys for resale.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is an entrepreneur from the central Ukrainian city of Ordzhonikidze. He has a small business selling movies and music from a rented space at a mall in Ordzhonikidze. Andrei started his business about two years ago after recognizing a lack of good video stores in town. His business has done well and he currently makes around $850 in profit each month. Andrei is married and has two children. He is a lively entrepreneur and has gained a reputation for integrity.

Andrei has requested a short-term loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to increase his working capital. He has proven to be a reliable loan client with Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for this opportunity to continue assisting him with his business.

(Note: this is a short-term “express” loan that will be repaid in two months.)

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Hamidan's Group

texts.en:
Hamidan baji is the wife of M. and they live in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. They have lived in this city for the last 16 years. She is the mother of two children: one daughter and one son. Both of her kids are enrolled in a local school near her neighborhood. Hamidan baji’s husband is a construction worker. She sells bangles in different areas, and also is efficient in domestic household work. She also takes care of her children. She successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and now she is applying for a loan to expand her bangle business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nusrat baji wants a loan for her wood business. Rani baji wants a loan for her shoe business.

This is a group loan, and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Khanim

texts.en: Khanim started this business three years ago. She sells blankets. Khanim is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan. She has settled in the Absheron region. She was born in 1961. She is married and has two children. Now she needs a loan of $1,200 to buy blankets to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy blankets to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Juliana C. me dedico a la venta de comida y golosinas, actividad que realizo desde hace mas de 15 años, lo que me ha permitido sacar adelante mi negocio y mi hogar, este negocio gracias a Dioa me ayudo a cubrir con todas las necesidades de mis hijos en los aspectos de alimentacion y vestuario.
en estos momentos necesito hacer crecer mi negocio ya que en estos ultimos dias no me doy abasto para cubrir las necesidades de mis clientes y rapido no tengo producto para vender, necesito inyectarle un capital para incrementar mis inventarios y asi tener mayor produccion de comida. y con las ganancias que obtenga poder seguir con el sstento de mi hogar.
esta es la unica actividad que puedo realizar ya que al uno cumplir con la tercera edad es bien dificil conseguir trabajo.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Juliana C.. I work selling food and sweets, an activity that I have been involved with for more than 15 years. It has permitted me to improve my business and my home. Thanks to God, this business has helped me pay for all my children’s necessities in terms of food and clothing. At the moment, I need to grow my business, as in recent days I have not been able to cope with the needs of my clients and soon I will not have products to sell. I need an injection of capital in order to grow my inventories and so enable more food production. And, with the income I would get from this, I would be able to continue with improving my home. This is the only activity that I am able to do, as once one becomes elderly it is very difficult to find work.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the things necessary to make food and sweets

loans.name: Umarboy

texts.ru: Умарбой 36летний мужчина отец троих детей,хороший специалист по откорму и уходу за скотом.Также у него есть участок земли где он выращивает рис, и вовремя маниторинга он был на даче.Ему помогает по откорму скота его жена которая на фотографии.Займ Умарой хочет взять для расширения бизнеса животноводства.
texts.en:
Umarboy is a 36-year-old man and the father of three children. He specializes in the care and feeding of cattle. In addition, he has a plot of land where he grows rice, and stays at his summer home to watch over it. His wife, pictured here, assists him in feeding the cattle. Umar wants to take out this loan in order to expand his livestock business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening of cattle

loans.name: Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  MUJERES VENCEDORAS, esta conformado por señoras que en su mayoría radican en la ciudad D. El Alto.nLa directiva esta conformada por la señora Teresa como su presidenta, Beatriz y Yolanda como tesorera y secretaria, las socias se dedican en su mayoría a la confección D. prendas D. vestir, al tejido a la venta D. comida y verduras, algunas son dueñas D. tiendas D. barrios y otros micronegocios independientes. Este grupo esta emprendiendo su cuarto ciclo, la mayoría D. ellas ya se conocen entre si y cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que componen el mismo grupo desD. hace ya tres ciclos atrás, es un grupo D. personas muy alegres y están muy animadas para trabajar con la Fundación AGROCAPITAL, debido a su puntualidad y compromiso en sus anteriores ciclos este grupo esta catalogado como uno D. los mas emprendedores dentro D. la fundación.n
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Vencedoras" Community Bank, meaning '"winning women" in English, is maD. up of women who primarily live in the city of El Alto. The executive is formed by Ms Teresa as president, Beatriz as treasurer and Yolanda as secretary. The members primarily earn a living from dress-making, and from selling food and vegetables. Some own neigbourhood stores, while others own independent micro-businesses. This group is starting their fourth cycle. The majority of the women already know each other and have experience in solidarity groups, as the same group has been together for the past three cycles. It is a group of very happy people, and they are very motivated to work with the Fundación Agrocapital. Owing to their punctuality and commitment during the previous cycles, this group is classified as one of the most enterprising within the foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS DEL GRUPO "LAS GAVIOTAS" SON REPRESENTADAS POR LA SEÑORA SILVIA. EN GENERAL ELLAS (OS) SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. ROPA, COSMÉTICOS Y TIENDAS D. ABARROTES Y  EL SOCIO PARTICIPANTE ES TRANSPORTISTA PÚBLICO. COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO EN ESPECIAL POR CAUSA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA D. PRODUCTOS PERO ELLOS (AS) SON GENTE TRABAJADORA Y EMPRENDEDORA POR LO QUE SABEN SALIR ADELANTE ANTE CUALQUIER CIRCUNSTANCIA. EL DESTINO DEL FINANCIAMIENTO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. MERCADERÍA E INSUMOS A LA VENTA EN EL CASO DEL SOCIO LE SERVIRÁ PARA LA REPARACIÓN DEL MOTOR D. SU VEHÍCULO. LOS SOCIOS (AS) EN SU MAYORÍAS YA PARTICIPARON D. ANTERIORES GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR TANTO CONOCEN LA MODALIDAD D. TRABAJO EN LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL EN LA CUAL DEMOSTRARON RESPONSABILIDAD Y PUNTUALIDAD.
texts.en:
The members of the “Las Gaviotas” (The Seagulls) group, represented by Ms. Silvia, sell clothing and cosmetics, and manage general stores. The male group member works as a public transportation driver. As in all commercial spheres, there is always competition in the market, especially because of supply and demand. However, these members are hard-working and enterprising people who know how to get ahead under any circumstance. The loan will be used to increase merchandise and supplies. The male group member will use the money to repair his vehicle’s engine. The majority of the members have previously participated in other solidarity groups, which means that they know about the operational moD. at Fundación Agrocapital, demonstrating responsibility and punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo a través de la Sra. Perla Vázquez, quien atraída por los principios del programa invito a sus vecinas del Barrio La Floresta para formar crear el grupo, y beneficiarse de una oportunidad de trabajo en equipo. Las señoras son muy unidas y realizaron muchas obras comunitarias, ellas están convencidas que pueden lograr mas aún.
También realizan diferentes actividades en forma independiente para el sustento de sus hogares como ser: 
1	Sara Florentin	Modista
2	Eliodora S.	Venta ambulante
3	Maria S.	Venta de Comidas
4	Perla V.	Venta de Frutas
5	Librada P.	Venta de Comidas
6	Gladyz Vázquez	Despensa
7	Lourdes I.	Venta de Mandioca
8	Maria V.	Venta de Menudencia
9	Julia B.	Venta de Mandioca
10	Maria L.	Venta de Frutas
11	Atanacia O.	Venta de Comidas
12	Eladia V.	Venta de Mandioca
13	Victorina B.	Venta de Frutas
14	Narcisa G.	Venta de Comidas
15	Carmen A.	Venta de Mandioca
16	Maria B.	Venta de Carne
17	Zunilda L.	Venta de Ropas
18	Delia D.	Venta de Bebidas
19	Mirta D.	Venta de Bebidas
20	Gilda Enciso	Venta de Carbón

Reciben de crédito un promedio de Gs. 450.000 cada una. Este crédito lo invertirán para surtir sus mercaderías para estas fiestas. Ellas esperan tener buenas ventas y con sus ganancias poder compartir una navidad en familia, aún cuando algunas de ellas tienen a sus familiares trabajando en el extranjero. Compra de: fideo, azúcar, arroz, harina, carne, frutas, mandioca, menudencias, telas, jeans, remeras, bebidas gaseosas, carbón vegetal.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Mrs. Perla Vázquez, who invited her neighbors from Barrio la Floresta to form the group and benefit from the opportunity to work as a team. The ladies are very close and do a great deal of community works. They are convinced that they can achieve even more. They do different types of work independently in order to maintain their homes such as: 1 Sara Florentin Dressmaker 2 Eliodora S. Street vendor 3 Maria S. Food sales 4 Perla V. Fruit sales 5 Librada P. Food sales 6 Gladyz Vázquez Shop owner 7 Lourdes I. Sale of tapioca 8 Maria V. Sale of giblets 9 Julia B. Sale of tapioca 10 Maria L. Fruit sales 11 Atanacia O. Food sales 12 Eladia V. Sale of tapioca 13 Victorina B. Fruit sales 14 Narcisa G. Food sales 15 Carmen A. Sale of tapioca 16 Maria B. Sale of meat 17 Zunilda L. Sale of clothing 18 Delia D. Sale of beverages 19 Mirta D. Sale of beverages 20 Gilda Enciso Sale of coal They would receive a loan of Gs. 450.000 each. This loan will be invested in order to supply merchandise for the holidays. They hope to have good sales and with their earnings be able to share Christmas with their families, even though some of them have family members working outside of the country. Items purchased include: noodles, sugar, rice, flour, meat, fruit, tapioca, giblets, fabric, jeans, t-shirts, carbonated soft drinks, and charcoal.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Items purchased include: noodles, sugar, rice, flour, meat, fruit, tapioca, giblets, fabric, jeans, t-shirts, carbonated soft drinks, and charcoal.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang T. is a villager in Damnak Lor Eth village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because her field is infertile. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel in order to water and support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Pech Uor, is a cow breeder. Mrs. Neang T. is a 57-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while another is a driver and the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for her rice plot.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan A. sells drinks and pure water in wholesale and retail to her customers. She has been in this business for quite a long time. She needs a loan in the amount of 70, 000NGN to purchase more drinks and pure water to sell. Susan is 40 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pure water to resell

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en:
S. is 35 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh. He has two children: one is attending school and the other one is still young. He is married to Ratha, who is 27 and sells cloth in bulk to the market with a net income of $6 per day. S. has earned a living by hiring big umbrellas to the surrounding sellers at Dermkor market since 2005. He is famous for his good service and his friendly attitude. He earns a net income of $5.33 per day.

Recently, due to the demands of the family, S. has wanted to increase his income. Hence, he is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy a number of big umbrellas for his service. This loan will help his family have a more comfortable standard of living. He wants his children to have degrees.

loans.use: To buy a number of big umbrellas to expand his service.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema has been a clothes seller in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for five years. She belongs to Mkimbizi "A" East loan group (Group code: 2015). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Rehema is 29 years old, married, and has two children, ages 11 and 5. She also cares for two additional dependants.

loans.use: Buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen A. is a 40-year-old mother of four children, ages 18, 14, 12, and 9. After many attempts, we could not stop laughing while taking a picture. This is the best one of the bunch.

Maureen sells fish in the Oyala market – located on a roundabout in downtown Kisumu. Her husband works at a supermarket. She sells all kinds of fish, but primarily Tilapia from Lake Victoria. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings so that she can buy a larger quantity of fish to sell.

She also laid out the problems that many fish-sellers here in Kisumu have. If the weather is bad, customers won’t come. If the fishermen have a bountiful catch, fish-stock floods the market and this drives the price down. Preserving the fish also can be very difficult for these women who have little or no access to electricity – so they sometimes will rent out space in someone’s refrigerator. If the fish start to go bad, they will fry them and sell them dry.

When asked what else she would like Kiva lenders to know, Maureen replied that life is difficult right now in Kisumu and regular income is difficult to come by. She says it is hard to earn enough for all her children to go to school and that she says it is most likely she will not be able to afford to send any of her children to college, though she would like to. She says that she will be happy if she can get the money to send her children to college.

Maureen recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To buy fish for retail sale

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha S., 38, and her husband, Mr. Yoeung Nut, 40, who live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1993 and have three children: two daughters who attend school and one young son.

Sokha and her husband have been producing rice wine and raising pigs for ten years. They produce rice wine at their house and carry it by their own motorbike to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Their old motorcycle broke and they have spent a lot of money to repair it so Sokha is requesting her first loan of $500 to replace the motorbike with a new one.

loans.use: To replace a motorbike with a new one to carry rice wine to sell at market.

loans.name: Kambar

texts.ru: Ходжаев КАмбар житель горда Яван. Возраст 38 лет, женат и имеет шестерых детей. В семье работает один . Работает в сфере услуг. Имеет микроавтобус , который использует в качестве маршрутного такси. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже четыре года. Для того,чтобы произхвезти ремонт машины он решил получить кредит и использовать его для покупки автозапчастей.
texts.en:
Kambar H. lives in Yavan. He is 38 years old and is married with six children. He is the only breadwinner in the family. Kambar owns a minivan that he uses as a taxi. He's had this business for 4 years. Kambar is applying for a loan in order to get spare parts and fix the van.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to fix the van

loans.name: Ramón

texts.en: Mr. Ramón is 48 years old and is married to Mrs. Fidencia Gimenez, with whom he has three older children, each with their own family.  He sells over-the-counter medicines in two cities on the outskirts of San Lorenzo. He has been working in this industry for ten years. He began delivering his medicines by bus. Two years ago he bought a motorcycle, and now he has a cargo-motorcycle that he bought with another Fundación Paraguaya loan, repaid in full.  His idea for the future is to buy a truck, so that he may be able to sell his medicines to more people in more cities.

loans.use: The purchase of over-the-counter medicines and sweets.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia P. is from the village of Bagakay, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Cecelia is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Cecelia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" (general) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Cecelia is just starting this business.

In 2008, Cecelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecelia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cecelia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 59 years old. She is a widowed woman with four children. Her husband died through a prolonged sickness. She prepares and serves pastries like cakes, dough nuts and flour chips through hawking and she also supplies to shops around her.

In spite of the challenges she faces, she manages to meet her customers' demands by depending on her small resources. She supplies her produce to her customers in the market center by herself. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet the demands of her customers. She requests loan support to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide support for the business. She has been in business for four years now.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc

loans.name: Enebish

texts.en:
Enebish D. is a single mother who has two sons, ages 7 and 11. She lives with her children and mother in a ger (a yurt or nomadic housing tent) district on the plot of land that she owns in Arhangay, one of the Mongolian central provinces. 

Enebish started a tailoring business in 2001. Then, in 2006, she started selling second-hand clothes at the local market. She purchases used clothing that is imported from South Korea. She pays 10,000 tugrugs (about $7) for a kilo of used clothes and then resells each item for a slightly higher price. Enebish says that "many poor and vulnerable people live in our province and big portions of my buyers consist of them. Because second-hand clothes are cheaper than new clothes, they sell quicker." 

With this loan, she will purchase more second-hand clothes to increase her business inventory. In the near future, she is planning to start a business selling new clothing.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 33 years old and married with two children, a son and a daughter. Both of his children are still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family and lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

George operates a snack bar which sells all kinds of soft drinks and pastries in a roadside shop in his community. George has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy supplies from distributors in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy crates of supplies

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Cette dame a très vite compris qu’elle doit exercer une activité génératrice de revenus pour supporter les frais scolaires et l’éducation de ses 03 enfants. Elle est veuve ; pour cela elle vend depuis 1983 des produits d’alimentation générale. Sa boutique est très fréquentée par beaucoup de clients, car elle a une manière particulière de bien accueillir les gens. Elle a besoin actuellement de renouveler son stock ; c’est pourquoi elle a sollicité un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 bidons d’huiles et 10 sacs d’oignons.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Bayasgalan is 33 years old and lives with her husband, three daughters and son in Uvs province in Mongolia. All six members of the family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Not only do both Bayasgalan and her husband work in the family’s traditional shoe-making business, but the three girls help out as well. These traditional shoes are very popular during Mongolian holidays and celebrations.

Bayasgalan began her business in 2003, and only made one type of traditional Mongolian shoe, the Bayad. However, after experiencing success with the first type of shoe, she expanded her business to not only include several different types of traditional shoes, but employed two assistants as well.

Bayasgalan has the ability to not only create quality shoes, but beautiful shoes as well. Her dream is to one day own her own shoe-making factory and be able to hire more employees. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a sewing machine and materials in order to increase sales.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and raw materials

loans.name: La Cienega Group

texts.es:
En la comunidad indígena de Donaciano Ojeda vive el señor Federico S. E., un señor de 48 años, amable y muy querido por la mayoría de sus vecinos en la comunidad, don Federico se dedica al cultivo de aguacate, aprendió a trabajar este fruto gracias a algunos cursos que les han impartido en su comunidad y que el  ha aprovechado muy bien. 

Don Federico esta casado con Doña Natalia, mujer de trabajo que se dedica a la cría de pollos y guajolotes a pequeña escala y a trabajar en el campo desde muy temprana hora del día para apoyar a su marido. Ellos viven en una pequeña casa de madera  rodeados de árboles y muchos animales domésticos. 

Actualmente ellos apoyan económicamente en la crianza de sus pequeños nietos y sueñan que estos pepequeñitos tengan las oportunidades que ellos y sus hijos no pudieron tener, su meta es que su negocio prospere y poder dejarles a sus hijos un patrimonio para que puedan vivir mejor. 

Es por ello que formaron un grupo con 3 personas mas en su comunidad, al cual llamron "La Cienega" y así piden un crédito a Fundación Realidad, ´dicho crédito don Federico lo utilizará para comprar fertilizantes para sus árboles de aguacate y así tener mejores aguacates.
texts.en:
Federico Solorzano E., 48, lives in the indigenous community of Donaciano Oveja. He is kind and well loved by the majority of his neighbors in the community. Federico cultivated avocados. He learned to work with this fruit thanks to some courses given in his community, which he took good advantage of. Federico is married to Natalia. She raises chickens and turkeys on a small scale. She also works in the field from a very early hour to help her husband. They live in a small wooden house surrounded by trees and lots of domestic animals. They are currently helping to economically support raising their small grandchildren. They dream that these little ones will have opportunities that they and their children could not have. His goal is for his business to prosper to be able to leave his children an inheritance with which they can live better. This is why they formed a group with three other people in the community. It is called “La Cienega”, and they are asking the Fundación Realidad for a loan. Federico will use the loan to buy fertilizers for his avocado trees; then he will have better avocados.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cultivate avocados and a store

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en:
Ronke I. is 45 years old and she is a divorcee with a child. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells all types of sarongs, ladies bags and shoes; she has been in the business for five years. 

Ronke I. hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more sarongs, ladies bags and shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Micaela Mercedes

texts.es:
La venta de comida es la actividad a la que se ha dedicado la señora Micaela H. desde hace cuatro años y habiéndose ubicado en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua.

Es importante destacar que la señora Micaela no posee un buen local para desarrollar la venta por lo que anhela tener su propio establecimiento donde vender. El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de la mercadería para preparar la comida como lo es la fritanga y de esta manera ofrecerla a los clientes.
texts.en:
For the past four years Mrs. Micaela H. has been selling food for a living. She is located at the market Israel Lewites in the town of Managua.

It is important to mention that Mrs. Micaela does not have good premises to carry out sales and therefore it is her greatest wish to own premises for her sales. The loan will be spent on buying ingredients to cook the food, such as fried snacks, for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food production.

loans.name: Mrs. Yom Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Yom T. is the president of a village bank loan group that consists of 14 people from Sarei Sambath village in Kandal province.  She is farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She needs fertilizer and pesticide for her field because it is infertile. Thus, she decided use her share of this loan to buy these things to support her field. Mrs. Yom T. is a widow with a child who helps her on the farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 32 years old and married. He sells second-hand clothes in the slums of Mathare and has been in business for two years. He is requesting Kes. 20,000 to increase his stock of clothing. He describes himself as optimistic and hardworking and says that in Faulu he has been instilled with a knowledge of saving. He hopes for a better and brighter future. In ten years, he sees himself as an achiever with an expanded wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario A. is from the village of Estrada. She is 52 years old. Rosario is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Rosario runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Rosario has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rosario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Rosario from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items in order to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 23 years old and is a single man. He lives in a small village close to Hebron, Palestine.

Murad owns a small bakery that attracts many clients from the region. His immediate need is to acquire basic ingredients to continue baking bread. This is why he’s looking for support from Ryada to obtain credit that will allow him to buy the ingredients he needs to continue his bakery business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for baking bread

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA. is a 36-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. BilA. has owned a barber shop for over 15 years. BilA. requested a loan from A. Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to change the décor of his shop. This is his third loan and he has always paid on time.

BilA. is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and he does a good job. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the tools he needed for his shop. BilA. decided on doing this business because he wanted to have independent work and because he leaned it in an academy. In the future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To change the décor of his shop

loans.name: Jose Leonzo

texts.es:
el señor Jose Leonzo J. P. tiene 52 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos dos viven con el y dos en los ee. uu.
Su esposa vende tortillas y el se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, esta solicitando el credito
para compra de una res para destazo y comprar pescado seco.
se siente muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien, y ahora quiere dedicarse tambien a la venta de carne de res. 
las ganancias las necesita para el sustento de su hogar y su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Leonzo J. P. is 52 years old, and has 4 children, 2 of whom live with him and 2 in the United States. His wife sells tortillas and he works buying and selling fish. He is seeking a loan for the purchase of a cow and to buy dried fish. He feels very happy that everything is going well, and now he wants to work selling beef as well. He needs the earnings to sustain his home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish and a cow

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Srun S.,  51, is married and lives with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has five children. 

She produces Cambodian traditional baskets and earns approximately US$11 gross per day. By doing this she is able to cover her family's expenses, particularly her children’s education. She has been with this business since 2000. Her husband grows mushrooms for sale, earning an income of US$7 per day. Their standard of living has improved since S. has been running her business. 

S. is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to expand her husband’s mushroom growing business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: to expand her husband's mushroom growing business

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Marina Isabel V. V., tiene la edad de 24 años, vive en el Barrio de Eduardo Contreras, es casada y su esposo labora como chofer, apoyándole con sus ingresos, a los gastos domésticos, la señora Marina trabaja para una institución como secretaria, desde hace 5 años.

Ellos viven en una zona muy desprotegida y en los tiempos de lluvia, el agua se les filtra mucho, por el mal estado en que se encuentra el techo de su casa, ellos habitan en un pequeño terreno que les heredo su padre, pero desean solicitar de un préstamo para comprar laminas de zinc y cambiar el techo de su hogar, esto les permitirá vivir con mejores condiciones, dentro de las remodelaciones, además esta la ampliación de la sala de estar, con este préstamo se compraran todos los materiales de construcción para empezar con los trabajos de mano de obra.

Ellos son una familia muy humilde y trabajadora que han logrado emprenderse a nuevas fuentes de ingresos, gracias al afán de mejorar sus estándares de vida y así brindarle mejores condiciones económicas a su futura familia.
texts.en:
Marina Isabel V. V. is 24 years old. She lives in the Eduardo Contreras neighborhood, is married and her husband works as a driver. To help him with household expenses, for the past 5 years Marina has worked as a secretary at a school. They live in a very unprotected zone and during the rainy season water often comes into their home because of the poor condition of the roof. They live on a small patch of land which they inherited from her father. They would like to request a loan to buy some zinc sheets and change the roof on their house, which will allow them to live in better conditions. As part of the remodeling, additionally they would like to expand the living room. With this loan they will buy all the construction materials to start the work. They are a very humble and hard-working family who have been able to start up new sources of income thanks to their drive to improve their standard of living and provide better economic conditions for their family´s future. .

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the roof of her house and expand the living room.

loans.name: Ilusion 1 Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la señora Cecilia G. García, que es integrante del grupo ILUSION I, ubicado en la comunidad de San Buenaventura Tecalcingo en el estado de Puebla, México. En ella podemos apreciar a 9 de las 11 integrantes del Grupo,  con algunos de  los productos que venden y elaboran. Cecilia se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes que inició hace 10 años, con el apoyo de créditos para incrementar su inventario. Su negocio se encuentra a una cuadra de la iglesia del pueblo, así que sus principales clientes son habitantes de esta comunidad. Solicita el préstamo para aumentar su inventario y en el momento de solicitarlo se siente emocionada porque su ilusión, como el nombre del grupo lo dice, es contar con una tienda bien surtida y poder ofrecer a sus clientes todos los productos que ellos le demandan.
Cecilia tiene 36 años y estudió la primaria, es soltera pero ella ayuda a su mamá económica y moralmente con lo que obtiene del negocio, el cual en un inicio fue complicado ya que la tienda que actualmente tiene en su domicilio primero la tuvo que establecer en otro lugar y pagar renta, por lo que las ganancias eran más limitadas. 
Las demás integrantes del grupo son:	
Inés Álvarez M., Elvia B. R., Araceli García Q., Felicitas G. García, Marcelina M. Juárez, Ana Pérez M., Guadalupe Ramírez A., María Azucena R. P., Wendidalet Sánchez M. y María Leonor S. S..
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Cecilia G. García’s house. She is a member of the ILUSION (Illusion) group, located in San Buenaventura Tecalcingo, Puebla, México. In the photo, we can see 9 of the 11 members of the group with some of the products they make or sell. Cecilia has had a grocery store for the past 10 years; she has used loans to increase her stock inventory. Her store is located a block from the town’s church so its main customers are residents of the area. She is asking for funds to increase her stock inventory and she is thrilled because her illusion, as the group name suggests, is to have a well-stocked store and be able to offer her customers all the products they ask for. Ceilia is 36 years old and finished elementary school; she is single, but she supports her mother both economically and emotionally with her earnings from the store. At the beginning, her business was pretty complicated because the store that she now has in her home was originally somewhere else and she had to pay rent thereby decreasing her profits. The remaining group members are: Inés Álvarez M., Elvia B. R., Araceli García Q., Felicitas G. García, Marcelina M. Juárez, Ana Pérez M., Guadalupe Ramírez A., María Azucena R. P., Wendidalet Sánchez M. and María Leonor S. S..

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase store's stock inventory.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is a 27-year-old married man and the father of two children. His lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Three years ago, he decided to open his barber shop because he learned the hairdressing occupation from his previous job. He became a talented hairdresser and decided to work for himself. He opened his own barber shop and receives clients from his region and its surroundings.
 
Amir is asking for his first loan to buy additional supplies that he needs, such as hair gels, shaving soap, etc., to expand his client base and increase his business productivity and income. He also plans to redecorate his shop so that he can attract more clients. In the future, he plans to open a second barber shop.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies.

loans.name: Gloria Guadalupe

texts.es: Gloria Guadalupe P. A., es mujer muy trabajadora de 37 años de edad, la cual vela por el bienestar de toda su familia. Reside en el departamento de La Libertad y vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 7 y 14 años de edad.
