Gloria se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de diferentes marcas, las cuales son muy reconocidas en el país, algunos de estos productos son: cremas limpiadoras del rostro, perfumes, crema para el cuerpo entre otros más. Ella los comercializa de forma ambulante, ya que debe salir a ofrecerlos entre sus vecinos y amigos, es por esta razón que posee muchos clientes, ya que Gloria se dedica a visitarlos de manera periódica  ofreciendo sus servicios. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que desea poder vender más, así mismo es de mucha importancia contar con el dinero necesario para hacer esto ultimo, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes compran su mercadería a crédito, por lo que en algunas ocasiones esto le dificulta seguir invirtiendo en el negocio. Gloria anhela en gran manera seguir superándose en su negocio alcanzando nuevas metas, las cuales beneficien en gran manera el presente y futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria Guadalupe P. A. is a hardworking woman. She is 37 years old and watches over her family’s wellbeing. She lives in the La Libertad department and lives with her husband and two children of 7 and 14 years of age. Gloria sells beauty products of different brands that are very well-known in the country, some of the products that she sells are: facial cleanser creams, perfumes, body lotion and other items. She sells them door to door since she offers them to her neighbors and friends; she has a lot of customers since Gloria visits them periodically to offer her products. She needs a loan so that she can buy a greater quantity of products since she wants to be able to sell more and needs the money to buy them since the majority of her customers buy her merchandize on credit which sometimes makes it difficult for her to invest in the business. Gloria wishes to be able to keep excelling on her job by reaching new goals that will benefit her in a great way as well as the present and future of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Julio Carlos

texts.en:
Mr. Julio O. is from the city of Carapeguá. For many years he has owned a bookstore in Carapeguá in which he also makes many photocopies. It is located in front of an educational institution. 

The business has a strong clientele, thanks to its location and the great customer service offered. 
 
Mr. Julio O.  is requesting a loan so that he can make the improvements in his store that will provide more comfort for his customers.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and other materials to make improvements in store

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es:
Gladys de 44 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución) tiene dos hijos. 

Gladys cuando era niña le hizo una promesa a su abuela que iba aprender a ser costurera, desde los 15 años ella comenzó a estudiar costureria, después de terminar sus estudios trabajo en una fabrica de ropa, poco a poco fue desempeñando su profesión de costurera. Ahora ella tiene una pequeña maquina de coser y trabaja todos los días desde su casa.  

Pero para tener mejores resultados y mas producción de ropa quiere comprar con el préstamo una maquina de coser industrial. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Forty-four-year-old Gladys lives in the Primavera de Duran (the city limits were originally irregular, with various hills, streams, and lakes, which still exist as remains of a vanishing ecology). She has two children. When Gladys was a girl, she promised her grandmother that she would become a seamstress. At age 15, Gladys began to study sewing; after she finished her studies, she worked in a clothes factory. Slowly she developed and grew as a seamstress. Now she has a small sewing machine and works from her home every day. To achieve better results and more production, however, she wishes to buy with this loan an industrial sewing machine. In the future, she would like to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie O. is from the village of  Pigsag an Cagayan de Oro City. He is 34 years old. Ronie is married and has 2 infants. Ronie owns & operates a  sari-sari (variety) retail shop where he sells food & daily use products. Ronie has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ronie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ronie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ronie is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Ronie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding his business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jorema

texts.en:
Jorema M. is a 45-year-old married woman who lives in Sto. Canonoy, Miranda, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by  fishing and fish-vending business.

Jorema’s 47-year-old husband, Renaldo, is a fisherman and they have seven children who are between 4 to 27 years old. Two of their children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. The rest of their children already work to help support the family.

Jorema joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her fishing and fish-vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Jorema is a member of good standing. She used her previous loan of Php 18,000 to add to her working capital so that she could sustainably expand the operations of her fishing and fish-vending business and it had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Based on previous experience, she anticipates her business turnover to slowdown a bit because of the rainy season, this is the reason why she is borrowing a smaller loan of  Php 10,000 for her 18th loan, the amount she has projected to be enough to continue sustaining her business operations.

Jorema is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.


About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her fishing and fish-vending business

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Madame Mariama O. is 32 years old and lives in Lome, Togo. Since 2001 she has run a general store where she sells various grocery items, jewelry, and charcoal from her home. She is married to a forester and they have four children. 

In order to improve the sustainability of her business, Madame O. has requested a loan of 300,000 XOF from WAGES. She hopes to purchase merchandise for her store like foodstuffs, jewelry and charcoal. The loan will help her pay for these goods as well as their transportation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REAL”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 51 años de edad y la socia es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista; La socia  tiene solo secundaria incompleta, ella se dedico desde muy pequeña a trabajar porque en su hogar ya sus papas, no podían mantenerla, La socia ahora trabaja muy duro para que sus hijos tengan muy buena educación y puedan llegar a estudiar en la universidad para tener mejor futuro del que ella tuvo y mejores opciones de vida, La socia se dedica a vender zapatos en la provincia de Calca desde hace 1 año y le está yendo muy bien. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos al por mayor y continuar con sus negocio de venta de zapatos.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "REAL" village bank. She lives in the Santiago district in the department and province of Cusco. Her name is Juana. She's fifty-one-years-old, lives with her partner, and has four children. She alternates her daily activities with her retail business. She has only an incomplete secondary education. She started working when she was very small because her parents were not able to support her at home. Now she works very hard so her children can have a good education and get to study at the university in order to have a better future than she had and more options in life. For a year she has earned her living selling shoes in the province of Calca and it's going very well. Juana is seeking a loan to buy shoes wholesale so she can continue her shoe business. Juana values and appreciates the loans she has been granted since they allow her to grow and to have a better quality of life, and so she promises to make all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Juana is seeking a loan to buy shoes wholesale so she can keep up her shoe sales business.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa B. is 21 and married with two children (ages 1 and 5).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Epenesa has two years of experience in this business.  Epenesa needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Epenesa joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Epenesa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Asel's Group

texts.en: Asel S. is the leader of this group. She is twenty-six and married with two children: her sons are four and two years old and both of them are at home. Asel works in a sewing workshop while her husband works for a private entrepreneur in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). In addition to working in the sewing workshop, Asel breeds cattle which she has been doing for almost five years. With the profits from cattle breeding, she has been able to make capital repairs to her house and purchase furniture. Asel is applying for a loan in order to purchase more cattle for breeding and to buy plastic windows for her house. In the future, she is planning to raise her children, give them a high education, and purchase a car. The other group members are: Zhuzumkul Z. is treasurer of the group. She is thirty-six and married with four children: her sons are thirteen and one year old and her daughters are eight and three years old. To earn a living, her husband sings at family celebrations. With the help of her husband, Zhuzumkul breeds cattle which they have been doing for seven years. With the profits from cattle breeding, they have been able to make capital repairs to their house and purchase a car. They are applying for a loan in order to purchase additional cattle. In the future, with the profits from cattle breeding, they are planning to raise children and significantly increase their herd. Bolotbek A. is seventy-four and married. His wife is housewife and is also a laundress at the local kindergarten. Bolotbek breeds cattle. Together with his wife, he started cattle breeding four years ago with an initial investment of 500 soms. Now, they have increased the number of their cattle to seven. Bolotbek is applying for a loan in order to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the near future, they are planning to significantly increase their herd. Valentina P. is fifty-three and married. She has a daughter and a three-year-old granddaughter. Her daughter lives and works in Bishkek at the carwash. Her granddaughter goes to kindergarten where Valentina works as a kindergarten teacher. Ten years ago, Valentina started breeding cattle with her husband and now they earn 1,500 soms monthly from cattle breeding. With the profits, they have been able to purchase furniture for their house. Valentina is applying for a loan in order to purchase hay for her cattle. In the near future, with the profits from cattle breeding, they are planning to raise their granddaughter and increase their herd. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle and to buy plastic windows for her house

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta is a 61-year-old single mother who lives with her son and sister in Las Magnolias, La Uruca, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Marta has a business making and selling decorative bags made out of durable fabric. Marta plans to use this loan to invest in raw materials necessary for bag making. Her goal is to produce and sell as many bags as she can. Marta dedicates the hours from 2-9 pm to her productive activity. 

This will be Marta´s sixth loan with Fundación Mujer. The loan consultant who has been working with Marta over the past months describes her as a hardworking entrepreneur with a fighting spirit who produces all her products in her house. 
  -

loans.use: To invest in raw materials necessary for making bags

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa M. is from the village of Santo Domingo, Echague, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Rosa is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a canteen in the community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $63 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony O. is 26 years old and single. He is from Kisumu city and lives with his brother whom he pays fees for as he is still in high school.
Antony has been a carpenter for the past seven years and has seen his business grow. He is applying for his first loan as he wants to buy hardboard for making tables, cupboards, chairs etc. and this will enable him to meet customer demand. His desire is to have a big workshop in the town center so that he would be able to attract more customers since at the moment his business is situated in a hidden place.

loans.use: To buy hardboard for making tables, cupboards, chairs

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret D. is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice, sugar and beans. Margret is 28 years old and married; her husband works in the government. She has 3 children who do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: to stock more bags of rice, sugar and beans to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Yon Khom Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has eight members fR. the Trapeang Angk village in Takeo province, who each will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Yon K. is the village bank president, and has been selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Gnorn Ouch, are farmers who own a plot of land more than one hectacres to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Mr. Gnorn Ouch is alS. a palm juice collector who earns some money fR. selling palm sugar. Although they all try to work hard, they earn little money. S. to improve their family living, Mrs. Yon K. is applying for a loan to buy three piglets to breed to start a new business. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are employed in garment factory, one a laborer at Thailand, and the others are studying in local public school.

loans.use: To buy three piglets for breeding

loans.name: Ma-La-Neh Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Ma-La-Neh” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Adama K. is the leader of this group. The 36-year-old is married to a driver and they have seven children. Adama has been a businesswoman for 21 years now. She sells “gara lappers” (locally dyed clothes).  With her share of this loan, she will buy gara lapper making materials – ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc in order to produce a large quantity of gara lappers. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Zainab Bangura handing over the loan to the clients)

loans.use: To buy materiasl to make gara lappers

loans.name: Arzu

texts.ru:
Arzu H. 32 qoda. On jenat imeyet 2 detey.Doch kotoroy 7 let uchitsay v shkole i doch kotoroy 5 let xadit v detskiy sad. Azru I yeqo semya  jivut v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 

Arzu uje 4 qoda kak yavlyayestsya voditelem betonomeshalnoy mashini.  Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyey mashini. Arzu etomu biznessu nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca kotoriy  toje bil voditelem.
texts.en: Arzu H. is 32 years old. He is married with two children: a 7-year old daughter, who goes to school, and a 5-year old son, who is in kindergarten. Azru and his family live in the Absheron Region. For about four years, Arzu has been a cement truck driver. At present he needs 2,000 AZN in order to buy spare parts for his truck. Arzu learned his business from his father, who also used to be a driver.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Solidaridad Cachimayo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cachimayo district of the province of Chinceros.

Her name is Ely and she is 38 years old.  Ely is single and has three children aged 4, 10, and 14 years old.  She is requesting the loan to invest in her business selling natural products in Cusco.  She is a street vendor who buys Chinese “Tianas”, vitamins, and natural antibiotics and sells them to tourists who come through Cusco.

She is very happy with the loan and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To Invest in Natural Products Business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca; ella tiene 40 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de panadería ella vende tortas, pan, pasteles entre otros más, la socia lleva años en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante, la socia abre su negocio a partir de las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como harina, manteca, azúcar entre otros más para asi poder abastecerse de mercaderia.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the ” MUJERES UNIDAS” ["United Women"] communal bank. The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Francisca. She is 40, married, and has 4 children. She has a baker's shop and sells pies, bread, and cakes, among other items. She has had this business for years and is happy that its revenue is supporting her family. She opens her business from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of supplies for her business, such as flour, butter, and sugar, among other items, in order to stock up on merchandise.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: the member is requesting this loan for the purchase of supplies for her business, such as flour, butter, and sugar, among other items, in order to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Mukama Ayambe Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: Julian K. is a 45 year old business woman who believes with hard work anyone can excel, principally women. For the last 5 years she has summoned up lots of diligence in her drive to take root in an increasingly competitive business sector-food sells. Julian has a grocery store in Mangira-Mukono. She says her late husband was influential in getting her started in this business. She was formerly relying on only her teaching job remuneration. Julian also does some small scale vegetable growing. She says weekly this business generates her shillings 50,000. Julian is happily married though she has no kids. With this loan she says she is going to purchase more foodstuffs and soft beverages to resell at her grocery store. Mukama Ayambe Development Group is her group.

loans.use: The purchase of more foodstuffs and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley A. is from the village of South Mapang, Rizal. She is 48 years old. Shirley is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Shirley owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a general store. In spite of close competition, she has still managed to operate her business for more than 10 years and earns a monthly net income of 3000.

In 2010, Shirley joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirley has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new stock for the business. Shirley is requesting her 3rd loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For the expansion of her business

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris is 69 years old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. His wife is retired and stays at home. 

Boris began teaching his driver education course in 2006. He rents the classroom where he teaches the course. He prepares 15 to 20 people a month to get their driving licenses by attending his class, and charges a fee of 220,000 MNT per person. He supports his family with his income. He is a hardworking and neat person who says: "I would like to expand my course and train more people." He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy spare parts for the cars that he uses for his course.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cars

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos tiene 33 años y vive con su esposa en el barrio de Villanueva. Pues ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y disfruta tener este medio de vida como es una pulpería y brindar el servicio de transporte. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que es inicio cuando su Papa ya no podía trabajar es por eso que Juan se quedo con este negocio del servicio de taxi, pues anteriormente él se dedicaba a una pulpería, con el paso del tiempo es que ha ido creciendo con esta actividad. El señor Juan Carlos utilizara el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos, detergentes, llantas, repuestos para su vehículo y así poder tener mejores ganancias. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, su meta es que su negocio sea grande y que tenga mucha variedad de productos para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes, también nos comento que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 33 years old and lives with his wife in Villanueva neighborhood.  He has shown himself to be a very responsible person and he enjoys his line of work which is running a grocery store and providing transport services.  He has been in this business for more than 11 years.  He started out when his dad could no longer work.  This is why Juan took over the taxi service.  He previously had a grocery store but over time he grew in this business as well.

Juan Carlos will use his loan to invest in buying candy, soft drinks, bread, basic grains and detergents, as well as tires and spare parts for his vehicle.  This will enable him to make more profits.  His business is located in his home and his goal is for his business to grow and have a large variety of products that will cover all his customers' demands.  He tells us that he would also like to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, basic grains and detergents, as well as tires and spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia M. is a married woman with one child who is working. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills and clothing. For over fifteen years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She sells cooked beans, rice and chapati (flat bread). 

She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her area. Patricia dreams of expanding her business and establishing a retail shop in the future. With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of rice, sugar, baking flour and cooking flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, sugar, baking flour and cooking flour

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish and spices to sell in her stall.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more fish and spices to sell in her stall

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy N. lives in the Namungoona neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her relatives).  She has a business of selling clothes and has been in this business for six years, working seven days out of every week. She sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.    

Prossy has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand clothing. The main business challenges for Prossy include defaulters and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand her business. 

She stays in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en:
Virginie is 31 years old. She has four children who are between the ages of 17 years and 3 months. Two are in school while the others are not yet school age. Her husband is a farmer.

Virgnie sells cooking oil and  vegetables such as tomatoes and cabbages. Selling food has enabled her to feed her family and pay the house rent. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more food such as green bananas, beans and tomatoes to sell. With the profits she wishes to start a garden

loans.use: to buy food such as tomatoes, beans and green bananas for resale.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 33 years old, she has 3 children between the ages 6-11 years. All her children are in school and her husband works with her. Chantal sells a traditional fabric called Kitenge. She has been selling these traditional fabrics for 5 years. She is requesting a loan to buy more fabric and make more profits. With the profits in addition to her savings, she plans to build her own house.

loans.use: Buy traditional fabric called Kitenge.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
For the past eight years Helen, a 57-year-old married woman, has operated a retail shop selling both food and daily-use products such as soap, shampoo, and toothpaste to the people in her community. She earns about PHP 9,000 each month from this enterprise.

Helen is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase additional retail items such as cases of soft drinks, canned goods, and detergents that will increase both her sales and her profits. In the future, Helen hopes to have a big business and achieve financial independence that will make her family more economically stable.

loans.use: to purchase additional retail items such as soft drinks, canned goods, and detergents.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Ángela de 54 años de edad,  es la propietaria de un negocio donde vende comidas y refrescos en el barrio Montes de la ciudad de Barranquilla, en un espacio ubicado en la sala y en la terraza de su vivienda, donde vive con su cónyuge y dos hijos en las edades de 4 y 11 años, con los que sueña  que en un futuro  se conviertan en unos profesionales exitosos y esta es justamente su mayor motivación.  Ángela inició su negocio desde hace más de 7 años,  cuando decidió apoyar también la gestión de su esposo en el hogar y desde ese momento con su disciplina,  ha crecido hasta lograr una clientela fija que trabaja en empresas de los alrededores a su vivienda y permanentemente le refieren nuevos compradores. En su negocio vende almuerzos principalmente y refrescos y ella quiere hacerlo crecer hasta convertirlo en un restaurante. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su Credikiva que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará de contado y en mayor volumen materias primas para la preparación de refrigerios que también  agregará a su oferta. Su meta más adelante es tener un local propio y separar el espacio productivo del familiar para lograr un mayor  sosiego.
texts.en:
Ángela is 54 years old.  She is the owner of a business selling meals and soft drinks.  Her business is located in a space in the living room and terrace area of her home, which is in Montes neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla.  She lives there together with her husband and two children aged 4 and 11.  She dreams that her children will become successful professionals in the future and this is her biggest motivation.

Ángela started her business more than seven years ago when she decided to support her husband in managing their household.  Since then, through her discipline, she has grown her business and now has regular customers who work in companies near her home.  They are always referring new customers to her.

In her business, Ángela mainly sells lunches and soft drinks.  She would like to grow her business and turn it into a restaurant.  This is why she is applying for a Kiva loan (her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will use it to buy a larger volume of supplies for making the snacks that she would like to add to her product offerings (and she will pay for these supplies in cash).  Her goal for the future is to own her own business premises and thereby separate her business space from her family space so that she can live more peacefully.

loans.use: to buy a larger volume of supplies for making the snacks that she will add to her existing product offerings (and pay for them in cash)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more timber to make more wooden chairs, windows, tables and side boards to resell.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Mrs. Pich, 30, married a few years ago and is raising two children. To try to earn a living, Mrs. Pich works as a fish seller in a market near her house. To help support their family, her husband doesn’t stay at home. He  is employed as a local factory worker which gets him a suitable salary to give his wife every month. Mrs. Pich and her husband can earn $8 per day. 

Since her business is improving. Mrs. Pich wishes to ask for a loan in the amount of $1,000  to purchase more fish to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell at the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more soap, cigarettes and mosquito spray.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah lives in Uganda.  She is single and has five children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two orphans from her late brother). 

Norah has a business of knitting sweaters and tablecloths.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Norah sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Norah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy threads and needles for knitting sweaters and rolls of cloth. The main business challenges for Norah include transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to employ girls to assist in knitting and also to acquire a knitting machine.    

Norah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more more thread, needles, and rolls of cloth.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 38 years old, married to Mary,and they have two school going children.  He has been running his quarry business for the last four years making a monthly profit of KES.10,000. He has been loaned KES.25,000 with which he plans to purchase another quarry site.

With the anticipated profit made he hopes to buy two other quarry sites to supplement his profits. He hopes to be the leading supplier of stones in Lukenya.

loans.use: to purchase another quarry site

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a hardworking businessman aged 24. He is married and blessed with one child. For the past two years, he has been managing a transportation business to earn a living. He has another source of income in dairy farming. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become business oriented.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Maximo Florentino

texts.es: Máximo Florentino tiene 51 años, su actividad es la venta de cerdos. Tiene más de 9 años que tiene este medio de vida. El tiene todas las ganas de salir adelante por lo que no se cansa de trabajar todos los días pues tiene que buscar el pan de cada día para su familia. Inicio con la intención de buscar otros ingresos, además que conoce muy bien este tipo de actividad lo que contribuye a la buena administración de su negocio. el motivo del crédito es para la compra de cerdos.
texts.en:
Máximo Florentino is 51 years old and works selling pigs. He has been making a living in this business for more than 9 years. He has a great desire to get ahead in life, so he does not tire from working everyday to earn the daily bread for his family.

He started with the intent to look for ways of earning more income. He knows this type of activity very well, which contributes to his well-administered business. The objective of the loan is to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Sam Aun

texts.en:
Sam Aun (in the picture) is now a garment worker. She used to be a weaver. Her husband, Saman is a security guard. They have been married since 1991 and have one son and one daughter. Their son is now in first year of  university and their daughter is still in high school. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sam Aun is requesting a loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to school.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 49 years old. She is married with one child.

Rosemarie has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rosemarie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Kilelu

texts.en:
Kilelu is 33 years old. He is married and a father of three, all in schooling. He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last fifteen years.

He learned about KADET LTD through a registered client. He has been a good client and this will be his first loan. Hhe is planning to spend the loan procees to purchase agricultural products, i.e maize seeds, fertilizers and also to hire manpower to aid in the farming activities.

Kilelu hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activities from small scale to commercial farming. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products.

loans.name: 03.10.113.thiệu Chính Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Nhân is 52 years old and is married with three children. For the past ten years, she has worked farming poultry and cattle. Nhân lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2010 to improve her business. Nhân has successfully repaid two previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women and she is the group leader of the 03.10.113.Thiệu Chính solidarity group, which consists of three members. Nhân’s main business hardship is the lack of capital. 

Nhân is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and to sell in the future. She hopes to use her business profit to buy a new motorbike, to help her children find good jobs, and to maintain her business.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is 29 years old and single. He has two years of experience selling timber. He currently employs two people to help him and his business is open from 7 am to 6 pm every day except on Saturday. 

Japhet has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more timber for resale. With any profits, he would like to satisfy his basic needs, reinvest in his business and build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for resale

loans.name: En

texts.en: Mrs. En is 25 years old and lives in Baray with her husband and child, who attends school. She cares for her home and also helps her husband raise pigs. Her husband supplements his income as a pig farmer by also working as a goldsmith in a booth in a local market. Mrs. En is applying for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy some raw materials to support in her husband’s business. Her goal for the future is to open up a small jewelry shop.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's jewelry-making business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Lourdes has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Lourdes has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Villamor

texts.en:
Villamor is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 
Villamor is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline needed in his transportation service.
Villamor is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Villamor hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline in his transportation service.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single mother of a 5-year-old son. She describes herself as an honest and reliable woman. 

She has been running a beauty salon for the last four years. She provides services of manicure, pedicure, plaiting, etc. She has two employees. The business is in a good and viable area. 

Her business challenge is the high price of the beauty products she uses. 

She will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to purchase Cutex (nail polish remover), weaves and braids. In the next five years, Beatrice hopes to own several beauty salons in all the major towns.

loans.use: To buy more Cutex, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya, sont toutes des femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 29 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de calebasses, du charbon de bois, de la volaille, des bijoux et de l’arachide.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement les neuf précédents.                                                                                                                                                                                                    
La cliente KAMISSA, première personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter, 10 colis de calebasses avec les fournisseurs de Tonna les jours de foires à Fana et à Massigui. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 95.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de calebasses.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are all married women who average 29 years of age and 2 children each.  They all live in extended traditional families in the town of Konobougou, which is located in the Barouéli cercle in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They know each other through family, neighborhood and friendship ties.  They sell calabash gourds, charcoal, poultry, jewelry and groundnut.

This is their tenth solidarity loan; they have duly repaid nine previous loans.

Kamissa, standing first from the left, is planning to buy 10 packages of calabash gourds from suppliers in Tonna, and on market days in Fana and Massigui.  She sells locally, and her customers are men and women.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 95,000 CFA francs, which will be used in part to cover her family's needs, and also reinvested in her calabash gourd retail business.

loans.use: to buy calabash gourds.

loans.name: 01Định Hưng Group

texts.en:
Dốn  works in agriculture raising poultry and pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry and pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Dốn is 44 years old and is married with three children.
Dốn is the group leader of the 01định Hưng  solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.
Dốn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dốn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to travel for vacation within the country, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry and pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Gathoni

texts.en:
Gathoni aged 82(the oldest Juhudi Kilimo client), is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past forty years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming and she gives free advice to upcoming farmers. 

Gathoni practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows, and through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. She really enjoys taking care of her cows. Although Gathoni has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mother. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. 

That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and buy seeds so as to expand her horticulture farm. What is lacking is the capital. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family and grandchildren a decent living and afford her grandchildren proper education.
You can help this hard worker granny to accomplish all her dreams, a loan will get her a lot closer to that.

loans.use: To buy farm implements and seeds so as to expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Nolasco

texts.en: Nolasco is 57 years old and married. He lives in Calamba. For the past thirty years, Nolasco has been a farmer. He earns 10,000 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC. Nolasco is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. In the future, he hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Ecolastica

texts.en:
Ecolastica has a young son and is married, lives in a small house in the city of Escobedo, Nuevo Leon. Eight years ago she started to sell shoes by catalogue, this with the hopes of helping her husband with the house hold expenses, seeing as his salary was not enough. Since then she has worked very hard day after day to continue with her business and keep support her family. Her will power and the love of her children is what motivated Ecolastica to realize what she has till now.

Now she requires a loan in the amount of $200, which will be used to purchase merchandise to maintain and increase her earnings, also to pay off some outstanding accounts. With your generosity you can help Ecolastica and her family. Your help will keep them ahead, don\'t doubt it, they need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Ecolastica tiene un hijo pequeño y es casada, vive en una pequeña casita en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León. Hace 8 años ella comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, esto con la finalidad de ayudara su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pues son el salario que el percibe no es suficiente. Desde ese entonces ella ha luchado muy duro día a día para continuar con su actividad y seguir apoyando a su familia. La fuerza de voluntad y el amor a sus hijos es lo que ha movido a Ecolastica a realizar lo que ha hecho hasta el momento.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $200 dólares, misma que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para sostener e incrementar sus ingresos, además de pagar algunas facturas que tiene pendientes por pagar. Tú con tu generosidad puedes apoyar a Ecolastica y a su familia, con tu ayuda ellos podrán seguir adelante, no lo dudes, ellos te necesitan.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice Wanjiru Nyambura intends to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S. is 36 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 3 children.  She works at a garment factory, earning $4/day, while her husband spends most of his time working in their field.  This loan will be used to purchase more seeds to grow in the field.  In the future, they hope to continue growing many kinds of vegetables to sell locally, and also to the larger markets in the city.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to grow in her field

loans.name: Decina Vicenta

texts.en:
Decina’s kiosk is one of the most popular businesses in the market. She sells ‘abarrotes’, also known as packings or cooking supplies. Store owners, restaurant owners, women, men, and children all purchase goods from Decina’s business. Daily clients visit her stand with a smile knowing that Decina sells products of good quality and fair prices. Seven days a week from 7am to 9pm surrounded by bags of split peas, dried corn, flour, eggs, rice, pastas, beans, seasonings, and more, Decina rarely has a break. These are the staple goods of every Peruvian home. Though, Decina says that the most common purchases are rice, noodles, and sugar.

Decina says that her stand has been busy every day for the past seven years that she has owned it. Many women ask for unique products, but with no extra help, she has not been able to fulfill their needs. She is not married and her two children are in school. Decina is asking for a next loan of $500 to maintain her bustling business and keep her clients satisfied.

Decina belongs to a village bank called “Agua Viva”, which means Live Water, where she has friends like her, with a business and who need a loan. For example her friends Patty Reymundez and Felomina Micuylla are also in her village bank and the three women together are expecting a total loan of US$ 1,100.

loans.use: Decina is asking for a next loan of $500 to maintain her bustling business and keep her clients satisfied.

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es:
Dora is a very hardworking, enthusiastic woman. She is single and has 3 children. Dora has put great effort into improving her family's situation. On her own, looking for a better quality of life for her children, she used her savings to start her business. She makes tortillas, and the good quality of the products she sells has allowed her to increase her customers, and little by little grow the business.

Right now, Dora needs a loan of $550 to buy a scale, to be able to improve the quality of the service she offers. She has committed to pay back the loan in 6 months. You can form an important part of the life of this family and help those who need it most. They appreciate your help.

Dora es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos, Dora ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a su familia ella sola, en busca de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos utilizó sus ahorros para emprender su negocio donde elabora tortillas, la buena calidad de los productos que vende le han permitido incrementar sus clientes y poco a poco ir creciendo con su negocio.

En estos momentos, Dora necesita un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que utilizará en la compra de una báscula para poder mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en la vida de esta familia y ayuda a quien más lo necesita, ellos te lo agradecerán.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy equipment for her business

loans.name: Shu Olivia

texts.en:
Shu Olivia is married to Neba George and is the mother of two children under 15 years of age. In order for her to support her husband in providing for the family, she was sponsored by her husband in a vocational training center where she was trained as a seamstress.

With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to sew and sell dresses. She also plans to train other apprentices in tailoring in the future. The profit will help her support her husband in paying their kids' school fees.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase sewing thread, buttons and cloth

loans.name: Sokhun

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Sokhum (age 49) is a widow with six children; four sons and two daughters. One of her children has been married and is living in a different house. The other five are living under her custody, four of which are working in garment factory, and the other one stays at home. Sokhum’s home is along National Road number Five about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of a grocery store and selling vegetables at her house since 2004. She buys grocery items from the market in Phnom Penh and vegetables from her village for reselling at her store. She and her children work hard to save some money to build new house. After getting loans from Maxima many times, her life is getting better and better.

Now she is requesting her fourth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1000. She will use this loan to expand her grocery store.

loans.use: Buying grocery items for reselling.

loans.name: Gulboy

texts.ru:
Gulboy Karahodjaev is 60 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a High school education. Gulboy owns several hectares of land that were given to him from the presidential fund. The sowing season is approaching, but Gulboy does not have enough funds to purchase seeds. He plans to use the obtained loan to purchase mineral fertilizer, wheat seeds, fuel and machine oil. A portion of the obtained crops will be used for personal needs while the other portion will be sold to the locals at a relatively low price. Most people living in the area use wheat to make flower and bake bread for personal consumption. Gulboy is planing to repay the loan over a period of 11 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Караходжаев Гулбой – 60 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 6 детей. Гулбой имеет несколько гектаров земли, выделенную ему из президентского фонда. В настоящее время наступает посевной сезон, но у Гулбоя нет достаточно средств для засева пшеницы. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести минеральные удобрения, семена пшеницы и горюче-смазочные материалы. Часть собранного урожая он будет использовать в личных целях, другая часть будет реализована местному населению по более низким ценам, так как большая часть населения использует зерно на производство муки и выпечки хлеба для личного потребления. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 11 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and wheat seeds

loans.name: Sara Elva

texts.en:
Sara Elva V. R. runs a cockfighting business in the rural jungle town of Jepelacio, San Martin. Cockfighting is a passion for people all over Peru, including major urban areas. Sara started the business 10 years ago with her husband who has loved the sport his entire life. They hold fights every Saturday night in a coliseum they built into the back of their home. They charge an entrance fee, handle the bets, and sell food and drink while the packed house bets and cheers on their favorite competitors.

Sara is 28 years old, married, and has 4 children. She is proud of her business and all that she has accomplished. She provides a service that is in high demand and she now has a voice in her community. She is happy that she can afford to give her children the opportunity to study and become professionals.

The secretary of the community bank Mujeres Responsables, Sara is requesting a loan of $700 (s/2000) to repay over 4 months. With the loan she would like to buy a freezer to keep various goods she serves her customers. The freezer will help Sara provide a better service.

loans.use: With the loan she would like to buy a freezer to keep various goods she serves her customers

loans.name: Wanyama West C (Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Annet N.. She is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to add capital stock. Annet is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a mechanic for work. She has 2 children aged 6 and 8, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Annet makes approximately UGX 36000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Annet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Annet is joined in her small group by Prossy N., Sarah M. and Monica B.. Prossy N. has a business running a restaurant and wants to add more equipment. Sarah M. is currently operating a local brewery business and wants a loan to buy more brewing ingredients. Monica B. operates a business selling used clothing and charcoal and wants to add more stock.

loans.use: To increase the volume of clothes purchased

loans.name: Thị Liên

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi Lien is 48 years old. She grows vegetable and sells it at the market. She has 3 children, one of whom is a truck driver, while the other two are still going to school. Her husband is a construction worker, to earn some extra money for her family. Mrs. Lien wants to borrow 125USD (equivalent to 2,006,000VND) to raise pigs. Mrs. Truong Thi Toan, 51 years old, and Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thanh Xuan, 48 years old, both want to borrow 125USD each (equivalent to 2,006,000VND each) to raise pigs. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Them, 27 years old, borrows 125USD each (equivalent to 2,006,000VND) to buy piglets. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Chuyen, 43 years old, borrows 125USD each (equivalent to 2,006,000VND) to make brick and tile. Mr. Le Tuan Truong, 26 years old, wants to borrow 125USD each (equivalent to 2,006,000VND) to buy a computer to open a business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị T. Thị Liên (MS 06020006), năm nay 48 tuổi, chị trồng rau màu và đi chợ,chị có 3 con, 1 con đã đi làm lái xe còn 2 con vẫn đi học, chồng chị đi làm thợ xây để giúp gia đình có thêm thu nhập. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Trương Thị Toàn (MS: 06020007), năm nay 51 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thanh Xuân (MS: 06020008), năm nay 48 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thêm (MS: 06020009), năm nay 27 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua lợn giống. Chị Hoàng Thị Chuyên (MS: 06020010), năm nay 43 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua đất làm gạch, ngói. Anh Lê Tuấn Trường (MS: 06020011), năm nay 26 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua máy tính mở của hàng kinh doanh

loans.use: Breeding animals and open a business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Happiness, dedication and persistence are the chief characteristics of Victoria, a very responsible and loving mother who since being being blessed with a daughter has worked intensely with the goal to always come out ahead. Currently she's dedicated to buying and selling cheeses, which she acquires at the town markets surrounding her city of Juilaca and orders from the cities of Arequipa and Cuzco. Additionally to this task, she also dedicates a lot of time knitting beautiful beanies and caps to sell at the city's Sunday market. The goal of Victoria is to acquire a loan to invest in her knitting business, purchasing more supplies. This diligent woman is sure she is worthy of your confidence and she will fulfill her dreams.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Su alegría, dedicación y persistencia son las principales características de Victoria, madre muy responsable y amorosa que desde que le otorgó el don de la vida a su pequeña niña trabajó insistentemente en sus actividades con el fin de salir siempre airosa. Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos, mercadería que adquiere los días de feria de los pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca, y los despacha para las ciudades de Arequipa y Cuzco, adicionalmente a este oficio se dedica con mucha persistencia a tejer hermosos chullos y gorras que oferta en el mercado dominical de dicha ciudad.El deseo que tiene Victoria es adquirir un préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio de tejidos. Esta diligente dama está segura que recibirá tu respuesta y concretará su sueño.

loans.use: Increase her capital so she'll be able to offer more products / Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor cantidad de artículos.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Q. sells rubber and used clothing.  She is married and has 2 children. 
Business is doing very well and she wants to increase sale but lacks enough capital. 
 
She is asking for an additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more goods.

loans.name: Maqsutali

texts.ru:
Maqsutali A. lives in Tursun-zoda. Maqsutali is married and has four children. He practices animal husbandry. He has a small farm where he breeds bull calves for sale. He would like to get a loan for buying another bull calf. After raising the calf Maqsutali will be able to sell it at a profit. He plans to repay the loan in the next 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Ашуралиев Максутали проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Женат , имет четверых детей. Занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит бычков для продажи. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить еще одного бычка. После откормки его он сможет его выгодно продать. Погасить кредит Максутали планирует в текчении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 45-year-old widow with 2 children, ages 20 and 27. She began selling bedsheets in 2001 and works every day from 9am to 10pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $US60 from her sales.

In the past, Rose has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more bedsheets to sell.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Elizabeth Leticia

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth solicito el préstamo para remodelar el techo de su casa ya que se encuentra muy dañado y para terminar de construir la ampliación de su cocina, ella es una persona que se dedica a la venta de seguros, para sacar adelante a su hija y a su mama, juntas conforman una familia de puras mujeres que son muestra del valor que poseen.
texts.en:
Elizabeth applied for the loan in order to remodel the roof of her house because it is already damaged as well as to finish the enlargement of her kitchen. She works selling insurance so that her daughter and mother can advance in life. Together they are a family of just women, which shows the value that they possess.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge her kitchen and remodel her roof

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy es agricultora y trabaja en su pequeña chacrita de platanales, a la par labora junto a su esposo en una ascienda alejada de su hogar, donde se ocupa de cuidar los productos agrícolas y su esposo es el capataz. Ambos realizan su trabajo de la mejor manera y son las personas más trabajadoras de su zona.Gracias a este trabajo, puede solventar los gastos de sus 4 hijos, demás tuvo que superar un problema con su hija, cuando esta sufrió un desengaño y fue abandonada con un niño en los brazos, a quien ayudó y acogió nuevamente en su hogar. Sumado a esto, su casa tuvo que ser derrumbada ya que las estructuras tenían deficiencias y era muy insegura, ahora desea poder construir su casa nuevamente, donde puedan vivir toda su familia de manera segura.Para ello trabaja muy duramente y desea que le podamos ayudar con una suma de dinero para que pueda invertir en cultivos de plátano, y prontamente conseguir juntar lo necesario para la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lucy is a farmer and works on her small banana plantation. Usually she works alongside her husband in an area far away from their home, where she sees to the care of the products and her husband is the foreman. Both carry out their work diligently and are some of the most hard-working people in the area. Thanks to this work, they can afford to provide for their four children and were able to overcome when their daughter was abandoned with a baby, taking them in and welcoming them back into their home. In addition to this, their home had to be demolished because it had structural deficiencies and was very unsafe. Now they want to be able to build a new home where their whole family could live safe and sound. For this, they work arduously and ask for our help with some money they can invest in cultivating bananas so they soon will have the necessary means to build their home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase banana production to earn more money to put toward building a home

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 38 anos, esta divorciada convive con su pareja Florencio de 41 y sus dos hijos Wilfredo de 18 y Diego Armando de 12. Lo que le gusta a Yolanda de su trabajo es el poder hacerlo desde la comodidad de su casa, pero la dificultad reside en tener que permanecer durante todo el día en su establecimiento, sin tener la libertad de salir cuando ella lo disponga, ya que ahora se debe a su clientela. Es su segundo prestamo, y ella es muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero implementara su tienda con mayor cantidad de productos, para satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 38 years old and divorced. She lives with her partner Florencio who is 41 and their sons, Wilfredo, 18 and Diego Armando, 12. The fact that Yolanda is able to work from the comfort of her home is the aspect of her job that she enjoys the most. However, she finds it hard to remain in the house all day long, without the freedom of being able to go outside when needed, now that she has a duty to her customers. This is the second loan she has requested and she always makes her repayments on time. With the money, she intends to fill her shop with more produce, in order to fulfil her customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more produce for her shop

loans.name: Maria Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora Maria Emperatriz es socia del BC La Mujer Riojana, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Rioja. Se dedica a la venta de comida, especialmente juanes de todas sus variedades (de arroz con chancho, de arroz con gallina, de yuca con chancho, de yuca con gallina, etc.), esta actividad lo realiza en su puesto ubicado en el Mercado Central de su distrito, también vende salchipapas y salchipollo por las tardes en su casa. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará insumos como arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceite, yuca, maíz para la preparación de mote, así como papas, cremas como mayonesa, ketchup, mostaza y otros insumos que se necesita para la preparación de sus platos a ofertar.
Maria Emperatriz tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 03 hijos que aún estudian. Más adelante desea ampliar su casa para poner un negocio, así como también desea ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Emperatriz is part of the communal bank, The Riojana Woman. She lives in the San Martin region, province of Rioja. She sells food, especially, tamales in all varieties (rice with pork, rice with chicken, yucca with pork, yucca with chicken, etc.). She does this at her booth in the Central Market of her district. She also sells spiced potatoes and spiced chicken during the afternoons from her house. With this loan of $650, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy groceries such as rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, yucca, corn for preparing mote (stewed corn), as well as potatoes, mayonaise, ketchup, and mustard, and other ingredients that she needs to prepare the meals she offers. Maria Emperatriz is 49 years old. She lives with her husband and three children, who are still in school. Someday she wants to add on to her house to have her business there, and she wants to see her children have careers.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima Ghulam Nabi Group

texts.en:
My name is G. Fatima and my age is 50 years old. I reside in a famous historical place named Yadgar of City Lahore, Pakistan. I have been living with my family for the last 30 years. I completed my education at the 5th standard (grade) and couldn’t study further due to the poor financial condition of my house. I am a widow. My husband left me with five children. I worked very hard and suffered the poor conditions alone. 

I have a decorative embroidery business. I atach the beads to shawls and sell them in cloth markets and earn a profit. I have five kids: two sons and three daughters. My eldest son has a cloth-selling business and my younger son has a decorative embroidery business. My daughters are make embroidered dresses. Embroidery just became our family business. This work gave us a lot. We’re very thankful to God that we became successful in this business and our living standard became better. I have successfully repaid my five loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy material (cloth, beads and colored thread) to grow our family business. 

I am a group leader of a few more women of my locality. Gulzar baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, beads and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy (sugar and cooking oil) for her sweetmeat-selling business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoemaking business. Chanda baji wants a loan to buy utensils to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for her embroidery business

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Mrs. Sao H. was born in 1963 and she now lives in Tasen village in Kampong Cham province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. Her husband, Mr. Horn Soeurn, is a motor taxi-driver who can earn a little income to support the family. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Sao H. wants to conduct her own fried noodle selling business, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy a small restaurant in the local village. She will use the rest of the loan to buy ingredients for her starting business. She is 46 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a small restaurant and ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Clémentine

texts.fr:
Née en 1956 à Grand Popo, TEVI Clémentine est originaire de MONO. Elle est veuve depuis 6 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont les trois premiers sont déjà tous majeurs. Les deux derniers enfants sont au collège. La dame est vendeuse de pagnes et des fagots de bois de chauffage. Résident à Hlacomey, un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou, elle a embrassé depuis quelques années des activités économiques afin de venir en aide à sa petite famille et assurer à ses enfants une bonne instruction. Elle est à son cinquième crédit. Les crédits passés lui ont été d’un grand appui pour elle. Les remboursements ont été très réguliers à son niveau. Actuellement, ses activités économiques sont très florissantes et le besoin de financement se fait sentir de plus en plus. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite pour son sixième crédit. 


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Grand Popo, Clémentine T.'s family is from Mono. She has been a widow for 6 years and is the mother of 5 children, of whom the first three are already adults. Her two younger children are in high school. Clémentine sells lengths of African print cloth ("pagnes") and firewood. A resident of Hlacomey, a district on the outskirts of the city of Cotonou, she has been working for several years at various jobs to support her little family and ensure a good education for her children.

She is on her fifth loan. The preceding loans have been a great help to her, and her repayments have been very regular. Presently, her businesses are flourishing so that she needs more and more financial support. For that reason she is requesting her sixth loan.

The meaning of Alidé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "another path always exists for the most poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa beside Nigeria, where the GNP per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest loans to very vulnerable clients and it is in a group which will soon be beginning a micro health insurance program.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" and 3 pick-up truck loads of firewood

loans.name: Umedahon

texts.en:
Umedahon T. is 32 years old. She lives in Isfara. Umedahon is divorced and bringing up her child alone. She is full of enthusiasm and readiness to work hard to ensure a good future for her child.

Umedahon works in the local bazaar where she sells shoes. She has a good assortment and repeat customers. Umedahon is a polite and charming woman. She attends to her customers respectably and people go far to buy her goods. Umedahon is asking KIVA to support her business with a loan of 1600 STJ for 6 months to import seasonal shoes.

loans.use: to import seasonal shoes

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. has sold groceries and farming tools at Agona near Elmina since 2007. He is married with two children and has received a senior high education. His wife is employed as a trader. He is responsible for providing food, clothing and other basic needs of the family.

His loan will be used to buy additional stock to help increase the sale of groceries and farming tools to meet the increase in demand by his customers. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest and help promote the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to help increase the sale of groceries and farming tools

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca I. is 33 years old and married with 2 children. She sells plastic items such as bowls and buckets. She is a LAPO client and hopes for a loan amount of N100000 to purchase more plastics to sell. She is very grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao E., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Auk, 42, were married in 1988 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of their sons are construction workers, their daughter is a garment factory worker and another son attends school. The family lives in a small village on National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mao’s wife stays at home to take care of their children. Mao has been driving a motorcycle taxi since 1989. Unfortunately, a thief has stolen his motorbike and that has caused Mao to be unable to continue his business. So he is requesting a loan of $500 in order to purchase a motorbike to continue his motorcycle taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to run as a motorcycle taxi business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria B. is a vegetable vendor and village store owner in their village at Casili Mallig, Isabela.
