Her greatest dream is to send her children to school and pursue their education to college level for she believes that education is the only treasure that she can give them. With the support of her husband Domingo and her hard work, she has been able to maintain her businesses that will pave the way to reach her dreams for her three children.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 10, 000 as additional capital for her store. Her hope is to become healthier and stronger to work for her business endeavor and be able to support the needs of her children.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery  vive en la calle Nanagua  de la zona de 16 de Julio en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño de tres años de edad, en una habitación en la casa de sus familiares.

Se dedica a la venta de comida en la puerta donde vive, los días jueves y domingos, ya que estos días se realiza la mayor feria de la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja de albañil constructor.

El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de insumos (carne, arroz, papa, verduras, etc.) para la preparación de sus platos. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Rosmery lives on the Calle Managua in the 16 de Julio zone in the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and their little three year old in a room in the family home. She sells meals from the door in the house where she lives. She sells on Thursdays and Sundays; those are the days of the major fair in the city. Her husband works as a brick layer. The loan is to buy ingredients (meat, rice, potatoes, vegetables, etc.) for the preparation of her dishes. This is her first loan with Impro; the completed evaluation qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced and raises two teenage children herself. She owns a kiosk at the central market and sells children's clothing. Her gross monthly income is 5,000 UAH.

Tatyana has been in this business for six years. She started it when her husband left her with two small children. Being a hard-working person, Tatyana was able to develop this business. During last year, she opened the second location. Her business goal is to win repeated customers.

Tatyana would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to purchase seasonal inventories. She hopes to receive additional income and take better care of her son and daughter.

loans.use: To purchase inventories

loans.name: Ana Ernestina

texts.es: Ana Ernestina C. D. R. D. 46 años D. edad resiD. en San Marcos ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ana vive junto a su esposo Don Rafael quien es empleado y aporta 80$ mensuales, también tiene una nieta en su responsabilidad llamada Tatiana D. 7 años D. edad. Ana se dedica en su mayoría a la venta D. productos D. belleza, pero también posee un inventario D. productos que son los más solicitados por sus clientes como joyería, vajillas, pañales desechables entre otros, el destino del crédito que Ana solicita es para la compra D. perfumes para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Ernestina Caceres D. R. is 46 years old and lives in San Marcos in the department of San Salvador. Ana lives with her husband Rafael who is employed and brings home $80 monthly, Ana supports a granddaughter called Tatiana who is 7 years old and is under her responsibility. Ana sells beauty supplies, but she also has an inventory of products that are on high demand by her clients like jewelry, dishes, pampers among others. The loan Ana is requesting is for buying perfumes for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes for her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is from the village of Katipunan. She is 52 years old. Lydia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Lydia raises crops to sell. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately Php 1,600.00 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to expand her business. This will be Lydia's third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Cornelly

texts.fr: Cornelly est née le 27 aout 1965 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Cornelly est mariée et mère de trois enfants. La famille y vit à Cotonou. Cornelly vend de tissus, des savons et des plastiques qu'elle achète à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Cornelly est aide-soignante de formation, elle mène cette seconde activité pour venir en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Cornelly a une clientèle importante dans des entreprises où elle passe pour proposer ses produits. Alors, Cornelly sollicite son deuxième crédit d’ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle. Cornelly a eu à bien rembourser son premier crédit.
texts.en:
Cornelly was born on August 27, 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married and the mother of three children. The family lives in Cotonou. She sells cloth, soaps, and plastics that she buys in Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Bénin. She is a nurse’s aid by training. It's a second job that she has to help her husband with family expenses. Cornelly has a major customer base in private companies, where she goes to offer her merchandise. She is therefore requesting her second loan from ALIDé to bolster her working capital in order to respond suitably to customer demands. Cornelly had fully repaid her first loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five 12-meter bolts of cloth, three boxes of soaps, and four dozen plastic items

loans.name: Savior Group

texts.en:
Ama is 47 years old and she is a widowed mother with four children. Two of her children are in school. She operates a drinking spot where she sells all kinds of drinks such as soft drinks, canned malts, canned and bottle drinks, etc. She is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide for her business and to provide the children with quality education, but she claims that without adequate funds, it won’t be possible to realize that dream. She has been running the drinking spot for six years now. She needs the loan to buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi and canned drinks to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Savior’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi and canned drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Ahmad has been working as a motorcycle repairer since 2003. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and spare parts for his work. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.
Ahmad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Ahmad first started his business, he had financial issues. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, as well as he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding.

loans.use: To purchase tools and spare parts for his work.

loans.name: Airen

texts.en: Airen’s rice farm in her town in Agusan Del Sur is, according to her, growing well but still needs additional farm inputs. She is 28 years old, married and has 3 kids. This is her first time to loan from CEV and she thinks its program is very helpful to farmers. She requested to loan Php2, 000, which she will use to purchase the additional farm inputs that she needs.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena C. is from the village of Brgy. 26, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Azucena is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Azucena owns & operates a business venture in the food sector by making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling boiled corn. In 2009, Azucena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Azucena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Azucena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Nuo S., 54 years old, is a snack food seller. She operates her business in the local market where she rents a small kiosk for selling her produce. Besides selling food, she and her husband always cultivate a rice crop when the farming season approaches. Nuo S. is a good mother blessed with four kids. Two of her daughters are employed in the garment factory in Phnom Penh. Nuo S. said that her current income is not adequate to support her family and in order to earn extra income she hopes to run a suitable business, but she doesn’t have money yet to invest in it. Therefore, she decided to look for capital on Kiva to purchase a set of music instruments, which she will use to provide a music service for wedding party. This loan will provide her with additional income and a good standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a set of music instruments, which she will use to provide a music service for wedding party

loans.name: Mrs. Goun Touch  Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people, all of whom live in Trabaek Pok village in Kandal province, comprise this particular village bank loan. The group members are seeking this loan for different business purposes, depending on the type of business they are engaged in.

Mrs. Goun T., for example, who was selected by her fellow members to be the village bank president, is a farmer. Indeed, she owns a small piece of land, on which she cultivates rice in order to earn a living. Aside from her farming operation, she also sews (and sells) thatched roofs to generate additional income. Because her business has been doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more raw materials for her roof-making business. Her husband, Mr. Yong Phalla, helps her with the businesses. Mrs. Goun T. has three children; one of her children is employed in a garment factory, another child is a construction worker, while the youngest child helps with the businesses.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more raw materials (in order to make, then sell, thatched roofs)

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna P. is from the village of Ramos East. She is 28 years old. Lorna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Lorna earns approximately 2,000 PHP a week for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lorna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg is a 46-year-old divorced mother of three who lives in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her children live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter, 23, is a teacher, her oldest son, 21, is a dancer and her youngest son, 18, attends university. Uranchimeg operates a plank and timber retail business in her town which she started in 2000 with working capital of 15,000 tugrugs (~10 USD). She quickly gained experience and expanded her business steadily in the nine years since. Now her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 tugrugs (~2100 USD). She hopes to keep expanding her business in the future in order to provide for her children. She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan in order to purchase a large amount of planks and timber for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of wood.

loans.name: Usuvilo Group

texts.en:
Amoni H. is 45 years old, is married with four children, and lives in Dar es Salaam. In the photo, Amoni is the second from the right in the back row in the striped blue and white shirt.

Amoni owns a chicken farm and sells eggs and chickens. He has been in the business for two years and currently earns 1.35 million shillings a month (approximately $1000).

This will be Amoni’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the loan, he hopes to increase the size of his chicken farm, to invest in more chicken feed, and to improve his egg-selling business.

Amoni will share this loan with his loan group which is comprised of sixteen other men and women from his community. These members work in food sales and secondhand clothing sales.

loans.use: To increase the size of his chicken farm, to invest in more chicken feed, and to improve his egg-selling business

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
A young dairy farmer from Chebwagan in the South Rift Valley of Kenya, Anthony is aged 28. He is married and blessed with two young children. He previously took a loan for Kes. 45,000 from 'Juhudi Kilimo' and repaid it on time. He now wants to improve his milk production by acquiring an extra quality cow with this new loan for Kes. 70,000.

Anthony has been farming for three years and sells his milk to Kenya Cooperative Creameries. He also earns income from a small retail shop and a motorbike taxi business. He says that the main challenges to his business are a lack of capital and of knowledge of high-yield dairy farming, both of which he is now receiving from Juhudi. In the future, he hopes to improve his farm by building a modern dairy unit to accommodate five cows, producing up to 70 litres of milk every day.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is a for-profit social enterprise focused on the economic development of Kenya, where agriculture and related activities employ about 75% of the workforce, often in smallholder farms. Through micro-leasing, Juhudi helps these smallholder farmers acquire productive, income-generating assets, like dairy cows, chickens, and agricultural equipment. Farmers also receive agricultural training and business insurance as part of Juhudi’s innovative approach to creating sustainable growth and employment in these rural communities. Juhudi is changing the way farmers do business.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Hangry

texts.en:
Mr. Hangry T., 28, shown in the photograph with his wife and son, lives with his widowed mother in a small village on National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

Hangry has been driving a motorcycle taxi since 2006. He drives from his village to Takhmao market and back which is about four kilometers from his village.

Under his wooden house is an open-air space where it’s difficult for Hangrey to keep out the elements, especially regarding his motorbike. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of US$300 to build a concrete room under his wooden house.

loans.use: To build a concrete room under his wooden house

loans.name: Jenus' Group

texts.en:
Jenus A. is from the village of Carikkikan. She is 39 years old. Jenus is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jenus A..

Jenus is married. To make a living, Jenus raises livestock primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Jenus has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jenus joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenus has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future. Jenus is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which also will be used to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jenus from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Ramón R. le está haciendo falta las barda y un portón al frente de la casa, ya que desea la seguridad de su familia. 
Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de la mejora. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo ya que es muy importante que su familia este segura, porque su vivienda esta cercas del las vías del ferrocarril. 
Don Ramón es empleado de una agencia aduanal en el departamento de jefe de mantenimiento, con una parte de su sueldo planea pagar el crédito.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Vicente Guillermina Salazar, ya que el señor Ramón se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
The home of Ramón R. is without a fence or gate in front of the house. He wants greater security for his family, however he does not have the necessary money at this time to be able to buy the material and to pay the person who would make the improvements. He is applying for this loan because it is very important to him that his family be safe, as their house is near the railroad tracks. Ramón is an employee of a customs agency in the head of maintenance department. He plans to repay the loan with part of his salary. The person in the photo is his wife, Vicente Guillermina Salazar, because Ramón was at work on the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a fence and locking gate

loans.name: Ronelie

texts.en:
Ronelie L. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Ronelie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ronelie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Ronelie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ronelie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ronelie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ronelie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa De Saron 5 Group

texts.en:
Mimose is the coordinator of her group Rosa de Saron (Rose of Saron). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, an area famous for natural beauty and its tourism industry. In this area, running water is not potable and electricity is unreliable (outside of the all-inclusive resorts). Mimose makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband.

Mimose is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing in the main markets of her community. She plans to purchase shoes, pants and underwear to sell. She will use the profits to invest in completing construction of her home, as well as saving towards buying a small motorcycle to help her with her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, pants, and underwear to sell

loans.name: Perlita's Group

texts.en:
Perlita R. is from the village of Magcamiguing in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Perlita is the group leader of a 2-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tulips 4.

Perlita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Perlita sells dried fish in the local community. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Perlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Perlita's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Iveth Ondina

texts.es:
la sra. Iveth Ondina A. G. tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la aldea Agua Caliente en San Lorenzo.
Iveth se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, la cual tiene desde hace poco tiempo.
en este momento Iveth necesita capital para poder surtir su pulperia ya que los tiempos han mejorado y las ventas estan siendo mucho mejor.
todos los dias se levanta muy temprano a atender a sus clientes y cierra de noche, sus clientes la prefieren ya que ella misma los atiende y les da un servicio especial a cada uno de ellos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y asi poder surtir mas su pulperia.
ella es una mujer joven y tiene muchos deseos de superacion y de sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Iveth Ondina A. G. is 27 years old and lives in the village of Agua Caliente in San Lorenzo. Iveth is a businesswoman. For the past little while, she has owned a small store which she runs out of her home. Currently, Iveth needs capital in order to restock her store now that times have improved and sales are up greatly. Every day, she gets up very early to attend to her customers and doesn’t close until night. Her customers prefer her to attend them personally and she gives each of them individual service. The loan will be used to buy merchandise in order to resupply her store. She is a young woman and she has a great drive to improve and help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a type of fritter, drinks, candy, rice, sugar, coffee, tortillas, corn flower, wheat flower, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, soup, powdered drinks, tooth paste, sauces, chilies, salt, condiments, cookies, eggs, batteries, candles, matches.

loans.name: La Fuerza De Cristo Group

texts.en:
Marcelo is the coordinator of his group, La Fuerza de Cristo (The Force of God), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Marcelo’s group is located in La Romana, a rural area of he country dedicated to the sugar cane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home there in a simple structure with his wife and their one child.

Marcelo is excited to be taking his second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his food sales business, a small neighborhood general grocery store (colmado), by purchasing necessary products for sale: rice, sugar, oil, etc.

Marcelo will use the profits to work towards expanding his colmado in the future. He hopes his dream of a bigger and more prosperous store will come true and he thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy supplies (rice, sugar, oil, etc.) for his small convenience store

loans.name: Ulziihuu

texts.en:
Ulziihuu C. is 51 years old and lives with her two daughters in Hovd province, western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Ulziihuu operates a traditional clothing business in her town and has taught her daughter tailoring. She began her business in 1995 with the help of some friends in a small tailoring center with the rent of 35,000 MNT per month. Her dream is to keep growing her business and to eventually be able to afford to rent her own tailoring center with her daughter.

Ulziihuu is a hardworking and optimistic woman who is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary fabrics and finishing materials for her clothes and costumes.

loans.use: To purchase necessary fabrics and finishing materials

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifanía trabaja como comerciante de comida (vivandera), tiene 4 hijos todos están a su cargo, su esposo es cerrajero quien ayuda en la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona villa Ingenio  de la ciudad de el Alto. 

El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de  víveres por cantidad  para su actividad el comercio de comida.
 
Es cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Epifanía works selling prepared meals. She has four children under her care. Her husband is a locksmith and he helps support the family. Her home is in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her meals at wholesale. This is her 4th loan with Impro. Her good repayment history allows her to request a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals at wholesale.

loans.name: Jorge Ignacio

texts.es:
Jorge Ignacio  P. R. tiene 78 años. Es viudo vive  solo,  no tiene  hijo, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Jorge es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Jorge dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Bucay y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para sus cultivos. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de una casa. Enfrenta desafíos son el clima y las enfermedades.

Le gusta hacer podas en los huertos de cacao.
texts.en:
Jorge Ignacio P. R. is 78 years old. He is a widower and lives alone. He does not have any children. He lives in the village of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. Jorge is an associate of the 'King of Kings' rural branch, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 associates on the whole, that in the majority are dedicated to agriculture. This is the first loan that he has requested from the San José Cooperative. Jorge is dedicated to agriculture, sowing corn and cocoa. He carries out his purchases each month in Bucay and sells his produce in the same location. He requests the loan to invest in seeds for his cultivations. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to do well. His dreams are to have money for the purchase of a house. He faces challenges such as the climate and diseases. He likes to prune the cocoa orchards.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Mr. Marlon L. is from the township of Purok 2 Labo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years of age and married.  He is blessed with 2 children who are both school-aged. To make a living, he is presently engaged in operating a videogames business. He’s been engaged in this kind of business for 5 years already and earns approximately Php 10,000 a month from this business activity. 

Just this year, Marlon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program, Marlon has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 15,000. He is now requesting a loan in the amount of Php 30,000 as his 2nd loan to be used as additional capital for his existing videogames business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use and for the children’s education, loan repayments, insurance and possible business expansion. 

About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for his videogames business

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Labo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, M

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie L. is a married woman who lives in Rizal St., Brgy. Zone 9, Talisay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  general store and E-load dealer businesses. Her husband, Erwin L., who is 46 years old, is a Chief Security Officer, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are 11 to  17 years old. 

Menchie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Menchie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 28,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 7th loan, she is again borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of their children. Menchie L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger S. lives in the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 26 years old, single and makes a living by running a store where he sells vegetables. He has been in this line of work for more than three years and earns about 7,000 PHP a month.

Earlier this year, Roger joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for his first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional vegetables to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve and expand his small company.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell to his customers

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta  caracterizado por su ecología en disolución. Su actividad económica es ser vendedora informal en un puesto de la calle de Duran. 

Con la separación de su esposo tubo que mantener a sus hijos muy pequeños. Compro bisutería y implementos de peinar. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días para poder mantener a su familia. Vende binchas a $ 0.50, aretes a $ 1.00 c/u. 

Quiere continuar con sus ventas ambulantes pero surtiendo mas su mercadería con binchas y aretes.  En el futuro quiere tener su negocio en un local y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Flor is 43 years old and she lives in a suburban region named Duran. This location is known for its diminishing ecology. She is a vendor and she has a stand on the main street in Duran. Following her separation from her husband she was left to support her very young children. She purchased jewelry and hair accessories. Since then she has worked from 8a.m. to 4p.m. every day to support her family. She sells barrettes for $.50 each and earrings for $1 each. She would like to keep up her sales though she wishes to increase her stock of barrettes and earrings. In the future she hopes to have a store for her business and to provide her children with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase earrings and jewelry.

loans.name: Gavharai's Group

texts.en:
Gavharai K. leads this loan group. She is 41, divorced, and has two sons, both of whom work in construction and also help their mother run a cattle-breeding business. Gavharai also has a second job working as a nurse, both hospitals and in her patient's homes. Over the last three years, the family has built a cow-shed. Now they are applying for this loan to buy a cow to fatten and breed. In the future, they hope to repair its house, install gates and pay for the wedding of its two sons. 

Saodathon K. is the treasurer of the group. She is 41, married, and is bringing up her four children by herself because her husband works in Russia. Her oldest son helps the family by working in construction while the three younger children are in school. Saodathon makes a living breeding livestock and also works as a nurse. She has applied for this loan to buy a cow to fatten and breed. In the future, she hopes to add a kitchen and a bath to her home, and buy a car. 

Manzurahon H., 21, is single and lives with her parents and brothers. Her father works in constrution, her mother is a nurse, and her brothers are employed in Russia. The family also raises livestock, grows cotton and sells dairy products. She is applying for a loan to buy a cow to fatten and breed. Her long-term goal is to have a dowry and get married.  

Dilshodbek O., 36, is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. He makes a living running a mill, and has applied for this loan to buy wheat and rice for resale. In the future, Dilshodbek hopes to finish building his house and buy a car. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to expand several small businesses

loans.name: Christian

texts.es: Cristian, de 27 años, es el 4to de 9 hermanos,  vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de sus hermanos menores. Desde muy pequeño apoyó a sus padres en el cultivo, pero cuando migró a la ciudad tuvo que dedicarse a varios oficios para subsistir, es así que logra comprarse un motocarro; que gracias al aporte que le dio la familia pudo obtener su vehículo, ahora trabaja sin cesar ofreciendo el servicio de transporte al público. Es de esta manera que se gana la vida y le va muy bien, ya que cobra de acuerdo a la distancia en que lleva casa pasajero, además la amabilidad con que los atiende le ha hecho merecedor de su confianza y estima de ellos. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a mucha gente, sin embargo hay momentos en que su vehículo se malogra, perjudicándole así continuar con su trabajo, por ello necesita darle un mantenimiento mecánico. Con el tiempo, desea comprarse otra moto carro, para alquilar y así captar mayores ingresos para el bienestar de toda su familia. Ingresa a su sexto crédito con MFP, y se siente muy contento de trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo va invertir en la compra de repuestos para su moto carro, ya que desde hace un año que no le da mantenimiento.
texts.en: Cristian, 27, is the forth of 9 siblings. He lives with his parents along with his younger siblings. Ever since he was very little, he has helped his parents farming, but when they migrated to the city, he had to engage in various trades to survive. From this work, he managed to buy a rickshaw motor-scooter. He now works constantly offering shuttle service to the public. This is how he makes a living and he is doing very well, as he charges according to the distance the passenger's home. His serves with kindness which has earned his customers trust and appreciation. What he likes about his job is that he gets to meet many people. Yet there are times when his vehicle breaks down, which jeopardizes his work and requires mechanic maintenance. Over time, wants to buy another vehicle to rent to another driver to make more profits for the welfare of his family. This is his sixth loan with MFP, and he feels very happy to work with his community group. With this loan request, he will invest in buying motor parts for his vehicle which he has not done maintenance on for over a year.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Mathew Sentero

texts.en:
Mathew Sentero P. has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He is 30 years old, married to Nailatei Ene Sentero and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount of 50,000 KES to buy 10 calves and 8 goats which he will rear and sell at maturity.

In the future, Mathew hopes to own a big animal farm and supply the Kenya Meat Commision with beef in bulk.

loans.use: To buy 10 calves and 8 goats which he will rear and sell at maturity.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 56 years old. She is a widowed mother of nine children aged between 23 and 36 years. One of her children is attending school. She is a mixed farmer who sells maize, sorghum, tea, coffee and milk locally.

She has requested this loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. Proceeds from this loan will help pay fees for the child in university. 

In five years, she aspires to have a passenger transport vehicle for business. The challenges she faces are irregularities in casual laborers' turnover on the farm, lack of enough capital to invest in other farming practices and the establishment of a fish pond. However, she thanks Juhudi for the financial service.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ntayia Ole

texts.en:
Ntayia Ole has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the past year.  He is 36 years old, married to Naserian Ntayia, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy 15 sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Ntayia hopes to grow his business and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: C2383 Abateranankunga Group

texts.en:
Alphonse is 33 years old and is married with three children. He is the president of a group called “Abaterankunga” and this group has a range of businesses selling clothes, foodstuffs, gasoline, charcoal, etc. Alphonse is a hardworking and happy man who owns a small business that sells charcoal.

Alphonse will use this loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. He would like to use any profits to continue to grow his business.

The Abaterankunga group thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña María del Carmen, es comerciante de frutas y verduras, tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su esposo don Lucio, no tienen hijos a cargo ya que han formado sus propios hogares, el negocio doña María lo aprendió desde hace 30 años, ya que ayudaba a sus padres a atender el negocio, luego heredo el negocio y desde entonces está al frente de él, realiza sus ventas en el mercado municipal los días de comercio y los otros días lo hace de forma ambulante por las calles, ellos residen en Corinto departamento de Morazán.
Ella quiere invertir en el negocio comprando frutas y verduras para comercializar y solicita un préstamo para llevar a cabo la inversión, que le permitirá tener a disposición de los clientes variedad de verduras y frutas frescas.
Ella desea seguir contando con el apoyo de préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio y lograr estabilizarlo.
texts.en:
Doña María del Carmen sells fruits and vegetables. She is 50 years old and lives with her husband Lucio. They don't need to support their children, because these have formed their own families. Doña María acquired her business skills 30 years ago when she helped her parents in their business. Since that time she has been actively selling on market days at the municipal market and on the other days hawking through the streets. The family lives in Corinto in the department of Morazán.

Doña María wants to invest in her business by buying fruits and vegetables to sell. She applies for a loan to carry out the investment, which will enable her to offer a diversified choice of fresh fruits and vegetables to her customers.

In future she wants to continue with further loans to invest in her business and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: G.s. Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: Yanilda M. se dedica al comercio de prendas de oro y plata y el crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de este tipo de productos. Otra de las integrantes del grupo es Yessica Del Socorro su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y usada, Ella desea establecer su propio negocio en su casa con vitrinas y más estabilidad, por lo que ese es su sueño. La señora Candida tiene 27 años de edad, ella tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Su esposo es agricultor. Josefina tiene su negocio que es la venta de frutas y verduras Sus éxitos recientes es que ha podido levantar su negocio con los prestamos. Juntas han tratado de sacar ganancias de sus negocios y siempre agradeciendo los financiamientos, por lo que este financiamiento que solicitan es para invertirlo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Yanilda M. sells gold and silver jewelry.  She invested her previous loan in buying this type of product.

Another member of this group is Yessica Del Socorro.  Her business is selling new and used clothes.  She would like to set up her own business in her home with display cabinets and more stability.  This is her dream.

Candida is 27 years old.  She has four dependent children and her husband is a farmer.

Josefina has a business selling fruit and vegetables.  She has enjoyed recent success in boosting her business through loans.

These women have worked together to make profits from their businesses and they are always grateful for their loans.  They are requesting this loan to invest in their businesses.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing, rent bills and electricity. 

For the past fifteen years, he has been operating a sculpture selling business, selling at the beach to his neighbours and passersby. Julius faces a major challenge in competition from other sculpture sellers in the area. He hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the loan for 20,000 Kshs, he wants to pay school fees for his child. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To pay  school fees for his child

loans.name: Genra

texts.en:
Genra C. is from the village of Poblacion, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 70 years old. She is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Genra owns a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing and shoes from NATASHA & AVON. Genra has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Genra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products like t-shirts and blouses to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Genra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like t-shirts & blouses to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is currently in a business of selling charcoal. She is 40 years old, married to businessman, with 6 children and all of them go to school. Esther requested a loan in order to stock more charcoal to sell. With extra profits, Esther hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Inviolata

texts.en:
Inviolata is married with five children, all of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.  She has operated a clothes selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Women's Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en: A. George William is the leader of Kamu Kamu Women's Group in Kyenjojo. He is 52 years old and married with six children, four of whom are still in school. George William sells produce including maize, beans, and coffee, and is also a tea farmer from Kitoma. He works with two of his eldest sons selling to grocery stores in Kyarusozi and Fort Portal. He is able to make 120,000 shillings as weekly profits in a business he has owned for 20 years. He accumulated most of his capital from the tea-growing, as well as being trustworthy. George William has a dream of putting up a coffee factory and a maize mill. He needs a loan to be able to buy more produce stock for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce stock for resale

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel T., from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental, is 35 years old, widowed and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish such as sardines and mackerel in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more mackerel, sardines, etc., she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish such as mackerel and sardines

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 54-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two young children. He has been an experienced carpenter for almost 26 years and has owned a carpentry shop since 2002. He works upon the request of the clients and in collaboration with some galleries. He is the main income source of the family. He has taken advantage of a first Kiva loan and was a very good client who made payments on time. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase electrical machinery needed for his work. He reports that this machinery will help him increase his productivity and therefore, his profit, by a large percentage. He hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to purchase machinery

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María Concepción C. R. tiene 51 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad carbón Chinipamba, sector cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 20 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, la mayor parte de los socios se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio por lo que produce arroz, cebada, habas quinua, papas y animales de cómo: vacas lecheras y animales de corral.

María se dedica a la agricultura tiene cuatro cuadras de terreno propio, siembra papa, habas, quinua cebada, maíz tiene 8 cabezas de ganad, cerdos y borregos. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es construir una casa de cemento armado y comprar terreno.

Le gusta tejer, pasear con la familia y festejar todas las fiestas.
texts.en:
Maria Concepcion C. R., 51, lives in Bolivar province with her husband and children.  She has 2 children.

The members of the GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA community bank meet in Carbon Chinipamba, some 20 minutes from our office.  Most of the group's members make a living from farming, raising livestock or running small businesses.  Some grow rice, beans, quinoa, potatoes, etc. and some raise dairy cows and other farm animals.  

Maria farms four parcels of land where she grows potatoes, maize, peas, beans, corn, wheat and other crops.  She also has 8 head of cattle, along with pigs and sheep.  She buys the supplies she needs in the market at Guaranda and sells what she produces in the wholesale market there.  

Maria is applying for a loan to buy animal feed and other supplies she needs for her livestock business.  The loan will help her generate the income she needs to live.  She faces challenges that include crop diseases and poor weather conditions.  She wants to build a solid house of cement and buy more land for sowing her crops.

Maria enjoys knitting, spending time with her family and the celebrating at holidays.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her livestock business.

loans.name: Selaphine

texts.en: Selaphine is 35 years old and has four children who are ages 11-13 years old. She works together with her husband. She has been selling green bananas for 14 years. With this business, she bought two gardens in which she grows different types of food for their home. She is requesting a loan to buy green bananas to sell. With the profits she hopes to make and her savings, she plans build her family house

loans.use: To buy green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 61 years old and married with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Pablita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Pablita requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other fishing equipment.

Pablita has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Pablita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es la propietaria  de un negocio de tienda, que nació de una necesidad de doble vía, la primera fue la de generar ingresos para aumentar el bienestar de su familia y la segunda hace referencia a que la comunidad no lograba encontrar productos de la canasta familiar al detalle y en un sitio cercano a su casa.  Su sueño es convertirla en un granadero bien surtido para proveer a otras tiendas pequeñas, pero es consciente de que su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para lograr su sueño. Esta es la razón por la cual está entusiasmada con un credikiva, porque planea gradualmente aumentar su capital  y ofrecer buenos precios, que obtendrá haciendo compras de contado y en volumen, derivando de ello él éxito de esta inversión. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que Ana hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará víveres e insumos de primera necesidad, para surtir su tienda con mercancías de mayor rotación, como aceite, arroz, azúcar, tubérculos, bebidas y refrescos y así comenzará a darle curso a su sueño.
texts.en:
Ana owns a store, which was born out of two needs: the first was to generate income so as to improve her family's wellbeing, while the second was to help her community, which did not have access to everyday products at a place near to home.

Her goal is to convert the shop into a well-stocked supplier to other small stores, but she knows that her working capital is insufficient for this at the moment.  This is why she is so happy about getting credit from Kiva.  It will help her plan to gradually increase her capital and offer good prices, which she can get with cash and volume purchases, and thereby make this investment successful.  This is her first loan with Kiva partner the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will buy provisions and everyday goods to stock her store with the quickest-selling merchandise, such as oil, rice, sugar, tubers, and drinks and thus put herself on the road to achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy provisions and everyday goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 47 years old, married and has three children. He is able to educate his children with the income from his business.

For the past sixteen years he has been selling second-hand shoes to earn a living. He has employed one person to assist him in the business.

Peter has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has learned how to save his money. He has requested an 80,000 KES loan to move to a bigger and better business site. With his profits he hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to move to a bigger and better business site.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 56 years old and married to Jacob. Her husband runs a posho mill business in order to get additional income for the family. Their children are ages eighteen,sixteen,fourteen,twelve,and ten years. Flora is a farmer. Her monthly income from the business is KES.15,000.

Flora is asking for  a loan of KES.20,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer. She plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and to plow her land next year. Flora successfully repaid her previous loan. She hopes to expand her farming and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Marlen Patricia

texts.en: Marlen lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras with her husband and two children. She runs a small convenience shop that is located in a strategic location and has a solid customer base. Marlen is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase merchandise for her store. She hopes to keep working with Prisma in the future in order to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, juices, milk, eggs, cornmeal, beans, rice, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 38-year-old married man with four children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

His dream is to expand his shop and educate his children. He fabricates metal objects for resale and has been in this business for 12 years now. The major constraint faced is the unstable power supply and his dream is to set up a modern workshop. 

William  needs the loan to buy fabrication equipment so as to increase his daily output.

loans.use: To buy more fabrication equipment.

loans.name: Sulpicio

texts.en:
Sulpicio is 50 years old and is a married man with five children. The oldest child is 24 years old.

Sulpicio manages a rice farm and a fishpond. He sells his rice at the market. Sulpicio grows “bangus” (milkfish) in his fishpond. Sulpicio works hard to support his family especially his children’s education. He requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and feed. This loan will help Sulpicio continue earning from his farm and fishpond.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feed.

loans.name: Tong

texts.en:
Tong (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Phat, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and three daughters. Three are married and live in separate homes, one is a construction worker, one has full-time employment and one is a weaver. 

Tong is a weaver, while her husband is a farmer and raises cows at home. She hopes to continue her weaving business because it’s a traditional profession. That’s why Tong is asking for another loan of $400 USD to buy weaving materials.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: Elsa Maria se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 5 años con esta actividad, ella ha tenido sus retos pero ha sabido enfrentarlos muy bien. A pesar de la competencia que Elsa tiene no brindan el carisma y dedicación que ella tiene con sus clientes. Realiza este crédito con el fin de comprar ropa en general, lápiz labial perfumes, ropa interior, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener siempre activo s negocio y así seguirle proporcionando a su familia ingresos necesarios.
texts.en: Elsa Maria sells general merchandise.  She has been in this business for more than five years.  She has faced some challenges but she has known how to deal with them.  In spite of the competition that Elsa has, her competitors don't have the charisma and dedication that she has towards her customers.  She is requesting this loan to buy clothes, lipsticks, perfume, underwear and other products.  She dreams of always keeping her business active so that she can continue providing her family with the income they need.

loans.use: to buy clothes, lipsticks, perfume, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 49 years old. She is married and has four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Milagros has a business buying and selling dried fish (boneless danguit) in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Milagros would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru: Татьяне 39 лет, вдова и воспитывает троих детей.  В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2003 году Татьяна начала свой бизнес в животноводстве.  Начав основание своего хозяйства с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день оно насчитывает 4 головы коров, 4 телки и 2 нетели и приносит Татьяне около 15,000 сом ежемесячно от продажи молочных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Татьяна обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков.  Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на ремонт дома и на увеличение поголовья в будущем.
texts.en: Tatyana is 39 years old, a widow and has three children.  In search of a source of income for her family, Tatyana started her animal husbandry in 2003.  Having started her business with a sum of 15,000 som (KGS), her business now contains four heads of cows, four heifers and two calves and yields Tatyana about 15,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk products.  In order to further develop her business, Tatyana requested a loan in the sum of 35,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to purchase bulls.  She plans to use the profits from this loan to make repairs to her house and to increase livestock quantity in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and two siblings. He has a big interest in motorcycles. This is why he started his business in 2007, working as a motorcycle mechanic. Ali states that he really loves his job. And today, he’s asking for a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new mechanical equipment such as screwdriver, hammer, handtools and many other supplies in order to facilitate his business operations. In the future, he plans to expand his business and earn more profit so he can open his own motorcycle showroom one day.

loans.use: purchase new mechanical equipment such as screwdriver, hammer, handtools and many other supplies

loans.name: Husain

texts.ru: Хусайн умный и трудолюбивый юноша. Он родился в 1990 году в семье педагога. В 1997 году он поступил в среднюю школу и закончил отлично. В 2007 году он поступил в Государственный Университет языков Таджикистана имени Сатим Улугзаде. В данный момент он учится на 4 курсе на факультете иностранных языков. Он учится отлично и всегда участвует на студенческих мероприятиях. Хусайн запрашивает займ для оплаты своего обучения и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Husain is an intelligent and hard-working youth. He was born in 1990, into a teacher's family. In 1997 he started school, graduating with excellent grades. In 2007 he was admitted to Tajikistan's Satim Ulugzade State University of Languages. Now he is in his fourth year, in the department of foreign languages. He is an excellent student and always participates in student events. Husain is asking for a loan to pay for his education, and is grateful in advance for your kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay for his education

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch (pictured with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband Kosal is a construction worker. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have four sons and two daughters. Four of the children are in school and the other two help their aunt sell food in Phnom Penh.

Touch is requesting a loan of $200 to buy weaving materials to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Nuevo Caribe Group

texts.es:
Doña Leticia es la Tesorera de Banco Mujer Nuevo Caribe, una mujer muy trabajadora, microempresaria exitosa, pero sobre todo una madre abnegada, tiene 3 hijos, una niña de 11, y gemelos de 13 años, uno de ellos con Parálisis Cerebral, y que por su discapacidad física y mental requiere de cuidado y ayuda total; Ella es madre jefa de hogar, no cuenta con la ayuda del padre de los hijos, pero eso no le ha impedido salir adelante, y especialmente darle todos los cuidados especiales que su hijo necesita. Sus otros 2 hijos son su principal apoyo a pesar de su corta edad  y conforman un verdadero equipo que unidos buscan el bienestar familiar y principalmente brindarle a su hermano todo el amor y las atenciones que necesita. 
Doña Leticia se debe levantar muy temprano todos los días, para poder atender a su hijo, preparar la comida de los que se van a la escuela, hacer la labores domesticas, y para cuando ellos regresan de estudiar, poder salir a vender sus productos por toda la comunidad. Ella comercializa ropa, lencería, perfumes, cosméticos y otros productos, que gracias al préstamo de Fundación Mujer va a poder  invertir en más mercadería a para la temporada navideña. 
Esta mujer  tan luchadora tiene sus metas bien definidas, y piensa lograrlas a mediano plazo, tales como; tener su propia tienda en la casa, pero sin dejar de vender productos en forma ambulante, además de comprarse un automóvil, para que le sea más fácil trasladarse a vender su mercadería  así como llevar a su hijo al doctor y otras terapias que son indispensables para él, y lo más importante darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, principalmente a su hijo con discapacidad. 
Junto a Leticia están en el grupo 7 señoras más, todas muy emprendedoras,  con deseos de salir adelante  y que desarrollan actividades comerciales y de pequeña industria.
texts.en:
Leticia is Treasurer of the “Mujer Nuevo Caribe” communal bank; she’s a very hard working woman and successful micro businesswoman.  But, above all, she’s a self-sacrificing mother.  She has three children, a girl, 11, and twin, 13-year-old boys one of which has cerebral palsy and because of his physical and mental disability requires care and total help.  She is mother and head of household; she does not get any help from her children’s father but this has not kept her from getting ahead nor especially has kept her from providing her son with all the special care he needs.  Her other two children are her greatest support system despite their young age; they form a true team united for their family’s wellbeing primarily to provide their brother with all the love and attention he needs.

Leticia must rise very early every morning to tend to her son, prepare meals for those that are heading to school, to do her household chores so that when they return home from school she can go out into the community to sell her products.  She sells clothes, lingerie, perfume, cosmetics and other products which thanks to her loan from Fundación Mujer she will be able to invest in more merchandise for the Christmas season.

This very determined woman has her goals very well defined and she intends to reach them in reasonable time.  Among them are: having her own home-based store while continuing to sell her products door to door; to buy a car so that it will be easier for her to move from place to place to sell her merchandise as well as to take her son to the doctor and other therapies that are indispensable for him and, the most important thing, to give her children a better quality of life, especially to her disabled son.

There are seven more members with Leticia who are all very enterprising and who wish to get ahead; they carry out commercial and small industry activities.

loans.use: to buy clothes, lingerie, perfume, cosmetics and others.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira, thirty, is a single woman who lives in a rental that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past four years, Samira has operated a tailor shop, selling her wares from her home to neighbors and passersby. She faces the challenge of competition from other tailor shops in the area.

Samira decided to join Yehu to access their loans. With a 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase cloth for her tailoring business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers’ future needs.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Aramatou

texts.fr:
Mariée mère de 4 enfants Madame Aramatou est âgée  de 36 ans et vit dans une famille polygame dans la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso) avec son mari, sa coépouse et leurs enfants. 
N’ ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école,  Aramatou  n’a pas pris du temps pour embrasser le commerce depuis à bas âge, auprès de sa maman.  
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par s’orienter vers la vente des tissus et articles divers (chaussures, parures etc) depuis 12 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne car elle vend une grande quantité de marchandises dans le mois.  
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en quantité et en qualité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 3 ans. Après 6 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous payés correctement, elle est à son 3 eme prêt individuel dont les deux précédents ont été bien remboursé.  
Avec ce  financement  elle  compte acheter, 10 pièces de tissus wax et des paires de chaussures. 
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et à Bobo (Burkina Faso) et effectue sa vente dans la ville de Koutiala  à une clientèle composée de femmes et  d’hommes, au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA  qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  le remboursement des taux intérêts de Soro, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aramatou, age 36, is married and the mother of four children. She lives in a polygamous family in Koutiala, a city in Sikasso Region, with her husband, his co-spouse, and their children.

Not having had the chance to attend school, she didn't take long to start working with her mother at a very young age. After having tried several businesses without success, she turned to selling fabrics and various other items (shoes, jewelry, etc).

She's been running this business for twelve years, and is now very well-known since she sells large amounts every month.

To satisfy her customers both quantity- and quality-wise, she decided three years ago to seek help from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso.

After six solidarity loans (group loans), all repaid without problems, she's seeking her third personal loan. The previous two were repaid without problems.

With this loan, she intends to buy ten pieces of "Wax" fabric and pairs of shoes. She gets her supplies in Bamako and in Bobo (Burkina Faso), and retails  in Koutiala, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both women and men.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 70'000 (ca US$ 140), to be used to repay Soro Yiriwaso's loan and its interests, and to help with the family daily expenses. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 pieces of "Wax" fabric and pairs of shoes

loans.name: Roger Raul

texts.es:
Nacido en Granada, con 36 años de edad Roger es un comerciante activo, vende CD y DVD, es soltero, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, sus estudios a duras penas llegaron hasta la secundaria. El empezó con este negocio por la necesidad y el entusiasmo de salir adelante e independizarse de sus padres además que necesitaba ayudar a su familia a salir adelante siempre buscando la manera de ayudar a sus padres. Fue cuando decidió vender CD y DVD cuando tenia 26 años de edad al principio fue difícil sobre todo el hacer una clientela fija pero logro y se siente satisfecho que a los largo de 10 años que tiene este negocio ha sobrevivido el y su familia. El vende su mercadería en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Granada su hermana lo ayuda atender el negocio mientras el realiza las compra de inventario y esta en la búsqueda de mas clientes. 
El solicita el préstamo para compra de CD y DVD por mayor cantidad. Pues le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su negocio. Uno de sus planes futuros es tener un local con mas seguridad y comprar un vehículo que le ayude a transportarse a los pueblos para vender.
texts.en:
Born in Granada, 36 year old Roger is an active vendor, selling CDs and DVDs. He is single and he has a two year old son. He attended school until the secondary level. He started this business for necessity and enthusiasm to make progress and to become independent from his parents. In addition, he needed to help his family make progress as he’s always looking for a way to help his parents. He decided to sell CDs and DVDs when he was 26 years old. At first, it was difficult because he had to find a stable customer base. However, he succeeded.  He feels satisfied that in the ten years that he has had the business he and his family have survived.  He sells his merchandise in the city market in the city of Granada. His sister helps him with the business while he purchases inventory and looks for more customers. 
He is requesting the loan to purchase more CDs and DVDs. These purchases will help him increase his sails and improve his business. One of his plans for the future is to have a store with more security and to also purchase a vehicle that will take him to other towns to sell his products.

loans.use: to purchase more CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan is taking out a loan for her daughter, Ngoc, who is a student at the Hanoi Economic Industry College. She is studying in the accounting faculty.
