After graduation in 2014, she will find a job as an accountant in a company in Bacninh province. Currently, she wants her mother to borrow a loan to pay for tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
El comité "San Lorenzo"tiene 16 integrantes, donde cada de una de ellas tiene la meta de trabajar en forma conjunta, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa de comité de mujeres.
La sra Alba es una de estas mujeres, es muy trabajadora y desea poder trabajar y sacar adelante a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Ella es una muy buena peluquera, comenta que sus clientes siempre están satisfechos con su trabajo y es por eso que le va muy bien.
Alba desea seguir trabajando y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser spray, shampoo, enjuagues, ruleros, peines, etc. Gracias a estos insumos podrá seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes y de esa forma tener los ingresos que necesita para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The committee "San Lorenzo" has sixteen members where each one of them has the goal of working as a whole, encouraging the spirit of solidarity, and reaching the maximum level of the women's committee program.

Alba is one of these women. She is very hardworking and wants to be able to work and get her family ahead through her work. She is a very good hairstylist, and she says that her customers are always satisfied with her work and this is why it's going very well for her.

Alba wants to keep working and this is why she's requesting the loan, in order to buy supplies for her hair salon such as hairspray, shampoo, rinses, hair curlers, combs, etc. Thanks to these supplies she'll be able to continue giving good service to her customers and in this way have the income she needs to help her family.

loans.use: to buy hairspray, shampoo, rinses, hair curlers, combs, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a diligent, honest and hardworking woman who is full of life. She hails from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming.

Monica has been married for the past 18 years and has so much experience in farming. Monica never got the chance to go to college because of a lack of fees, but this never killed the zeal that she had for succeeding, and she started farming on a small plot of farmland that she inherited from her parents.

Through hard work, she has managed to practice crop farming and animal farming, and has managed to take care of her parents and also take care of her basic needs. Monica grows vegetables and fruits and keeps dairy cows as a source of income. Although she has been making profits, she is challenged by timely delivery of products to the market. This has made her profits go down because goods reach the market when they are not fresh, and hence fetch lower prices.

Monica comes from an area that has poor feeder roads, and this has been a major problem for her. That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 55,000 to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, Monica will be able to transport her farm produce to the market and deliver it in a timely manner, and hence it will fetch higher prices. Vegetables, fruits, and milk are perishable products, and they require quick delivery to the market, so this motorbike will be of so much help.

Through timely delivery of her product, she is sure of increased profits, and this will translate to better living conditions and a secure future. Monica is very ambitious, and she is planning that once she has accumulated more profits, she will be able to go back to school. Through education, she will be able to have a more secure future, because education is “the key to success.”

Like Monica, thousands of smallholder farmers are waiting for your help. Go ahead, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver her products to the market.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Flavia has started her small time business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has manage to have enough inventories and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she made good sales since she is the only store in their barangay. Recently she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock sari-sari store with consumable goods like noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and others. In the future, she hopes to mount a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock sari-sari store with consumable goods like noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and others

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe lives in the city of Monclova, here in the state of Coahuila, she is married but is separated from her husband for some time now. She had a job to support herself through this situation, but some time later she found herself unemployed, and, desparate, she looked for a business that would generate the income that she needed. Now it has been one year since she sells used clothing in her community.

To be able to purchase more merchandise and increase her sales, she requires a loan of $200, and she plans to repay it in a term of 3 to 6 months. You can be a part of Maria Guadalupe’s continued project. You only need to make a decision, do not leave her alone – she needs you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe vive en la localidad de Monclova, ene estado de Coahuila, es casada pero se separó de su esposo hace algún tiempo, ella buscó un trabajo para poder sostenerse tras esta situación, sin embargo tiempo después se quedó sin empleo y desesperada buscó una actividad que le generará los ingresos que requería, por ello ahora hace 1 año que se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en su comunidad.

Para poder comprar más mercancía e incrementar sus ventas, ella requiere de un préstamo de $200 DLLS, planeando cubrirlo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tu puedes ser parte de la continuación del proyecto de María Guadalupe, sólo hace falta que te decidas, no la dejes sola , ella te necesita.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alesi

texts.en:
Several years ago, Alesi secured a ST 750 (approximately USD 300) loan from SPBD and used it to open up her small village store.  Alesi has continued to use SPBD loans to expand the supply and variety of goods available to her local customers.  
With a strong history of repayment, Alesi now qualifies for a fourth loan, and she will use these funds to get closer to her dream of owning a fully-stocked grocery and starting up a bakery to sell her home-baked goods.  Alesi says that without the income from her business, she, her husband and their three children could never make ends meet.  Alesi hopes that with the next loan, she can increase her shop sales enough to be able to save weekly for her children’s school fees and supplies.

loans.use: Buy supplies to stock her shop

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Mrs. Khim P. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and 11 children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.  P. runs a small business weaving silk clothes.  This business generates about $42 per day in revenue.  P.'s husband is a doctor in a small clinic in their village.  Although they make more money than the average Cambodian family, they have 11 children to support.  Three of these children have families of their own, but still live with P. and her husband.  Two more of the children help P. with her silk weaving business, while the other six are still students.  They hope to use this loan to purchase more silk threads for their business.  In the future, they hope that they will be able to teach all of their children how to weave silk clothes.

loans.use: To purchase silk threads for her clothing business

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Children are really into sweets-and this is the motive behind Naomi’s ice-block stall. She knows that she can earn some money by making ice blocks everyday to sell in the school in her village. She also knows that apart from school children, other people will want to buy her ice-pops. A week's worth of sales earns her $100.

Naomi also works on a plantation and, being single, her siblings are always eager to help her out. She grows different varieties of root crops and takes them to the market where their sale earns her $200. All her hard work has paid off well for her and she is excited and hoping to ask for more financial assistance from SPBD. In the future she plans to expand her plantation and also her food stall. She is asking for a $1,200 loan to expand and buy more material for her current ice-block stall.

loans.use: To purchase plastic bags, cool aid, sugar, cement, timber, sand and an iron roof for her ice block stall.

loans.name: Rita Pascoal

texts.pt:
Rita Pascoal T. is a member of the Raquelina group, along with Ms. Amélia Xavier Chirindza. They both started the program in 2004, receiving loans of 960 and 1520 meticals [Mozambique currency] respectively, as their first loans. Rita sells beverages and basics at the market in Matola. They are now on their 9th loan cycle, receiving 12,920 and 7,640 meticals respecitively. Their businesses have grown continuously and they have both improved their housing conditions and the education of their children.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Rita Pascoal T. é membro do grupo Raquelina a par da senhora Amélia Xavier Chirindza. Ambas entraram no programa em 2004 tendo tomado 960MT e 1520MT, respectivamente, como 1º empréstimo. A primeira vende bebidas e a segunda frangos e produtos de 1ª necessidade no mercado 19 de Outubro na Matola. Vão já para o 9º ciclo de empréstimo e vão tomar 12.920MT e 7.640Mt, respectivamente. Têm evoluído contínuamente, tendo conseguido ambas melhorar as condições de habitação e educação dos filhos.

loans.use: Business support.

loans.name: Janeth Bethy

texts.es:
Janeth is 32 years old and she sells groceries in the market in Sacaba. She has 3 children, who are 6, 9, and 11 years old, all school-aged. Her husband is a taxi driver. They live in a single-family home.

The business is grocery sales and she has more than 4 years of experience in it. She sells a variety of products: noodles, rice, canned goods, chuño (a type of freeze-dried potato), spices, different types of corn, condiments, macaroni, sodas, cereals, chilies, cooking oil, and other common food products. Business is good and there is much demand. There is a lot of competition in Sacaba’s market. Everyone is always trying to sell but Janeth’s business is well stocked and her prices are always a little lower than those of other vendors, and that is how she is able to sell so much merchandise. The prices of some products are lower because she buys them at whole-sale price.

Janeth has credit history with Agrocapital, works loyally with the institution, and has paid her loans on time. She was very shy about having her photo taken and that is why she does not appear in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

JANETH DE 32 AÑOS DE EDAD SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ABARROTES EN EL MERCADO DE SACABA. TIENE 3 HIJOS DE 6,9 Y 11 AÑOS, TODOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR EL ESPOSO NO PARTICIPO DEL CREDITO POR MOTIVOS DE VIAJE, ÉL SE DEDICA AL AUTOTRANSPORTE VIVEN EN SACABA EN CASA FAMILIAR. EL NEGOCIO ES LA VENTA DE ABARROTES CUENTA CON MAS DE 4 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA VENDE DIFERENTES PRODUCTOS FIDEOS, ARROZ, CONSERVAS, CHUÑO, ESPECIAS, MAICES, CONDIMENTOS, MACARRONES, REFRESCOS EN BOLSA, CEREALES, PICANTES,ACEITE Y OTROS PRODUCTOS QUE SON DE LA CANASTA FAMILIAR TIENE UN NEGOCIO BUENO Y SOBRE TODO CON MUCHA DEMANDA. LA COMPETENCIA ES MARCADA YA QUE EN EL MERCADO DE SACABA TODOS SIEMPRE ESPERAN VENDER PERO EL NEGOCIO DE LA CLIENTE ES MUY SURTIDO Y SIEMPRE TIENE PRECIOS UN POCO MAS BAJOS QUE LOS OTROS, ESTO ES LA BASE PARA QUE PUEDA VENDER MUCHO MAS LOS PRODUCTOS. LOS PRECIOS SON MENORES EN ALGUNOS PRODUCTOS YA QUE ELLA COMPRA AL POR MAYOR LA CLIENTE CUENTA CON EXPERIENCIA CREDITICIA EN NUESTRA INSTITUCION ESTA FIDELIZADA A TRABAJAR CON AGROCAPITAL, ES UNA CLIENTE NORMAL EN SUS CANCELACIONES. SE HACE NOTAR QUE LA CLIENTE SE ENCONTRABA MUY SUCEPTIBLE A QUE LE SAQUEN LA FOTO POR LO QUE PREFIRIÓ NO SALIR EN LA MISMA.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a grocery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the municipal licence and add stock for his shop.

loans.name: Fosseni

texts.en: Fosseni K. is a 34-year-old married man. His wife is a housewife. He has a 5-year-old child who attends school. He has been selling rice, beans and rubber for 9 years. He stopped going to school early, but has since found his way forward with this business, which has been doing very well. With the first loan from the AE&I micro credit program and the capital he had earned and set aside from his business, he was able to buy a taxi. Fosseni is a courageous man who pays for his family's household expenses, his child's school fees and his brothers’ needs. He will use the loan to purchase more goods to increase his stock in order to earn enough money to buy another taxi with the profit.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Mrs. Maruja, is a very cheerful and popular business woman in the market "Baratillo", in the city of Cusco, although she is from Juliaca. For 7 years now , she has been in the business of selling used shoes. When she began her business she was only involved in fixing them with the help of her husband, Octavio, who in his days off serves as a master builder (bricklayer). Despite the commitment to their work, the money they brought in was not enough for the needs and expenses of their six dear children. And, it is for this reason that these parents decided to venture into the business of buying and selling used shoes. At first, the business did not appear to be very profitable, but little by little with great determination and hardwork, they have the satisfaction of providing education and support to their family. This couple's wish is to increase the size of their business. Please let your heart answer the plea for this loan. Mrs. Maruja awaits your response with joy.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Maruja, es una mujer muy alegre y popular dentro del mercado “Baratillo” de la ciudad de Cusco, ella es natural de Juliaca pero su negocio se desarrolla en esa visitada ciudad.Desde hace 7 años está dedicada a la comercialización de zapatillas usadas, en un inicio sólo se dedicaba a arreglarlos con apoyo de su esposo, Octavio, quien en sus días libres se desempeña como maestro de obras ( albañil), a pesar del empeño con el que desenvolvían el dinero que obtenían no era suficiente para los gastos que demandaban sus seis queridos hijos.Es por ese motivo que estos ejemplares padres decidieron incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de zapatillas usadas, en principio este negocio no parecía ser muy rentable pero poco a poco con mucha voluntad fueron sacando adelante este proyecto, actualmente tienen la satisfacción de brindarles educación y tranquilidad a los miembros de su hogar.El deseo de esta pareja es aumentar el monto de capital de su negocio, con ese propósito recurre a tu buen corazón haciéndote la petición de un préstamo. Doña Maruja espera con alegría tu respuesta.

loans.use: Additional capital in order increase their shoe inventory and grow their business. (Incremento de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de zapatillas.)

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour A. is married with 5 children. She is 44 years old and has been in business since 1990. She sells fish and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She spent a year learning the trade. Favour buys river fish and sells them; but because some of her customers want it dried, she goes the extra length to smoke some on the fire for them, and her customers really appreciate it. She needs the loan amount of $600 to buy river fish for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish for sale

loans.name: Niaz Din

texts.en: Niaz Din lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single. His father died 3 years ago during the war, so he is supporting his family. He has a shop where he sells construction supplies. He needs to complete his stock so he wants to take out an individual loan to complete materials lacking in his inventory so as to make a good monthly income to help his family and make a better future for himself.

loans.use: To complete materials lacking in his inventory

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is a very hard-working woman. Her and her partner work cultivating potato and maize. Their most urgent need right now is of fertilizers and medicines which will help to look after their products and will allow the earth to give them excellent vegetables as the market requires.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maribel, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora.Ella y su pareja se dedican al cultivo de papa y maíz, su necesidad más urgente ahora es comprar fertilizantes, abonos y medicinas para el cuidado de sus productos a fin de que sus terrenos puedan producir excelentes vegetales acorde a la exigencia del mercado.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers/Compra de abonos y fertilizantes.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en: Adjowa A. sells palm oil. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Adjowa and her four children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with two children. She runs a business selling clothing and shoes in a spacious kiosk located at the busy central market. Galina has been in business for 16 years. Presently, she has about $5,000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $2000.

Galina is constantly looking for new ideas and products that would make her business more profitable, and she is consistently growing and developing as an entrepreneur. She values every customer and tries to do her best to meet their needs. Galina has gained a reputation as a committed and responsible market vendor among her clients. She has promptly repaid all loans that she has received from "Nadiya Ukraine". Galina would like to receive a loan for 2000 Grivnas to purchase seasonal clothing for the summer season. She is planning to purchase clothing in bulk so she will have plenty to attract new customers. Galina is an experienced bookkeeper. She knows all the tricks of this business and works hard to earn more profit so that she can provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To increase seasonal assortment of inventory

loans.name: Selina's Mkombozi Group

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman with one child, aged 24. She sells vegetables every day from 6am to 12pm. She can earn a monthly profit of about $US300 from her sales.

Selina now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Mwajuma, who has a business selling tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Mrs. Ro Mao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Our village bank which consists of fifteen members is located in Thmey Khmer Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, and they plan to use the loan for maN. different purposes. Mrs. Ro M. is the village bank president who raises two cows and thirty chickens. In addition to running the village bank, she is a tailor in the local village. So far her business has been extremely successful so she has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy more fabrics. Without the loan she will be unable to meet the need of her consumers' demand. Mrs. Ro M. is a 45-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the remaining two are attending school. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fabrics in order to meet the need of her consumers' demand in order to process into clothes.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer que desde muy joven tuvo que afrontar sus limitaciones para poder caminar, debido a una fuerte caída que sufrió en su chacra, ahora camina cojeando.  Pero esto no impidió que siquiera adelante con su ritmo de vida, gracias a Dios, nos dice, ahora tiene una familia que le ayuda en todo.  Sin embargo, por su dificultad en caminar, se dedica a la crianza de vacas, por las que obtiene leche que vende dentro de su comunidad.  Ahora desea incrementar su negocio de venta de leche, pero sus nuevas terneritas aun están pequeñas, entonces tiene pensado adquirir una vaca más, pero no cuenta con el capital para hacerlo y solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la comprar de esta.   Ella espera que usted sea de las personas que pueda apoyarla para seguir adelante como madre y como trabajadora.
texts.en:
Rosa is a woman who, from a very young age, had to confront limitations to be able to walk. Because she suffered a sharp fall at her farm, she now walks a limp. But even that did not stop her from going forward with her pace of life. She thanks God that she now has a family who helps her with everything. However, because of her difficulty with walking, Rosa raises cows and sells the milk she collects within her community. She now wants to increase her business selling milk, but her new calves are still small. Therefore, Rosa plans to buy one more cow, but does not have the capital to do so. She requests a loan of 1,000 soles for this purchase. She hopes that there are people who can support this so that she can carry on as a mother and as a worker.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an additional cow to sell its milk

loans.name: Naiseam

texts.en:
Mrs. Naiseam E., who is 28 years old, lives in the village of Eysan Meanchey in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Chin Sim, pictured on the left of the photo, are both farmers; more specifically, they own a plot of land upon which they cultivate both rice and vegetables. In addition, they have two children, both of whom are too young to work or study.

On their plantation, they face an obstacle in that their rice field has infertile soil, which adversely affects their crops. In order to address this problem, Mrs. Naiseam E. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers in order to make her land more productive and to thereby grow more crops. In turn, she hopes to generate an increase in her family's income and to improve her famiy's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To increase their crop yield by purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS VIOLETAS”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Rioja, distrito de Nueva Cajamarca. Se dedica a la venta de dulces como roscas dulces, kekes, suspiros, biscochos. Esta actividad lo desarrolla en la esquina del mercado, ya que es una avenida muy concurrida.  

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, lo cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diariamente dulces como, kekes, tortas, roscas, piononos, alfajores, suspiros, y otros tipos de dulces, también comprará bebidas como gaseosas de distintos sabores, tamaños y  marcas  y así satisfacer la gran demanda de sus clientes.  

La señora Santos  tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos, es separada y vive con sus 2 últimos hijos quienes son la razón de su lucha constante. Su meta es surtir su puesto de venta que acaba de comprar en uno de los mercados de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos belongs to the Las Violetas (The Violets) Village Bank and lives in the City of Rioja in Nueva Cajamarca, San Martin, Peru. She sells sweets such as sweet baked ring cakes, cakes, and sweet breads. She sells on the corner of the market since it is a high-traffic area. With this $650 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase sweets such as cupcakes, cakes, ring cakes, Swiss rolls, and other types of sweets; she will also buy beverages like different flavors, sizes and brands of soft drinks in order to meet the demands of her customers. Mrs. Santos is 40 years old and the mother of 6 children. She is separated from her spouse and lives with her youngest two children who inspire her to keep working. Her goal is to stock her shop that she recently purchased in one of the city markets.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cupcakes, cakes, ring cakes, Swiss rolls, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Jamila Bakhtayar Ahmad Group

texts.en:
I am Jamila and I am a 24-year-old married lady. I reside in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrine. Many people come to visit the city of shrines. I feel I got a blessing from God to live in this city.  I completed my education in the 8th standard (grade). I own a two-room brick house in which I have lived with my family for the past 9 years. I have three more members in my family there. I am a mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Both of my children are in kindergarten. My husband is a fruit seller with experience of 3 years. My brother-in-law also lives with us. He has a clothing business with experience of 2 years. He buys clothing from a famous city Multan and sells in big markets of Pakpattan. I am applying for a loan to expand my brother-in-law’s clothing business. 

I am a group leader of a few more members of my locality. Azra parveen baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Suraiya baji and Hafizan baji each want a loan to buy wheat to resell. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business. Asia parveen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothing-selling business

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en: K. Ruth is the leader of Victory group in Kampala. She is a hard-working businesswoman with a retail shop that she has been running for 6 years now. She is grateful that she has seen her shop grow from a very small shop selling a few items to a much bigger shop that has increased in capital and the amount of products to be sold. In her shop she sells cereals, oils, maize, and wheat flour plus bread and so much more. With the loan, she plans to increase the quantity of products in her shop for more profits.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Gladys Predesvinda

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Predesvinda S. D. A., tiene 51 años, vive en   La Urb. Libertad, Distrito Trujillo,  provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Curso estudios D. fisioterapia, carrera que no culmino debido a que se caso. Tiene 03 hijas que dependen enteramente D. ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa para niños, se inicio en el negocio con la venta D. cerveza y ropa D. niños, luego en un restaurante que cerro debido a que se enfermo, ahora solo se dedica a la venta D. ropa y cerveza, el cual le da muchas ganancias, su negocio se desarrollo en su propia casa.
Con este primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Cielo II”, lo invirtió en la compra D. cerveza.
Con el crédito D. 750 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra D. cerveza y ropa D. niños.
Gladys sueña con tener una dulcería y un stand para venta D. ropa.
texts.en:
Gladys Predesvinda S. D. A. is 51 years old and lives in the Libertad neighborhood in Trujillo, La Libertad, Peru. She studied physical therapy for a while but had to quit her studies when she got married. She has three daughters who are dependent on her. She works selling children's clothing; she began her business selling beer and children's clothing and later started a restaurant that she had to close when she got sick. Now she only sells clothing and beer which gives her a good income; she developed her business out of her own home. With her first loan of $100 that she received from Cielo II (Heaven II) village bank, she invested in the purchase of beer. With this $250 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of beer and children's clothing. Gladys dreams of one day running a candy store and putting up a stand where she can sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer and children's clothing to sell; Gladys dreams of running a candy shop and putting up a stand where she can sell clothing

loans.name: Ibrogim

texts.en:
O. Ibrogim lives in the B. Gafurov region. He is married and has 3 children. Ibrogim has the reputation of a hard-working and good father since he considers family stability as the main aim in life. He works in a collective farm but livestock brings in the general family income.

Ibrogim raises and sells livestock. His wife helps him in taking care of the animals. Ibrogim asks KIVA for the business support loan of 3000 STJ for 8 months to purchase a pedigreed bull. Ibrogim thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best in future.

loans.use: to purchase a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Since 2005, Ebenezer B. primarily sells clothing goods including handbags, shoes and jeans in Kissi near Elmina. He has one child and received schooling through the third stage.  He is primarily responsible for paying school fees and bills. His loan will be used to expand the business and potentially sell more products.  The goal of the loan is to reinvest the money into the business in order to promote expansion and success.

loans.use: To expand the business and potentially sell more products.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas I. rears poultry birds. She started this business six years ago. She is 64 years old and married with six children.

Dorcas is requesting for the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more poultry birds. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde braids and styles hair. She also sells hair extensions and kerosene. She hopes for the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. Kehinde is 40 years old and married with three children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Nzovwe '1' C Group

texts.en:
For many years, Subira has owned a small shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently earns very little monthly profit. Daily she works at her business.

Subira is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add to her current stock to improve her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Subira is 34 years old, married, and has three children aged 12, 7 and 7. She also cares for four additional dependents.

Subira will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Maria, who has her own small business selling maize in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items to add to her current stock

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana M. S. owns a small grocery store. She is married and has three children and four grandchildren. Mrs. S. has experienced a life of many obstacles, as she lives with Lupus disease, her husband is bedridden, and her granddaughter was recently diagnosed with breast cancer. Two more of her grandchildren have just finished school, but as yet they have been unable to find work. As a result, Mrs. S. supports the entire family.

She has owned her small grocery store for over 25 years, and it is one of the family's main sources of income. Additionally, the family rents houses to people in the neighborhood. While she has a steady source of income, Mrs. S. explains that the money earned is barely enough to cover the medical and living expenses of the family.

Despite these difficulties, Mrs. S. has been a long-time client of the Fundación Paraguaya and is always prompt with her loan payments. She thanks the Fundación for their help, and asks for their continued support of her business and of her family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery-store merchandise

loans.name: Ameena Haq Nawaz Group

texts.en:
This group has 5 members. The leader, Ameena baji, is a widow and has lived in Vehari, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband died in an accident. She had no financial resources but she never lost courage. She started an embroidered clothes business. Through this business she able to send her kids to school and pay off the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and clothes) to expand her business.  Noor Fatima baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Zeba and Syeda baji each want a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and clothes) for their embroidered clothes business. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy rice sacks to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee the other loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to buy material for preparing embroidered dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow sweet potatoes

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold manages a typical village store business in their simple place of Barangay Catabban Burgos, Isabela. According to him, managing a store is of big help in maintaining some important family resources such farming, and other alternative businesses.

Arnold now is 40 years old and is patiently doing his best to give his family enough financial support. He is married to Janet, 39 years old. Her accompaniment in their humble store is a great help, said Arnold. They are lucky because they are blessed with three children who are in their high school studies. His dream is to sustain his business to give his family a progressive and stable living condition.

Arnold is hoping that through this Kiva loan, he will be able to generate additional business capital of PHP 12,000 to purchase added merchandise.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 45-year-old woman. She is married and is the mother of two children, all of whom are in school in the community where they live.

Theresa is a food vendor and sells “waakye” with gravy stew at the market center. Waakye is prepared from rice grains together with beans. Many Ghanaians enjoyed waakye as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Theresa started her operation about fifteen years ago in order to take care of her home. Her food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables and bags of rice to increase her efficiency by producing in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support and to provide for her family and to finance her children education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Isekahingu United Saada Kabadaki Group

texts.en: Saada K. is fifty years old business woman representing her group. She is a widow with two children and she also has a dependant who is an orphan in school. She sells firewood and it is over five years in the business. She is using the loan in order to increase on the size of her business by purchasing much more firewood for big profit return. She is very hard working and courageous woman who is encouraging young women also to work hard in her community. Her future plan is constructing a house.

loans.use: To increase on the size of her business by purchasing much more firewood for big profit return.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is engaged in selling bamboo (buho), cogon (grass used for thatching roofs), and charcoal. Some of the items that she sells are woven products and she sells them at a retail price. To further improve her business, Erlinda is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 20,000 to have additional capital to enable her business to grow.

Erlinda lives in Barangay Research Minante 1, Cauayan City, a simple and semi-urban area. She is married to Ruben, a truck driver in Cauayan. They do not have their own child so they adopted one.
	
Erlinda’s requested loan will help her improve her current business and will assist her husband in providing for their family needs since they don’t have other sources of income. Her goal in life is to “work hard, be patient, and learn how to wait for the right turn”.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Patrick Kiprop

texts.en: Patrick is married and has one child. He has a farm located at Tembeleo in Eldoret. Patrick was introduced to KADET by a group of borrowers. With the loan he is taking from KADET he will purchase seedlings for planting kale and tomatoes. His future dream is to grow vegetables on a large scale and be able to feed his family. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor Y., 30, is married. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia with her husband. To make a living, her husband and Y. raise ducks at her home, earning approximately US $12.6 collectively per day as a primary source of income for their family. This is Y.’s first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Mrs. Sor Y. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, Sor Y. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more ducks and duck food. With the remainder, she wants to purchase one more plot of farmland to do farming. (She is pictured with her husband and her young child.)

loans.use: To puchase more ducks, duck food, and a plot of farmland

loans.name: Janerose

texts.en:
Janerose is 41 years old, married to Richard W., and they have five children who all attend school. She first heard about KADET during an awareness campaign organised by the company in Naivasha town.

She has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for the last 10 years and she has applied for this loan from KADET so that she can start an Mpesa service business within her clothes shop. Mpesa is the popular money transfer service from a local mobile service provider safaricom. With Mpesa people can send small amounts to other people through their mobile phones. For her to start offering the service, she is required to deposit a certain amount of money with the mobile phone company provider and this is where proceeds from this loan will go.

She also wants to increase her business of selling clothes, so that she can have a larger shop in the future.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To start an Mpesa (mobile money transfer) service as a side business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married with 6 children and she is 42 years old. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.

She sells kitchen utensils at retail prices in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria.  She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en:
U. Chuluuntsetseg is 29 years old and lives with her husband and son in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a “ger”. Her son, Ganbold, is 5 years old, and is in kindergarten.

Chuluuntsetseg operates a clothing trading business in her town. She started her business in 2006 with working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD) and has established her business well in the community over the last three years. She has gained great experience as a businesswoman and has built a loyal customer base. Today, her working capital exceeds 5,000,000 tugrugs (~3500 USD).

Chuluuntsetseg is very hardworking and attributes her success to her good accounting and excellent communication skills. She is optimistic about the future and says, “I am planning to soon expand my business to increase my sales." She is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug (~2460 USD) loan to purchase clothing items to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is a 62-year-old widow who has two children. She has been working as a baker producing special Lebanese bread since 2007.

Today, Latifa is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy bakery merchandise in order to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To buy bakery merchandise

loans.name: Norbibi

texts.en:
S. Norbibi is married and has seven children. She runs a small business selling rice in the local market. Her place is located on the main market aisle where there are many customers every day. Norbibi has been in this business for over eleven years. She is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. Her professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure the rapid growth and success of her business. 

Norbibi is requesting a loan of 5,000 TJS to increase the assortment of her selling inventory. She is hoping that this loan will help her venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Norbibi's ability to identify tasks critical to business success, and to set up a system for accomplishing them, will allow her to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of her selling inventory.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn M. is from the village of Pigsag-an Cagayan de Oro City. She is 54 years old. Merlyn is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda E. is from the village of Sumalag, Kinoguitan Mis. Or. She is 43 years old. Gilda is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Gilda owns & operates a specialized retail business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Gilda has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Gilda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Granada

texts.en:
Granada A. is from the village of Overview, Liloy. She is 49 years old. Granada is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Granada owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Granada has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Granada joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Granada is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Granada from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sothavy

texts.en: Mrs. Sothavy K. is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in Trapeang Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2.50-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living. In order to support the farm, Mrs. Sothavy K. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to add to a previous ox for plowing. Her husband, Mr. Phorn Chhar, is a construction worker who can earn a small salary to support his family. Mrs. Sothavy K. is a mother of four children who all are studying.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.en: Ivonne T. is 50 years old, lovely and happily married with two children,all girls.The first child is married and the last is still in school. Her husband worK as a surveyor and they live in Circular road,where she sells her goods of gara clothing (indigo dyed clothing using the local gara plant),shirts, African wears,and pig meat. Ivonne has been a LAPO,SL client for more than a year now,and she has taken three previous loans.With her past loans,she helped to train her daughter in school,and expand her business.She is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 Leones from Kiva lenders with the help of LAPO,SL to enable her buy more of her goods for sale.

loans.use: To purchase gara clothing, shirts, African wear and pig meat.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 50 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a food stall, selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to increase her working capital. Anita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yvonne Patricia

texts.es:
Yvonne tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el sector Campodónico, un sector situado en la periferia de la ciudad de Chiclayo, conocida a nivel nacional por su movimiento comercial.

Yvonne cuenta con dos mototaxis (vehículos motorizados utilizados en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) que alquila a choferes para que brinden servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en la ciudad de Chiclayo, lleva mas de tres años en el negocio y con estas actividades solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a la economía de su familia. 

Yvonne desea comprar otra mototaxi con la cual pueda ampliar su negocio y percibir mas ingresos, ella ya ha estado ahorrando el monto que necesitaba para adquirir su nueva unidad pero aún le faltan 1000 nuevos soles los cuales desea obtener en calidad de préstamo, por ello se encuentra solicitando por pirmera vez un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa.

Yvonne es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, su sueñon es llegar a tener una empresa de transporte con varias unidades y siente que ya lo esta logrando, lo que la pone muy contenta y orgullosa. En la zona donde vive ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos que la consideran una mujer honrada.
texts.en:
Yvonne, 32, is single and lives with her family in Campodónico, an area on the periphery of the city of Chiclayo, a city known nationally for its commercial activity. Yvonne has two mototaxis (motorized vehicles used to transport cargo and passengers) that she leases to drivers so that they can provide cargo and passenger transportation services in the city of Chiclayo. She has been in business for over 3 years and these activities provide for personal expenses and to help with the family finances. Yvonne wants to buy another mototaxi to expand her business and receive more income. She has been saving up for it but still lacks 1000 new soles which she hopes to get through a loan. Thus she is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. Yvonne is a hard-working, enterprising woman. Her dream is to someday have a large transportation company composed of several vehicles; she feels she’s already well on her way to achieving this, something that makes her very happy and proud. She is very well-known and liked by her neighbors where she lives; they consider her to be an honest woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to have enough money to buy a new mototaxi.

loans.name: Fatima Mercedes

texts.es:
Fátima es una joven de 26 años de edad. Dedicada al negocio, el cual ha aprendido de sus padres, que han aportado para que administre su propio negocio de ropa y variedades. Desde hace varios años logro esta venta de ropa que ha venido incrementando con financiamiento, el cual ha logrado el objetivo ya que le ha invertido en variedades como: venta de cosméticos,
Perfume, zapatos, para poder lograr vender ya que solo la venta de ropa no le da por la mucha competencia que tiene, pero no se deja de vender. Con este préstamo lograra la compra de ropa interior, compra de tintes de cabello, cosmético variados, como ropa para dama.
Sus planes es poder mantener el equilibrio en sus ventas, y poder ayudar a sus padres en los gastos. ya que todo esta caro.
texts.en:
Fátima is a 26 year old young woman who started her own clothing and accessory business. She learned this trade from her parents and has grown her business with the help of some financing. It has also allowed her to expand into other areas, such as the sale of cosmetics, perfume, and shoes because she has lots of competition selling just clothing. She will use the money from this loan to buy undergarments, hair coloring, cosmetics, and ladies clothing. She plans to balance her sales and be able to help her parents with their expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, a married woman with a one-year-old child, has been operating her fuel gas business for two years with the help of her husband. She sells in a shop and as retail to restaurant operators, hotel businesses, and villagers. Alice decided to join Yehu to acquire a loan to enable her to expand the business. With a loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock for a new branch in town, hoping to have five branches in the future. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is theft.

Alice rents a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To acquire more fuel to stock a new branch

loans.name: Annet Nalongo

texts.en: N. Nalongo Annet has been running her own grocery store and supermarket in London College, Maya-Mpigi for 9 years. Her current business is a far cry from her first small business designing school compounds. Her success story is a testimony to the fact that with hard work, good planning and support from friends, one can always have their stars and stripes. She still does compound designing though it’s now second fiddle to her main business. She is happily married with 13 children. In a week, she makes profits that add up to 700,000 UGX. With this loan, she is planning on buying a fridge and other groceries for her supermarket.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and additional groceries for her store

loans.name: Bolivia Natividad

texts.es:
Bolivia Natividad R. M. tiene 37 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  tiene 3 hijos, Leonela (12), Cristina (10) y Jorge  (11), vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Bolivia es una socia de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Bolivia se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, naranja, piña y yuca Realiza sus compras cada seis  meses en Matilde Esther y los productos los vende en la localidad de la comunidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de cacao, naranja, piña y yuca. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra incrementar su negocio comprarse una casa y dar la educación a los hijos. Enfrenta desafíos  las enfermedades.

Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Bolivia Natividad R. M. is 37 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children: Leonela (12), Cristina (10) and Jorge (11). She lives in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.

Bolivia is a member of the Rey de Reyes rural communal bank, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they are taking out with Cooperativa San José.

Bolivia works in agriculture planting cacao, oranges, pineapple, and yucca. She makes her purchases every six months in Matilde Esther and she sells her products in the community.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of cacao, orange, pineapple, and yucca seeds. She feels that the loan is a way of getting ahead. Her dream is to have money for shopping, to expand her business, purchase a house, and provide her children with an education. The challenges that she faces are diseases.

She likes to dance.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of cacao, orange, pineapple, and yucca seeds.

loans.name: 05.05.03 Dinh Long - Hoang Phong - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Lý H. Thị (50503006) is a 24-year-old female living in the town of Hoằng Hóa, Thanh Hóa. Lý is the leader of a six-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 050503-Đình Long-Hoằng Phong (050503-Đình Long-Hoằng Phong).
Lý is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Lý operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month from these activities.
In 2010, Lý joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women for 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. Lý plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group
1. Lê Thị Hiền (50503007) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 2,442,600 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 2. C. Thị Bính (50503008) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 3. N. Thị Thả (50503009) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 4. C. Thị Thảo (50503010) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 5. H. Thị Chinh (50503011) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Lý H. Thị (50503006) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoằng Hóa - Thanh Hóa. Lý là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 050503-Đình Long-Hoằng Phong (050503-Đình Long-Hoằng Phong). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. Lý thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Lý kiếm được khoảng 1,000,000 VND. Vào 2010, Lý đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Lý đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Lê Thị Hiền (50503007) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2442600 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. C. Thị Bính (50503008) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. N. Thị Thả (50503009) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. C. Thị Thảo (50503010) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. H. Thị Chinh (50503011) là 23 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Santos Eucebia

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Eucebia G. C. cuenta con una tienda en la cual vende Ropa nueva, cosméticos, productos para niños como leches en polvo, desodorantes, talcos, cremas, unguentos.  su tienda opera bajo el nombre de "VARIEDADES CHEVITA”.

las ventas las hace de contado y crédito lo que le permite tener clientes permanentes durante todo el año.

la sra. Santos G. tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y se ve que le ha ido muy bien, ya que con los ingresos que su negocio le a generado a salido adelante.
Santos apoya a sus padres en lo necesario para la casa ya que por los momentos esta soltera y no tiene hijos.
Santos se esta preparando para cuando se case tener su negocio bien establecido.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mas mercadería como ser ropa interior, ropa casual y cosméticos, 
Desea satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Chevita como popularmente se le conoce es una mujer muy luchadora y de muy buenas costumbres.
texts.en:
Santos Eucebia G. C. has a store where she sells new clothes, cosmetics, products for children like powdered milk, deodorants, talcum powder, creams, and ointments. Her store operates under the name Variedades Chevita. She sells for cash and for credit, which generates customers throughout the year. Santos G. has been doing this type of activity for eight years. It is going very well for her. She has been able to get ahead with the income that her store has generated. Santos helps her parents with the home necessities. She is single and does not have children. Santos is preparing to have her business well established for when she gets married. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise like underwear, casual clothes, and cosmetics. She wishes to satisfy her customer demand. Chevita, as she is called, is a very tenacious woman with very good moral values.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy powdered milk, sanitary napkins, toilet paper, talcom powder, deodorants, creams, ointment, soap, nail polish, clothes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie S. is from the village of Nabannagan West, Solana, Cagayan. She is 52 years old. Emelie is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Emelie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Emelie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2010, Emelie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emelie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emelie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and/or expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Myrna's Group

texts.en:
Myrna G. is from the village of Pagbangkeruan, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 39 and the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Myrna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living she sells AVON cosmetics in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima A. is married to Joel, 53 years old, who works as a driver to earn his living and also assists in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are 13 to 25 years old. The family lives in Purok Roadside within the barangay of Punta Salong, a part of Manapla municipality, Negros Occidental province on the Visayas islands. Fatima earns a living by both running a frozen food business and fattening pigs.

Fatima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past fourteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Fatima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 16,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, thus lifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing 19,000 PHP which she intends to use to purchase more piglets and stocks of frozen food so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Fatima A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and stocks of frozen food

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIWASI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dina; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la enseñanza a niños del nivel primario, ella es profesora y enseña desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para gastos personales para que compre lo que necesite. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
She is a member of the communal bank, "QORIWASI" located in the district of Cusco and belonging to the Cusco province.

This member's name is Dina, she is 49 years old and single.  She alternates her daily activities between teaching from 8AM to 1PM to elementary aged children and wanting to own a grocery store.  She needs this loan for personal expenses and be able to purchase what she needs.

She thanks those who make up part of this dream through this medium and commits herself to making timely payments.

loans.use: Loan will be used for personal expenses.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret O. is currently in the business of selling groundnut phaste at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts to make phaste to sell.  Margret is 40 years old and married to a political party officer. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more groundnuts to make phaste to sell

loans.name: Bo's Group

texts.en:
Nine members forms this village loan; they are all located in the Traeuy Troeng village in the Kandal province. The members of this village loan selected Mrs. Bo C., a 26-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. Each member of this village loan will use their portions of the loan to support a different purpose. 

Mrs. Bo C. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare rice field to cultivate rice. She also earns her living by knitting. Her husband, Mr. Chea Sarorn, is an iron welder. With their businesses, they still earn less income to support the family. In order to increase their income to improve the family's condition, Mrs. Bo C. would like to ask for a loan to buy clothes for selling, and with the rest of the loan she would like to buy pigs for breeding.

This couple has two children who are just one year old and five years old.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Amancia Isabel

texts.es:
Amancia de 55 años, tiene una farmacia en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín en una casa que cuenta con agua y luz como los servicios básicos.  

Empezó hace 6 años atrás con un capital de $ 300.00 en medicinas, con esfuerzo y dedicación incremento ese capital por la buena atención que daba a sus clientes. Para incrementar sus ingresos también hace costuras a ropas. Trabaja vendiendo medicinas desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm en la parte delantera de su casa donde ubico su negocio.   Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere agranda su negocio y surtirlo con mercadería de ferretería. Y que su familia tenga una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Amancia is 55 years old.  She has a pharmacy in the front part of her home.  She lives in a peri-urban area called Fortín in a house which has water and light as basic services.

She started her business 6 years ago with a working capital of $300 in medicines.  Through hard work, determination and the good service which she provides to her customers, she managed to increase this capital.

To increase her income, Amancia also sews clothes.  She sells medicines from 6.00am to 9.00pm from the front part of her home where her business is located.  She will use her loan to buy medicines for her business.

In the future, she would like to expand her business and stock it with hardware merchandise.  She would also like her family to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 42 years old and married with six children aged between six and 16. Jacqueline owns a pub in the Nyagahunga Sector in Rwanda. She has been in this business for about ten years. The hours of her pub are from 7am to 9pm.

Jacqueline will use this loan to purchase more sorghum to make traditional local beer.  She would like to make a profit and use this to continue to improve and build her business.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to make traditional beer

loans.name: Asociacion Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento ASOCIACION EMPRENDEDORAS es un banco que ya está en su segundo ciclo y el Banco está conformado por 8 Integrantes 5 Mujeres y 3 Varones y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta ropas y otros, y la Sra. OLMEDYS es la presidenta del Banco y  tiene una hija y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos cosméticos de feria en feria o a pedido y con el préstamo comprara más mercadería en ropa de mujer y productos de belleza  y  así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo y la Sra. YOVANA es la secretaria en el Banco y ella se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos  a facilidad y tiene dos hijos con el préstamo comprará más mercaderías para su negocio de esta forma mejorara sus ingresos económicos y aumento de su capital de trabajo. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The ASOCIACION EMPRENDEDORAS community bank are in their second loan cycle.  The bank has 8 members: 5 women and 3 men.  The ladies are saleswomen.  They sell clothes and other products.

Olmedys is the bank's president.  She has one daughter and her business is selling clothes and cosmetics in different markets or to order.  She will use her loan to buy more merchandise: women's clothes and beauty products, so that she can increase her working capital.

Yovana is the bank's secretary.  She sells electrical appliances on credit and has two children.  She will use her loan to buy more merchandise for her business, thereby improving her income and increasing her working capital.

All of the members of this group are responsible and hard-working people who are grateful to the institution for the support they have been offered.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: women's clothes and beauty products

loans.name: Essoun

texts.en:
Essoun M. is married and has three children. She sells provisions in Takoradi. Essoun has attained a senior high school education. 

Essoun will use her loan to buy provisions to fill the empty shelves in her store and meet the demands of her customers. She plans to reinvest the profit from her loan into increasing her business capital.

loans.use: to buy store provisions
