loans.name: Un Millon De Amigos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Un millón D. amigos inicia su cuarto ciclo con 10 socios, los cuales tienen diferentes negocios. Haydee es la Presidenta del Banco Comunal esté ciclo, tiene 27 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos D. 5 años y el otro D. 8 meses. Haydee ingresó a Finca Perú por la invitación D. una amiga, Haydee tiene un puesto en el Mercado 12 D. abril, en el cual se dedica a la venta D. comida.
El préstamo que solicita Haydee lo invertirá en la compra D. mesas, sillas, platos, tasas, cucharas, gas, entre otros, para su puesto.
A Haydee le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal por los ahorros, su sueño es ahorrar para tramitar su titulo profesional porque estudio educación, tambien le gustaría mejorar su casa, que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
The “Un Millon D. Amigos” (A Million Friends) Communal Bank has begun its 4th loan cycle with 10 members, each with a different business. Haydee is the President of the communal bank. She is 27 years old, living with a partner, and has 2 children, one aged 5 years, the other 8 months. Haydee joined Finca Peru on the invitation of a friend. She has a location in the 12th of April Market where she sells meals.

The loan Haydee is requesting will be invested in purchasing tables, chairs, plates, cups, spoons, and gas, among other items.

Haydee enjoys the reunions of her communal bank and the savings. Her dream is to save up to obtain her professional title -- she studied education. Also, she wishes to make improvements on her house, to expand her business, and for her children to continue their studies.

loans.use: TO BUY TABLES, CHAIRS, PLATES, CUPS, SPOONS, GAS, AND OTHER SUPPLIES FOR A RESTAURANT

loans.name: Merah

texts.en:
Merah S. is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. She is 33 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Merah owns and operates a general store, selling assorted products in the local community. Merah has operated her business for more than 10 years, and earns a monthly net income of 5,000 PHP despite close competition.

In 2010, Merah joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merah is requesting her 1st loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock for her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Tursun's Group

texts.en:
Tursun S. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Kochkor, a small village in Isykul region. She is 58 years old, married to a farmer, and has four adult children. In order to earn money the family breeds livestock. The youngest son lives in a sheep yard and takes care of livestock animals. With money received from the loan, Tursun wants to purchase cattle for breeding. In the future she plans to build a house in Bishkek for her older son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” ubicado en el distrito de Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno.  Tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 02 hijos.  Adela estudió educación superior. 
Es una socia nueva que  recientemente trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con el préstamo solicitado por la suma de S/. 1000.00 soles invertirá en su negocio, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales como: vaca, oveja, chanchos y un burro.  La señora trabaja sola en su negocio.
Su sueño es ser empresaria ganadera y poder tener ganado en cantidades para venderlos.  Lo que le gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the “Virgen de Lujan” community bank, located in the district of Tinicachi, province of Yunguyo, and departament of Puno. She is 37 years old, single, and has 2 children. Adela finished high school. 
 
She is a new member who recently started working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos. With the S/. 1000.00 soles loan she has asked for, she will invest in buying and selling animals, such as: cows, sheep, pigs and a donkey. She works alone at her business. 

Her dream is is be a cattle trader and have large quantities of cattle to sell. What she likes about Manuela Ramos is the facility of the loan.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Virginia Patricia

texts.es: Virginia tiene 51 años, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de costura. Este no es el primer financiamiento que ella ha realizado con Fundación León 2000, pues estos han sido de gran apoyo. Pues ella es una persona muy ejemplar que disfruta su negocio y además que siempre ha trabajado, ella tiene muchos clientes por lo que tiene una diversidad de encargos, por lo que está muy acostumbrada a realizar este tipo de trabajos. Es por este motivo que ella solicita este financiamiento que es destinado para capital de trabajo como agujas, tijeras, hilos, tela, zipper y botones. Su deseo es mantener activo su negocio que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Virginia is 51 years old.  Her work is offering sewing services. 

This is not her first loan from Fundacion Leon 2000 and the previous ones have been of great help. She is an exemplary person who enjoys her work. She has many customers because she offers diversity and is used to doing this kind of work.

She is requesting the loan as working capital to buy needles, scissors, threads, fabrics, zippers and buttons. Her wish is to maintain an active business which is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy needles, scissors, threads, fabrics, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Elenida

texts.en:
Elenida D. is 54 years old, married and has three grown children. She is from the village of Sta. Isabel, Dipolog City. 

Elenida owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 a month.

In 2005, Elenida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living conditions. Elenida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP.

Elenida is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a parcel of land which will be use as residential lot and for their new hog raising business. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a parcel of land 300 sq. meters lot for her residential lot and for her hog raising business

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is a married woman with three children. 

She is a farmer in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 40 years now.  This earns her family PHP 4,000 per month. 

Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers, herbicide and seedlings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicide and seedlings

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel,tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su familia, dos hijos de 5 y 7 años y su esposa, desde pequeño Manuel se dedica a la siembra de maíz, el cual cultiva año a año para sostener a su familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para las plagas, con esta compra iniciara el proceso del cultivo y espera que un buen cuido tenga al final buena cosecha.
Su aspiración es que a través de su trabajo pueda apoyar a sus hijos y evolucionar económicamente junto a ellos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old and lives with his family: his two children aged 5 and 7, and his wife.  Manuel has been growing corn since he was a young boy.  He grows it year after year to support his family.

Manuel is currently requesting a loan to buy manure, fertilizers and pest treatments.  With these purchases, he will start growing his crops.  He hopes that taking care of his crops will provide him with a good harvest.

Manuel's goal is, through his work, to support his children and make financial progress.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and pest treatments.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia está aplicando a su segundo credikiva y está satisfecha porque con el anterior le fue muy bien compró, insumos generó utilidades para pagar obligaciones, compró materiales de construcción para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda y hasta tiene un nuevo televisor. Con su nuevo financiamiento espera comprar hilo fino, porque tiene pedidos de hamacas y mochilas las cuales trabaja en compañía de su madre.
Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores e Kiva: “Se les agradece por sus créditos cómodos y  a un interés bueno, espero seguir prestando y contar con ustedes.” Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Claudia ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/206865
texts.en:
Claudia is applying for her second Kiva loan.  She is satisfied because she did very well with the previous one.  She bought supplies and generated profits to pay her commitments.  She bought building materials to start building her house and she even got a new television set.

She hopes to use the new loan to buy fine yarn because she has pending orders for hammocks and backpacks that she makes with her mother.

She sends the following message to Kiva lenders:  “I’m grateful for your easy loans with good interest rates.  I hope to continue borrowing and to be able to count on you.” 

If you’d like to know Claudia’s story, please click of this link:

http://kiva.org/lend/206865

loans.use: to buy fine yarn in bulk.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 32 years old and married with 2 children. Cristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store like soap, groceries, etc.

Cristina has borrowed and repaid 11 previous loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from apartelle (hostel) rentals.

Cristina aspires to to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, groceries, etc

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco” ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Tahuaco, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y tiene 06 hijos.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales vacunos y ovinos, también dice se dedica a la venta de tejidos.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace diez años.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuatro ovejas para su respectivo engorde por tres meses, comprará también lana de oveja para la fabricación de frazadas y  llicllas (mantas).  Su esposo le ayuda con el negocio y también es agricultor,  vende papas y habas en Yunguyo.
Su sueño es tener más ganados y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Natividad is a member of the San Juan de Tahuaco Communal Bank in the central village of Tahuaco, Yunguyo province, Puno department.  She is 48 years old, married, and has six children.  She does not have an education.

Her first loan was for 300 soles.  She invested the money in her business of selling animals, cows and sheep.  She also says that she sells knitwear.  She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for ten years.

She will use this new loan for 500 soles to buy four sheep to fatten for three months.  She will also buy sheeps’ wool to make blankets and shawls.  Her husband helps her with the business.  He is also a farmer.  He sells potatoes and beans in Yunguyo.

Her dream is to have more livestock so that she can improve her income.

She likes her communal bank’s meetings.

loans.use: to buy four sheep and to buy sheep's wool.

loans.name: Monrovia Group

texts.en:
Hariet, who is in her early 30s, is married and has four children who go to school. 

She has had a fruits and vegetables business for three years now. She works from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the business stock and also to renovate her working place, and she has paid back her loans successfully. 

She wants a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. Her dream is to one day buy land for building a house of her own.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Monrovia," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Serfina

texts.en:
Serfina is married and has three children aged four to fifteen. She has been selling fish for the last five years and employs four people. Serfina finds that the high price of fish, caused by inflation, is pushing people to eat other types of meats. This is a challenge she faces with her business. 

Serfina plans to use her loan to stock more fish. This is her second loan with SMEP. She is a good client who pays her loan well. 

Serfina hopes to use the profits from her business to expand it by supplying fish to different parts of the community. She also hopes to sell fish directly to restaurants. Serfina describes herself as outspoken and social.

loans.use: to stock more fish for her business

loans.name: Hanny Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Hanny, esta conformado por la señora Dolores va a comprar con su prestamo cuadernos, lapices, gomas, sacapuntas, diurex, colores, etc., la señora Silvestra va a comprar dulces por caja, la señora Erika va a comprar brassieres, pantaleta, bikini, la señora Dominga va a comprar sombras, rubores,esmaltes por mayoreo, Atzidi Guadalupe va a comprar bolsas. La señora Dominga tiene 45 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 4 hijos, dos hombre y dos mujeres su hija mas pequeña se llama Liliana tiene 11 años de edad esta estudiando la primaria, ella vende cosmeticos, juguetes, aretes, collares, pulseras y fantasias, su negocio se llama "Cosmeticos Luz Maria" se localiza en el mercado de Tetela del Volcan, ella solicito su prestamo para surtir su negocio va a comprar juguetes, cosmeticos, pulseras, aretes, collares, fantasia, ella inicio su nigocio hace 15 años por necesidades economicas se dio cuenta que estos productos hacian falta en el mercado, su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para cubrir todos los gastos de la familia, ella se siente orgullosa su negocio y de su trabajo le ayudo a solventar los gastos sus estudios de sus hijos mayores quienes ya lograron su carrera profesional, su negocio es popular por el buen precio de los productos y el buen trato a los clientes,las ganancias las utiliza en la comida, ropa, zapatos, gastos generales como la luz el agua, el gas. Sus sueños y esperanzas son ponerle techo de loza a su casa y terminarla para que sus hijos vivan mas comodos y que su hija pequeña siga estudiando y mas adelante tenga su consiga una profesion. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad "gracias por ayudarnos, les aradecemos por facilitarnos estos prestamos y que sigan en su valiosa labor e ayudar a la gente necesitada"
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called Hanny.  It was brought together by Señora Dolores.  With her loan, she will buy notebooks, pencils, erasers, pencil sharpeners, tape, coloring pens, etc.  Señora Silvestra is going to buy boxed sweets, Señora Erika will buy bras, panties, bikinis, Señora  Dominga is going to buy eyeshadow, blush, nail polish at wholesale, Atzidi Guadalupe is going to buy bags. 

Señora Dominga is 45 years old.  She is married, and has 4 children; two sons and two daughters.  Her youngest daughter, named Liliana, is 11 years old and attending primary school.  Señora Dominga sells cosmetics, toys, earrings, necklaces, bracelets and costume jewelry.  Her business is called "Cosmeticos Luz Maria", and it is located in the market or Tetela del Volcan.  She has applied for her loan to stock her business.  She is going to buy toys, cosmetics, bracelets, earrings, necklaces, and costume jewelry.  

She began her business 15 years ago as a result of economic need, she realized that these products were needed in the marketplace.  Her business is important because it provides income to cover all the family expenses.  She is proud of her business and of her work, which helped her cover the expenses of her older children's education, who have already achieved careers.  Her business is popular for the good prices of her products, and good service for her customers.  She uses her earnings for food, clothing, shoes, and general costs such as electricity, water and gas. 

Her hopes and dreams are to put a roof slab on her home and to finish it so her children can live more comfortably, and for her young daughter to continue studying, and later to have a profession. 

The group members want to tell Kiva  and the Fundacion Realidad, "Thank you for helping us.  We are grateful to you for providing these loans to us, and we hope you continue your valuable work and help people in need."

loans.use: to buy toys, cosmetics, bracelets, earrings, necklaces, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is a 33 year old married man with two children.  He lives in a semi permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. His major dream is to educate his children to higher levels of learning.  He is a farmer who grows bananas and maize on a large scale. The major challenge he faces is high labor costs and his dream is to venture into mechanized farming.  Leonard needs the loan to clear land for maize growing.

loans.use: To  clear land for  maize growing .

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 46 years old and lives in Paynesville south. He is married and his wife is a business woman. They have two children who are presently attending school.

For the past three years Daniel has been operating a medicine store in his community where he sells a variety of medicines. He makes a lot of profits, hence he is the only one who is operating a medicine store in his community.

Daniel is requesting a loan to purchase more medicine such as paracetamol and cough syrup for his business. He plans to open a clinic in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine such as paractemol and cough syrup for his business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bananas buying-and-selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of bananas to sell in her business.

Judith has been in this business for 5 years. She also earns an income from raising pigs and buying and selling of coconut shells.

Judith has been able to sustain her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to purchase a delivery truck in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of bananas to sell

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Alex; el tiene 22 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de árboles frutales, el socio vende arboles a diferentes personas que tienen terrenos de cultivo y también vende arboles pequeños para adornos, el socio vende en forma independiente, el socio qui9ere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de arboles. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar árboles frutales y arboles pequeños.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Tres de Mayo de Poroy Communal Bank, located in the Cusco district in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

Alex is 22 years old and single.  He alternates his daily activities with his business selling fruit trees.  He sells trees to different people who have croplands, and he also sells small trees for decoration.  Alex is self-employed.  He wants to expand and improve his business selling trees.

Alex is requesting the loan to buy fruit trees and small trees.

He is happy about the loan and is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to buy fruit trees and small trees.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed.
 
Romana has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Romana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 51 years old and married. She has a stall to bake and sell snacks like rice cakes in her village. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional improvised oven for baking and ingredients to make rice cakes. Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients of bebengka or rice cakes, and additional improvised oven for more orders.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 27 years old. He is married and is a father of one child. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last seven years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for mixed farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET LTD staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to use to buy wheat seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. 

He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy or build rental premises. He is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a resident farmer in Kitale. She is aged 49 and has been in farming for 10 years, producing and selling eggs and vegetables to the local market. She is married with 5 children. The last three are still in school. She runs a retail business in the local market dealing with milk, eggs and vegetables sourced both from her farm and from other farmers locally.

Eunice has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. The loan will help her to construct a dairy unit at 20,000 KES and a greenhouse at 40,000 KES. She hopes these two developments will expand her farming income and make her family financially stable.

She mentions the network of poor roads, high cost of farming inputs and lack of finance as the major challenges for farmers.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse and a dairy unit

loans.name: Norienza

texts.en:
Norienza is 43 years old and lives in Calalinan, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married and has three school age children.

To earn a living, Norienza has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 to purchase ingredients for her snacks vending business.

Norienza has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 7 months. In the future, Norienza would like to finance her children's studying.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for snack vending business.

loans.name: Koisun

texts.ru: Койсун 45 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей, младшей из которых шесть лет. Койсун работает продавщицей в местном магазине, а также подрабатывает санитаркой в больнице, получая примерно 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В 1996 году, в поисках средств к существованию для своей семьи, Койсун начала свой бизнес в разведении скота и перепродаже сельхоз продукции. Койсун использовала стартовую сумму в 5,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, и сумела развить свое хозяйство, с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме около 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Койсун обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей. В ближайшее время, при помощи доходов от кредита, Койсун планирует увеличивать поголовье  скота.
texts.en: Koisun is 45 years old, married and has four children, the youngest of whom is six years old.  Koisun works as a salesperson at a local store and also works part-time as an orderly at a hospital, earning about 5,000 som (KGS) per month.  In search of means of survival for her family, she started her own business of breeding livestock and reselling agricultural crops in 1996.  Koisun used an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock and was able to grow her business to have a monthly profit of about 5,000 som (KGS) now.  In order to further develop her business, Koisun requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase heifers.  In the near future, she plans to increase livestock headcount with the help of the profit from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children. 
Girlie has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Girlie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Girlie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Marysa

texts.en:
Marysa is married and has two children.  She is 39 years old and lives in Cabulihan, Larena, Siquijor.

Marysa is a farmer and has a backyard piggery to earn a living.  She has been doing this for four years.  She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase medicine and feed for her business.

Marysa has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine and feed for her piggery business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Josefina es  una señora trabajadora  que se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes desde hace tres años.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Noé con quien tienen  dos hijos una mujer y  un varón, quienes le ayudan a atender su tienda  cuando ella está haciendo la comida.
Tambien se dedica a la venta de refacciones para dicicletas y tisiclos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la comprar de mas mercancía de abarrotes como es : aceite,cebolla,azúcar,pan,leche,galletas y detergente.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla ya que gracias a su apoyo su tienda va creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking woman who has been selling groceries for 3 years.

She is happily married to Noé, and together they have 2 children, a girl and a boy.  They help her to tend to her store when she is making meals. In addition, she has a business selling spare parts for bicycles and 3-wheeled bikes.

She requests a loan to buy more merchandise for her store, such as: cooking oil, onions, sugar, bread, milk, cookies and detergent.  

Josefina thanks the Fundacion for helping her, because thanks to their support her store has been gradually growing.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to sell

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 45 years old and married with four children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Bernadette is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Bernadette has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming rice for the fast 19 years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.en:
Rosa Maria is married and has three small children. Her husband works in a company but his salary is very low and they face many difficulties in covering all of the costs for their childrens\' education, which is why some time ago she started making chorizo sausage to sell to her neighbours. With time Rosa Maria has been able to acquire more steady clients, now she has weekly orders.

She now requires a loan of $200 to be able to increase her roster of clientele by purchasing more ingredients for to make her product. With the great support of her family she has been able to reach her objective. You only need to decide and she and her family will forever thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa María es casada y tiene tres hijos pequeños, su esposo trabaja en una empresa, pero su sueldo es muy bajo y presentan muchas dificultades para cubrir con los gastos de la educación de los niños, es por ello que hace algún tiempo ella comenzó a elaborar chorizo para luego venderlo a sus vecinos. Con el tiempo Rosa María ha logrado conseguir clientes fijos y seguros, ahora ya tiene pedidos semanales.

Ella ahora requiere de un préstamo de $ 200 dólares para poder incrementar su cartera de clientes, comprando más insumos para la elaboración de su producto. Con el gran apoyo de su familia ella ha logrado su objetivo, pero tu también puedes apoyarla, solo tienes que decidirte, ella y su familia te lo van a agradecer siempre.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
This a very kind woman was born in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She is married and has 4 children.
25 years ago she decided to start her own business.
She believes that this business will help her to overcome difficulties and improve her incomes.
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Korng

texts.en:
Mrs. Korng S. P., is 31 years old, is a mother of 1 child, and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She runs a souvenir store which normally generates about $10/day in revenue, while her husband is an air conditioner-repairman and typically makes around $3/day from his service.
In order to increase her inventory, S. P. is asking for $800 to purchase more souvenir products to meet the demands of her clients. In the future, S. P. is thinking about being able to expand her store with a larger inventory.

loans.use: To purchase some souvenir products to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Taikerise

texts.en: Ms Taikerise is married with four children. She just joined the SPBD program this year and hopes to get her 1st loan of $750 to start up her pancakes business. She says that it will a big improvement for her family's financial support and her children’s education. She hopes  to pay off this first loan early and to get another loan to buy things for her business and also to pay her children’s school fees. She likes the program's support and hopes to stay in it for a long time.

loans.use: Start up a pancake business

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
Nazokat V. is a happy mother of 3 children. Nazokat is married and has a college degree. Nazokat’s husband works at a collective farm and her children attend school. After school, the kids help Nazokat to take care of the animals at the farm. Nazokat has been breading cattle since she was little. In 2006, she received a MicroInvest loan to increase livestock. Nazokat used the money to purchase a few animals and a supply of animal food. In the future, Nazokat plans to continue the expansion and purchase more cattle.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Вахобова Назокат счастливая мать троих детей. Замужем, образование высшее. Муж работает в колхозе, дети учатся в школе, и после школы они помогают матери, то есть присматривают за скотами. Занимается животноводством с малых лет. В 2006году она получила займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест», для увеличения поголовья скота. После получения займа и целевого использования она приобрела несколько видов крупнорогатого скота, запасалась кормом для скота. В дальнейшем планирует приобрести и другие виды скота.

loans.use: To increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter is 34 years old and married. He works as a mason and his wife works as a maid. Walter lives with his wife and three children in their own house. He has a lot of experience working in construction and, because of the fine work he does, he never lacks for jobs. Currently the demand in construction is very high, due to a shortage of labor. Walter is currently working outside of the city. He never lacks for jobs because he has many acquaintances who are familiar with his work. He will build a bathroom in his house, which will make his family more comfortable. He only has credit in Agrocapital. He doesn’t have loans with other institutions, nor guarantees.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

WALTER ES UN SEÑOR CASADO DE 34 AÑOS DE EDAD, SE DEDICA A PRESTAR SUS SERVICIOS COMO MAESTRO ALBAÑIL CONTRATISTA Y SU ESPOSA TRABAJA COMO EMPLEADA DOMESTICA. WALTER VIVE CON SU ESPOSA Y SUS TRES HIJOS EN SU CASA PROPIA. EL CLIENTE TIENE MUCHA EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO DE LA CONSTRUCCION Y POR SU TRABAJO FINO ES QUE NO LE FALTAN OBRAS. ACTUALMENTE LA DEMANDA EN EL RUBRO DE LA CONSTRUCCION SE A ELEVADO BASTANTE DEBIDO A LA FALTA DE MANO DE OBRA, WALTER ESTA CON TRABAJO ACTUALMENTE FUERA DE LA CIUDAD, NO LE FALTA YA QUE CUENTA CON BASTANTES CONOCIDOS QUE SABEN DE SU TRABAJO. EL CLIENTE CONSTRUIRA UN BAÑO EN SU VIVIENDA,CON LO CUAL DARA MAYOR COMODIDAD A SU FAMILIA. EL CLIENTE SOLO TIENE CREDITO EN AGROCAPITAL,NO TIENE MAS CREDITOS EN OTRAS INSTITUCIONES, NI OTRAS GARANTIAS.

loans.use: To improve his house by building a bathroom

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva is part of the communal bank called Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas. She lives in the district of Calleria, in Ucayali. She is 53 years old and has 6 children, all of whom are grown up and working, and appreciate very much the sacrifice their mother maD. for them. Her husband is a shop assistant, but his salary is not enough to cover the costs of the house. With the first loan, Genoveva invested in a business selling clothing and food.

She sells clothing door to door, and in the evenings she prepares and sells food such as roasted chicken, rice dishes and snacks which her neighbors love and wait for every day. Genoveva gets up very early each day to go sell her clothing and still have time to prepare her meals in the afternoon.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy chickens, rice and potatoes, as well make some minor repairs to her kitchen. Genoveva tell us that things are going very well. Her business has grown and she has maD. new friends through the communal bank. She feels good about herself.

La señora Genoveva pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas, vive en el Jr Urubamba 650, del distrito Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 53 años D. edad y es madre D. 6 hijos, todos profesionales y muy agradecidos con ella por todo el sacrificio que hizo por ellos y que nunca olvidaran. Su esposo es trabajador dependiente, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Genoveva, con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) deciD. invertir en la compra - venta D. ropa y venta D. comidas. En la actualidad ella venD. ropa a domicilio y se dedica a la venta D. comida por la noches, prepara salchipapas, pollo broaster, arroz chaufa (comida rápida) que son las delicias D. sus vecinos y que todos los días esperan con ansias que Genoveva salga a vender para poder degustar tan ricos platos. Se levanta muy temprano todos los días para ir a vender sus prendas a sus clientas y en la tarD. preparar los alimentos que venD.. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,500, (US$ 502.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará D. 6 pollos, 5 kilos D. arroz y 15 kilos D. papa, además dará mantenimiento a su cocina. Genoveva, nos dijo que le va muy bien, su negocio ha crecido y gracias a Manuela Ramos hizo mas amistades y se siente bien consigo misma.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CHICKEN, RICE AND POTATOES TO PREPARE THE MEALS SHE SELLS, AS WELL AS MAKE SOME MINOR REPAIRS TO HER KITCHEN.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda's Internet cafe is the most popular in the area. She decided to invest her savings in this business. In the beginning, it didn't look as though it would be very profitable, since lots of competition exists right in her area. Fortunately, the good, quick service that Hilda provides has allowed her to win a large number of clients in a very short time. Hilda feels a special affection for her business because her earnings allow her to provide well-being and most importantly, an education to her two youngest children. This resolute and cheerful mother's wish is to perform appropriate maintenance on her computers. With this purpose in mind, she turns to your generous heart and requests the loan that will allow her to fulfill her wish. Let's make Hilda's request a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Las cabinas de Internet de la señora Hilda, son las más concurridas de su zona. Ella decidió invertir el ahorro que tenia en esta actividad, en un principio no parecía ser muy rentable porque en esa zona existía mucha competencia, afortunadamente el buen y rápido servicio que brinda le ha permitido captar en muy corto tiempo gran cantidad de clientes. Por este su negocio doña Hilda siente un cariño especial, debido a que con sus ganancias le permite brindar a sus dos hijos menores bienestar y sobre todo educación. El deseo de esta empeñosa y alegre madre es darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus computadoras, con ese propósito recurre a tu generoso corazón y hace la solicitud de un préstamo para llevar a cabo su deseo. Hagamos realidad la petición de Hilda.

loans.use: Perform maintenance on her computers in order to improve her services

loans.name: Sren

texts.en: Mrs. Sren K. L., 29, with her husband Mr. Sary, 33, are door-to-door sales people selling spoons, plates, chopsticks and so on, typically making on average about $9 in profit a day. They have two children to look after. To expand this business, both are requesting a loan to purchase more plates to sell from door to door. Having a loan is great because it gives them a better life and they can send their child to university in the future.

loans.use: purchase more plates to sell from door to door

loans.name: Sorie O.k.

texts.en: Mr. T. is a Headmaster and has been working in Education for 35 years.  He is 53-years old and is married with five children, two of which are married.  With 35 years earning a teaching salary, Sorie could not purchase or build a house for the family.  He has bought a plot to build the family house, but cannot do so as the government needs him to get a house plan and legalize the land by April.  He is requesting a loan of $350  to process the land title, develop a house plan, and purchase one-dozen zinc sheets.  He will repay the loan from his monthly salary.

loans.use: For additional funding to begin building a family home

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is 63 years old and works and lives in southern Lebanon, in the town of Saida. Youssef is a farmer, and has applied for his second loan from A. Majmoua. He will use the loan to buy the supplies he needs to maintain and improve his farm.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farm

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina was able to open up a small store 3 years ago with the help of her husband's income who is a teacher at a local school. She has been able to take care of her store ever since by making sure everthing runs smoothly.

Due to the problems the country is currently dealing with, in terms of education, she would also like to offer a wide variety of other products. She would like to sell good quality products which a lot of times are not accessible in her community unless you go to nearby cities. She hopes to make a profit by offering a wider range of products.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Saturnina, gracias al ingreso de su esposo quien se desempeña como docente en un centro educativo pudo establecer una pequeña bodega y ya lleva más de 3 años dedicada a la atención y administración de su espacio de desarrollo.Debido a los problemas que están afectando al sector educativo de su país ha pensado llenar su bodega con una gran diversidad de productos, para poder no solo obtener ingresos sino dar la posibilidad de ofrecer a sus clientes productos de calidad y de difícil acceso por el alejamiento que tiene su comunidad a las ciudades más cercanas.

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence M. sells slippers and other provisions. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Florence and her four children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more slippers and other provisions to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel lives on “P” Street in the Belen zone of the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and three children. He dedicates himself to making lined jackets and sweaters, particularly for the cold, which he sells in the city of Oruro. The loan would be for the purchase of fabric at wholesale, the lower price helping him to improve his income. This is his first loan through IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted indicates he qualifies to receive the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Daniel vive en la calle “P” de la zona Belen de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos. Se dedica a la confección de chamarras y chalecos de tela con frisa, especiales para el frío, los cuales los vende en la ciudad de Oruro. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de telas por mayor, pues los costos disminuyen y así Daniel puede mejorar sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase fabric at wholesale for his business making special jackets and sweaters for the cold.

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Mrs. Man K. lives in Trav Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetables. Mrs. Man K. is a 56-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the other is living at home. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Man K. wants her second child to start a motorbike taxi business. She decided to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike to help reach this goal. Last year, one of her children got typhoid and Mrs. Man K. faced unforeseen expenses. This is the reason why Mrs. Man K. does not have enough money to buy a new motorbike for her child's business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to start a motorbike taxi business.

loans.name: Saiyod

texts.en:
F. Saiyod is 30 years old. He is married with 3 children. Saiyod is an optimistic, hardworking father. He works in his vineyard with love and dedication every day so that it produces excellent fruit.

Saiyod has been in agribusiness for more than 6 years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. Though growing grapes is a very difficult and a time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix the house and save enough money to pay for his kids at school. With this purpose he is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) which he has committed to repay within 9 months. With the desire to realize his plan, Saiyod appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

loans.use: Purchasing of the mineral fertilizer and paying labour power for growing vineyard

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es: Oswaldo es un hombre de avanzada edad, a pesar de sus años, tiene la responsabilidad de  educar a sus hijos, sobre todo de solventar los gastos de primera necesidad en su hogar, ya que tiene una familia  numerosa.  Por ello trabaja arduamente en la  producción de sus terrenos,  en el cuidado sus productos agrícolas, y por ello que es muy conocido por su comunidad, por el empeño que le pone a su trabajo, lo cual lo caracteriza como uno de los hombres más responsables de la zona.  Sin embargo, necesita comprar una mochila fumigadora, que le ayude a cuidar sus productos agrícolas y obtener en la cosecha productos de buena calidad, en comparación con la competencia.Espera la ayudar necesaria para adquirir esta mochila fumigadora y así tener mayores cuidados con sus productos, evitando que sean perjudicados por las plagas.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is an older man, but despite his age he is responsible for his kids' education, and more than anything for all the household costs as he has a large family. This is why he works very hard in the field and in looking after his agricultural produce, and he is well known for this in his community - for the work that he puts into his job, and this is what characterizes him as one of the most responsible men in his area. However, he needs to buy a fumigating backpack which will help him to look after his agricultural products and to get good quality products from the harvest in comparison with the competition. He awaits the necessary help to get this fumigating backpack and thereby better look after his produce, avoiding them being damaged by pests.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a fumigating backpack to fight against the pests that threaten his produce/Compra de una mochila fumigadora para luchar contra las plagas que amenazan sus cultivos.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Mr. Rin C. is a villager in Angk Chey Village in Kampong Cham Province. He owns a small piece of land where he cultivates both rice and cassavas. His wife, Mrs. Phal Sdoeng, is a pig breeder. She faces an obstacle in her business because she does not have enough money to support and continue her breeding. Thus, Mr. Rin C. decided to request a loan to buy pig feed and to build a pig pen. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. He is 26 years old and the father of a young child. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and build a pig pen.

loans.name: Diéba

texts.fr: Diéba D., mariée et mère de 06 enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Plateau 2 depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut  renforcer ses activités de ventes de tissus teintés (imprimé et en couleur unique). Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Married and having six children to look after, Diéba D. has been a member of the village loan group Plateau 2 for a year and a half. She wants to bolster her business selling dyed fabrics (printed or monochromatic). The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in dyed fabrics

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Married with two children, Grace E. is 38 years old. She sells maize and other grains. She travels to Techieman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana to buy maize, which she resells at home. She started this grocery three years ago with a small amount of working capital, but through commitment and hard work Grace can now boast of a growing business, for which she gives credit to God. These profits are a wonderful resource for her family.

She would use this loan to stockpile maize so that she can serve her customers throughout the season. Buying now to freeze the price is especially important in the face of inflationary pressures due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes the loan will help her upgrade her business. 

She belongs to a trust group called "Obotantim," meaning rock. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and thus support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans to restock a grocery shop.

loans.name: Tushikamane Kongwe Group

texts.en:
Saluma M., age 36, is married with one child of 19 years. She owns a cosmetics shop which she started in 2004 and works daily from 8am until 8pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $73. 

This will be Saluma’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first two loans to open a shop.  She used to sell her products from door to door and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to open yet another shop.

Saluma will share this loan with subgroup B of the Tushirikiane Komgwa group. The subgroup has 7 members, who run different types of shops, some sell charcoal, some are tailors. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Saluma is 1st on the left.

loans.use: Open another shop for clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Don Juan tiene 55 años de edad, reside en un bario en la capital de Managua que se llama Mirna Ugarte, junto a su familia, sus niñas cursan la secundaria, durante estos años ha laborado en diferentes expresas como fontanero, de mensajero lo cual han sido de mucha experiencia en su vida personal, en estos momentos se desempeña en vigilante tiene diez años pero sus ingresos son bajos es por eso espera encontrar un trabajo mejor para tener mejores beneficios, con esta solicitud de crédito la quiere para invertir en materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo del porche de su casa que esta en mal estado y desea en este invierno poder tener su casa en buen estado para gozar junto con su familia los logros.
texts.en:
Juan is 55 years old and lives in a Managua neighborhood called Mirna Ugarte with his family. His daughters attend secondary school. In recent years, he has worked as a plumber and messenger, which has been a great experience in his personal life. He has worked as a guard for ten years, but his income is low, so he is seeking a better job that will bring better benefits. He will invest this loan in construction materials to repair the porch roof on his house which is in poor condition. He hopes to have his house in good condition this winter to enjoy his achievements with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to repair porch roof

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.ru:
Лутфулло  Шарипов 1973 года рождения, он женат и имеет троих детей. Он сотрудничает с Микроинвест с 2007 года. Занимается разведением скота более десяти лет. Дома содержит несколько голов кота. На полученный кредит приобрел корм и скот. В  свободное время сажает овощи и деревья с фруктами.
О кредите узнал у своего  друга, условия понравились ему и он получил кредит. Планирует увеличить поголовье скота за счет дальнейшего кредитования и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Lutfullo S. was born in 1973, he is married and has three children. He has been a client with MicroInvest since 2007. He raises cattle for more than ten years. He has several heads of cattle at home. He will use the loan to buy fodder and cattle. In his spare time he sows vegetables and plants fruit trees.

Lutfullo found out about the loan program from his friend. He liked the terms and took out a loan. He plans to increase the head count of his livestock by continuing to use loans and expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle and fodder

loans.name: Ranohol

texts.ru: Кенджаева РАънохол проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 47 лет , замужем и имеет четверых детей. занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке района. Торгует овощами и фруктами. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ranohol K. lives in the Shahrinau region. She is 47 years old, married and has four children. She is in the retail business and has a vendor space on the central market of the region. She sells fruits and vegetables. She plans to use the loan to increase turnover of her produce.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnaround of goods

loans.name: Mary Najjemba  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 46 years of age, married, and the mother of seven children aged between 13 and 25 years. Five of her children go to school. She owns a two-roomed house where she lives with eight people but doesn’t take care of additional family members. She doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Mary sells fried samosas (fried, stuffed pastry), mandazi (East African donuts) and chapattis (flat pancake-like bread cooked on a griddle) in Kawempe market, in one of the city suburbs and that is how she earns a living. She buys wheat flour from the very market she operates from and so doesn’t incur any extra transportation costs. She receives about 35 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. She has run this business for eight years now.

Mary is faced with a challenge due to the increase in the price of wheat flour, sugar, cowpeas and cooking oil. Yet she can’t increase the prices of her product so she deals with this challenge by reducing the size of her product so as to remain in business.

This is Mary’s 16th loan since she joined MCDT and she has been with MCDT for eight years, working all this time with the same group of co-workers.

Mary wants to use this loan to buy more stock for her business. She hopes to start a bakery business.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, sugar and cowpeas for her business

loans.name: Ibirogba

texts.en: Ibirogba is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She sells foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount of 70, 000 naira ($500 US) to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She promises to pay back her loan promptly and she says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Kazija

texts.en:
Kazija has owned a small shop in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to Tushikamane  group loan (Group code 2002).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $50. She works 8 hours every day at her business.   


She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more items to add her current stock and expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Kazija is 49 years old, and she is married.

loans.use: To buy more items to add her current stock

loans.name: Las Autenticas Group

texts.es: El grupo denominado  “Las Autenticas” esta conformado por trece señoras que en su mayoría radican en la zona Elizardo Pérez D. la ciudad D. El Alto, la directiva esta conformada por la señora Juana,  Irene y Maruja que son presidenta , tesorera y secretaria del grupo. Los componentes del grupo en su mayoría se dedican a la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo, víveres, madera y ropa. El mercado D. oferta D. productos es altamente competitivo pera las socias saben como salir adelante ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercaderías, materiales e insumos que ayuden a incrementar sus ingresos y a mejorar la calida D. vida D. sus familias.  Este grupo esta emprendiendo su tercer ciclo demostrando ser un grupo responsable, unido y con ganas D. crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Las Autenticas" group (the Authentics) is maD. up of 13 women who mostly live in the Elizardo Pérez area of the city of El Alto. The directors are Juana, Irene and Maruja who are president, treasurer and secretary of the group. Most of the members of the group sell cosmetics by catalogue, food, wood, and clothing. The market for these products is extremely competitive, but the members know how to be successful, because supporting their families depends on it. This loan is for the purchase of merchandise, materials, and ingredients that will help increase their incomes and improve their families' quality of life. This is the third loan for this group and they have shown themselves to be responsible, united and full of desire to grow and be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Mhllhau Group

texts.en: Mhllhau is the group leader of Mhllhau group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for her business. Mhllhau wants to take a loan for the business of carpet weaving. Seemae Gul wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Shkallah wants to take a loan for her husband who has a fruit and vegetable shop. So they are requesting a group of loan 44100 Afghani. They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For expanding her business

loans.name: Fuente De Vida (Fountain Of Life) Group

texts.es: En el Centro  Focal “Panamericana” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Fuente de vida”  con  aproximadamente 9 años de vida y tiene 10 integrantes, en su mayoría se dedican al tejido de chompas (con máquina o  a mano) y en esta época de invierno les va bastante bien porque tienen demanda y necesitan del préstamo para la compra de lana y en algunos casos comprar maquinaría, otras se dedican a la venta de verduras, y también necesitan el préstamo para la comprar mercadería  como cebolla, zanahoria, zapallo y nabo.
texts.en:
In the "Panamericana" Community Center you will find the "Fuente de vida" (Fountain of Life) Communal Assocation, which has been established for approximately 9 years. The association has 10 members, the majority of whom make a living knitting jackets (with machines or by hand). This wintertime, things are going well enough for them because there is demand for their products, so they need a loan in order to buy more wool and in some cases to buy machinery. Other group members make a living selling vegetables, and they also need a loan in order to buy their merchandise such as onions, carrots, pumpkins, and turnips.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials, Merchandise, and Supplies

loans.name: Kemea

texts.fr:
Cette femme a emboîté le pas de sa mère en exerçant dans la restauration, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1999, elle sert spécialement des plats togolais, beaucoup de monde vient déjeuner chez  elle, elle exerce à proximité d’un bar ce qui lui permet de bénéficier de la clientèle du bar. Son stock de produits nécessaires à la restauration est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite donc un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des vivres et divers condiments pour son activité de restauration.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants
texts.en:
This is a woman who has followed in her mother's footsteps operating a restaurant business. She has been in this business since 1999, and she especially serves Togolese dishes. Many people come to her for lunch. She operates near a bar, which allows her to benefit from its customers. Her stock of the necessary ingredients is exhausted. She wants to stock up again and is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES to buy provisions and various condiments for her food service business. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying necessary ingredients for food catering

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is sixty years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children, six sons and two daughters. Some of her children are still in school while others are learning trades. Akua works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a family house in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in all kinds of foot wears for ladies. Akua buys her goods from Kumasi and sells at the local market. She also hawks and treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foot wears

loans.name: Moacyr

texts.es: Moacyr tiene 35 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos por quienes trata de trabajar arduamente para brindarles las mejores condiciones de vida. Desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar en varias actividades, ya que su familia no tuvo las posibilidades económicas para brindarle estudios superiores. Sin embargo, aprendió a manejar y esa fue la forma que usó para ganar dinero y solventar sus gastos, pero no le desagrada su trabajo, al contrario, por eso brinda sus servicios con mucho humor. Gracias a este esfuerzo logró ahorrar y adquirir su propio motocarro, con el cual realiza transporte de pasajeros. Esta actividad la viene realizando formalmente desde hace 8 años y desde entonces se levanta muy temprano, pues considera que la mayor demanda es por las mañanas, cuando todas las personas salen rumbo a sus trabajos y estudios. Los 29 préstamos que tiene Moacyr en Microfinanzas PRISMA son reflejo del trabajo y esmero que muestra como miembro del banco comunal donde trabaja en base a la responsabilidad. Los 1000 soles que ahora solicita le permitirán reparar su motocarro, el cual requiere de un mantenimiento general para evitar perdidas con el tiempo.
texts.en:
Moacyr is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children for whom he works arduously in order to provide them with a better quality of life. Since he was very young he learned to work on various activities, because his family did not have the economic resources to provide him with a superior education. Nevertheless, he learned to drive and this was the manner in which he earned money and covered his expenses. He doesn't dislike working, on the contrary, he enjoys his work and because of this he is able to provide his services with good humor.

Thanks to his efforts he succeeded in saving and acquiring his own motorcar (light 3-wheeled vehicle), with which he is able to transport passengers. He has been doing this activity formally for 8 years. He rises early, considering that the majority of demand is for the mornings when people are leaving for work or school. The 29 loans that Moacyr has had from Microfinanzas PRISMA are reflected in the work and care that he demonstrates as a member of a communal bank where work forms the basis of responsibility. The 1000 soles that he now requests will permit him to repair his motorcar, which requires general maintenance to avoid losses over time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintenance of his motorcar

loans.name: Soung

texts.en: Soung S., 59, is a widow living in Phnom Penh with her two children. Since 2007, she has been selling groceries to earn a living and is able to make about $7 US every day. One of her children, who works as a construction worker, helps support her. Soung is asking for a loan of$1000 to expand her grocery stand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery stand.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
45-year-old Teodora C. has a fishing business in Danao, Panglao. She has six children and the eldest is 27 years old. She needs additional capital to sustain her business.

Teodora joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. requesting a loan of Php 7,000 to buy materials for her fishing business. This will help her a lot to rise from her difficulties in living.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es: María Josefa S. G. originaria de Tacuba del departamento de Ahuachapán, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando. María instalo su negocio una tienda con productos de consumo aprovechando de la oportunidad que a los alrededores de su domicilio no cuenta con ninguna competencia, el negocio de María es muy conocido en Tacuba, son ocho años de experiencia que María posee en la administración de su negocio. El crédito que solicita está destinado para surtir su negocio con nueva mercadería.
texts.en:
María Josefa S. G. is a native of Tacuba, which is in the department of Ahuachapán. She lives with her husband and their three school-aged children. María established a store where she sells consumer products. She took advantage of this opportunity because there are no competing stores near her home. Her business is well-known in Tacuba and she has been managing it for eight years. María will use the loan she requested to restock her store with new merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business with new merchandise

loans.name: Chhun's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan that has been requested by two low-income people. The group’s leader, Mrs. Chhun K., age 41, is a local vegetable grower. As another source of family income, Chhun K.’s husband works as a vehicle trader. He also goes to buy vehicles from people who live in rural areas and sells to other people to gain a profit. He typically earns an average of $5 per day.

Chhun K. currently faces difficulty with irrigating her crop because her farm is located far from the water system. Therefore, she would like to ask for a loan to buy a water pump.

The other borrower is Mrs. S., a farmer, who is asking for a loan to support her farming business.

loans.use: To buy a pump for irrigation

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 22 year old single man. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2006 to provide, along with his brothers, better living conditions for the family. Today, Hassan is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy the rented car he has been driving to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy the rented car he has been driving for his taxi business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan, a 27-year-old single man, works as a farmer where he produces dairy products for sales. He has been involved in this field since 2006. Today, Hasan is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase fertilizers and seeding for his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeding

loans.name: Najjembe Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Teddy is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a widow with six children; three of them are at the University and three have completed their studies and have their own families.

Teddy has a restaurant in Najjembe that she has been running for a long time. She has been able to win many clients because of her experienced cooking and good customer care. Her customers are mostly the traders in the Najjembe market and truck drivers who rest in the area. Teddy usually buys her foodstuffs in large quantities at a less cost, and she wants to stock more foodstuffs for her restaurants.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs to increase her stock

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro G. de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil su casa es de cemento cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa trabaja como comerciante con ella tiene 5 hijos todos están estudiando en escuelas fiscales.

Pedro comenzó ahorrando dinero para  poner una tienda en su casa, en poco tiempo empezó vendiendo víveres poco a poco pudo surtir más el negocio. Ahora trabaja en conjunto con su esposa vendiendo arroz, aceites, legumbres etc. Una de las mayores complicaciones es la delincuencia de su sector.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite, pollos, legumbres para poder agrandar la tienda, en el futuro quiere poner sucursales de su tienda para poder asegurar el futuro de sus 5 hijos.
texts.en:
Pedro G., 43, lives in the periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil. His concrete house has all the basic services. His wife works as a merchant and they have children who are all enrolled in public school. Pedro started to save money in order to establish a grocery store in his home. He soon began selling food items and bit by bit was able to increase the variety of his stock items. Now, he works with his wife selling rice, cooking oils, vegetables, etc. One of the biggest obstacles for them is the high level of delinquency in their area. With this loan he will buy rice, cooking oil, chickens, vegetables to enlarge his stock. In the future, he would like to open additional branches of his store in order to insure the future of his 5 children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, chicken, cooking oil.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 33 years old and is married with four children, with ages between 3 and 13. She and her family live in Rubavu, in the Western Province of Rwanda, where she sells milk.

This is Odette’s tenth successful year in her business. She employs four people in the business and the hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day.

Odette, after finding herself unable to satisfy the demands of her customers, decided she needed to request a Kiva loan. The loan will allow her to satisfy the demands of her customers as well as allowing her to purchase some new equipment which will be in use during the time she will be selling milk to her customers.

With this loan, Odette’s business will keep growing. She hopes to earn enough profits to help her to pay school fees, to renovate her house and beside that, with the remaining portion of her profits, to reinvest in her business so that her future business will be stable.

Odette has a plan to buy her own house through the profits she earns from her business.

loans.use: To buy a big quantity of milk to sell

loans.name: Victoria Group 5, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Flista is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a widow with eleven children and ten dependents.

Flista has a business selling matooke (green plantain) in Kiyindi. She says that her challenge is that at times the matooke is too expensive hence reducing the number of customers, leading to some of her food ripening.

Flista has been in the business for seventeen years and she has been able to introduce the sale of charcoal to her business, hence increasing her income. She hopes to expand her business further as well as educating all her children.

Flista needs a loan to help with purchasing more matooke and charcoal for business sustainability.

loans.use: To buy more matooke and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose D. is married and has one child. She has received a junior high education.  Rose sells both body and hair creams at Abura, which she has been doing for some time now. Her husband is a plumber.  Rose uses her income to help her husband with the general upkeep of the house.  Rose will use the loan to purchase more creams, pomade and a few other cosmetics for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to build a shop where she will be stocking her goods to protect them from our harsh weather conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more creams, pomade and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Joanna Marie's Group

texts.en:
Joanna Marie D. is from the village of Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is the leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Joanna Marie is 22 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes from selling bread in the local community. Joanna Marie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Joanna Marie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's daily needs.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her bakery

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie H. is from the village of Lawis Panalsalan. She is 28 years old. Melanie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Melanie owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Melanie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Melanie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme est une femme qui est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de LOMNAVA qui est un quartier périphérique de ville de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, plus tard elle a associée à son activité le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle fait face en une diminution de son stock, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  divers pagnes de qualité Wax et hi Target et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This is a married woman who is the mother of two children. She lives with her family in the Lomnava district on the outskirts of the town of Lomé. Her business is selling “pagnes” (traditional fabrics for food clothing). She later added selling groceries to her business. Her stock is being depleted. She would like to restock her goods, which is why she is seeking a WAGES credit to purchase different high-quality was and Hi-Target pagnes as well as various grocery products.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing "pagnes" fabrics and grocery products (for resale)

loans.name: Marta María

texts.es: Marta María R. H. de 34 años de edad, reside en Pasaquina, ubicado en el departamento de La Unión. Marta es una mujer muy fuerte y trabajadora quien vela por el bienestar de su familia día y noche, ya que su esposo reside en Los Estados Unidos, razón por la que ella sola se encarga de sus dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Marta posee un comedor en el cual se dedica a la venta de desayunos y almuerzos, el cual esta ubicado frente a la Alcaldía de Pasaquina, lugar el cual cuenta con una gran afluencia de personas, lo que beneficia a Marta en gran manera. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos, tales como: verduras, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, frutas y otros más, todo con el enorme deseo de aumentar sus ventas y de esta manera brindarle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta María R. H. is 34 years old. She lives in Pasaquina, which is located in the La Unión department. Marta is a very strong woman. She is a hard-working person who watches out for her family’s well-being day and night. Her husband lives in the United States, which is the reason she is raising her two minor children alone. Her children go to school. Marta has a restaurant, and she sells breakfasts and lunches. It is located in front of the mayor’s office in Pasaquina. There are a lot of people there, and that is of great benefit to Martha. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy a larger quantity of raw material to make the food. She will buy things like vegetables, rice, beans, sugar, fruit, and other things. She does all of this with a great desire to increase her sales. This way she will give her children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sweets to sell in her grocery store
